story:
My name is Jason Sani and I am the author of Making Healthy Taste Good. My life is all about delicious food, I've been studying nutrition for more than 12 years and I want to share my methods with you in an organized and easy to follow format. 

My experience and knowledge comes from working with clients for the last 10 years. This includes overcoming challenges such as picky eaters, eating on the go, fat-loss, menu design, and food prep. 

 

What makes Making Healthy Taste Good unique?

Do-ability factor! At the end of the day, a recipe needs to be easy to follow, so I've made sure that everything is simple.This book is an adventure guide with descriptive pictures of recipes that you will actually put together with tools that you actually have. These recipes have been tested and approved by kids and big kids just like yourself. You'll find methods such as using tea to cook with, how you can use a tasty waffle or ice cream to deliver the nutrients that your body is hungry for. 

 

Making Healthy Taste Good will teach you:

  • How to create a sustainable method to eating in a delicious and healthy style
  • How to save time and manage stress when it comes to food choices
  • How to stop dieting for good and get on the path to real, lasting weight control
  • How to stop relying on willpower so that health and energy comes automatically
  • How to stock your kitchen with the basics that you need to stay healthy
  • How to create an environment that improves your social environment  
  • How to retrain your taste-buds into cravings nutrient-dense, sugar-free, and gluten-free foods

  • Do-ability  - ability to seem doable, stripping away intimidation 

This is my purpose. I can confidently say that this is the most important project that I have ever worked on. I have poured more than 1,000 hours directly into the writing, testing, and design of this book. Making food taste good is simple, making food that nourishes something that you crave can be challenging at first, explaining it in a way that strips down intimidation has been quite the journey. 

 

By contributing to this project, you will help me bring my dream to a reality of creating the physical copy of my book and getting this adventure guide with pictures into the hands of hungry people like yourself. 


 

What We Need & What You Get

All of the heavy-lifting is completed; I have compiled all of my favorite recipes that are just waiting to see the inside of your kitchen.  I've decided to go the route of self-publishing and printing a color book full of descriptive pictures is not cheap. By pre-selling the books, I will have enough to cover artwork, professional design, and print. 

 

I've included some unique perks for contribution 

The services that I'm offering include personalized recipes, menus, cooking lessons, and more. I can assure you that any contribution will be a worthy investment to your entertainment and health. 

How about having myself as personal accountability?

A custom dinner party?

5 of your favorite recipes or cravings upgraded so that you can eat them daily without guilt?

I specialize in gluten-free, plant-based, allergy-free, macro or paleo recipes!

 

 

Your contribution will allow me to price the books out reasonably enough to order a high-volume that I can spread to everyone that desires upgrading their health and nutrition without depriving themselves of the flavors they crave.

This book is a by-product of the 1,000's of people that I have worked with who have food allergies, fat-loss goals, digestive issues, sports and performance goals, people just like you. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If things are tight and you cannot contribute anything, your help in spreading the word is greatly appreciated. I'm going all-in on this and can use all of the help that I can get :)

So... Please help me get the word out and make some noise about Making Healthy Taste Good

 

See more of my recipes on instagram at instagram.com/jasonsani

or youtube: https://www.youtube.com/user/sanitizer03

Check out the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Earth in Color (EIC) is on a mission to remove cultural barriers to engaging in healthy, sustainable living. Through our content and nature experiences, we affirm Black cultural connections to the environment and encourage regenerative ways of living.

As we are collectively reckoning with the fact that racism is woven deeply into our social fabric, we must also acknowledge the ways in which consequent violence and oppression have shaped our connections to the land. We believe that everyone should have the opportunity to experience the healing and nourishment that comes from deep kinship with the earth. We are committed to helping our community overcome inherited traumas that stifle connection to the natural world. Earth in Color seeks to facilitate community healing and create a future in which we all can live in ways that regenerate our bodies, our communities, and the earth.

 

 

Through sensory nature experiences and multi-channel content, we bring our culture, our histories, and our voices into the environment. Designing an art and music festival, hosting pop-ups and nature gatherings, and providing recipes and resources via our Instagram is just the beginning! With every activation, we help our community heal our relationships with nature and reaffirm our roots. 

 

 

Your financial contribution will fund the foundational elements of Earth in Color. It will allow us to build our team, incorporate as a nonprofit organization, and, ultimately, scale our work. It will also support the launch of several projects; one being Radicle, an interactive magazine that is a companion for a healthy and sustainable life.

In botany, a radicle is a catalyst. It is the first sprout to appear during germination, anchoring the seedling in its infancy and becoming the plant’s primary root.  In homage, we offer Radicle, a medium for personal germination. This magazine is the embodiment of Earth in Color’s vision and is a toolkit filled with plant-forward recipes, interactive activities, essays, resources and so much more. 

 

Please note, the limited print edition of Radicle can only be purchased through this campaign.

 

Reaching our stretch goal of $200,000 will allow us to roll out even more projects, like UNEARTHED, a documentary series that celebrates and archives Black land history. This series highlights our past and present connections to place focusing on relationships with the natural environment. UNEARTHED is a call for us to speak with our elders and document our history before it is lost. 

 

Unearthed Documentary Series  

 

Your financial contribution will give us the initial boost to produce more episodes, create more content, tell more stories, host more gatherings, and grow the EIC community. You are not only funding a business. You are investing in a movement for healing.

 

Make a contribution to Earth in Color and get a taste of what’s to come—from digital posters to culinary experiences. If you want all of your donation to go to Earth in Color or if you want to give a specific amount, you can scroll up and press the pink "back it" button. Otherwise, you can participate in the campaign perks system. 

Indiegogo campaign contributions are being received by The Pollination Project (TPP), a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization, who is a fiscal sponsor for Earth in Color. You can learn more about TPP at https://thepollinationproject.org/.

 

Help us spread the word:

  • Repost our campaign on social media and add a personal note about why you’re excited about Earth in Color. Make sure you tag us on Instagram @earthincolor.co. 
  • You may use the Indiegogo share tool.
  • Talk about the project with your friends, colleagues, and family.

 

In community,

 

 

To learn more visit our website and follow us on Instagram @earthincolor.co. Please check out our FAQ section for more information.

story:
Who am I?

"Hi, I´m Rebecca Wheaton, concerned global citizen and married mother of a 4-year old. I am a therapist and an educator. I want to increase awareness about what we can do about stress in Managua, Nicaragua. Nicaragua is one of the poorest countries in the hemisphere. People suffer from poverty, physical and emotional violence, gender inequality and lack of affection and quality time in the family. This results in high stress, anxiety, and physical problems. I want to do all I can and add to the growing network of healers and teachers working on this important social issue."

What is this about? Why do I need money?

My business in the healing arts is growing. People are looking to understand stress and overcome anxiety more effectively. Power Brain Education is an integral health program that blends a variety of healing arts techniques with the latest in neuroscience research. I choose this program because of it's skilful, respectful and dynamic understanding of the brain-body connection. I am asking for your help to send me to the training (including room and board) and provide materials for courses and marketing(books, art materials and on-line professional support). Your help will serve as the basis for growing my business as a healer and educator.

Who do I reach out to?

Five years ago, I moved to Managua to work and teach. Since 2012 I have brought both healing and yoga to students, teachers, parents, and professional adults - people were in need of a better quality of life. I have seen people's lives transformed. Primarily I work with caregivers and people with the majority of responsibility for their organizations and who feel burnout and in need for more spaces of self care. I also work with children and their teachers to introduce movement and mindfulness into the regular school program. Students find more  joy, clarity, focus, inner peace and self-awareness through this experience.

For 4 years I worked in Casa Alianza, a residency center for at-risk teenagers. We used power brain methods for over 300 youths in weekly classes. We emphasized yoga-like movements and mindfulness techniques, art and storytelling. At the beginning of the classes teens often arrived angry, frustrated and distracted; within 20-30 minutes, the environment always transformed into one of calmness and focus. People also reported heightened self-confidence and a positive outlook. On average 70% of students in each class could change their mood, and 30% of students who had left Casa Alianza later expressed that they still use the exercises to relieve stress

Next steps

Now I have the chance to reach out to teachers and professionals and train them in the practice and benefits of Power Brain education. I have a strong basis as an active yoga instructor and educator in my community. So far, my current level of training can only take me so far with what I can teach. Time to expand my scope and build on what I already know and what I can already do. 

Through this training, I can offer Power Brain Education to Nicaragua. I need your help for the training. Power Brain Education uses well-structured classes and on-going training; engaging physical, emotional and cognitive exercises to promote better self-esteem; enhance creativity; improve health and help any practitioner improve their mental focus and concentration. The philosophy holds the body/brain connection as a central value to it's education model.


While in the US mindfulness and wellness practices are being assimilated with enthusiasm, they are just up-and-coming in Nicaragua.  People are interested and want to try new techniques.

Expenses are high and money is tight in Nicaragua. It will take money, sponsorship and time before teachers, parents and schools are ready to devote funds to alternative education.

I want to champion this important work and I need your help.

When you donate your dollars, I will donate my hours!

In exchange for your generous donations towards my training, I will reach out to a variety of well-known and beloved institutions to offer free healing packages to the people in desperate need but cannot pay for individual healing sessions, yoga classes or exposure to the benefits of Power Brain Education. I will reach out to groups like:

CDCA & Nueva Vida Clinic: http://jhc-cdca.org/ 

CEPS: https://www.facebook.com/Centro-de-Estudios-y-P... 

CANTERA: http://cscantera.blogspot.com/ & CANTERA - Centro de Comunicación y Educación Popular

...and if you know of a group, institution or individual/family that really needs support and you think this might help please consider sponsoring them.

Healing packages are listed as PERKS in this campaign, Please claim the perk when you donate. THANKS! All perks will include campaign T-shirt and letter of thanks and testimonies.

Costs of training and follow-up

GOAL: $10,000:

$6,000 for both level 2 and 3 Power Brain trainings held in the Summer and Fall of 2017.

To read more about this training please click here 

$1,000 for room and board(during the trainings).

$3,000 for travel and marketing costs and promotional materials and books

Synopsis: BEL2 is an advanced program designed to give BE(Brain Education) Instructors a boost of passion and professionalism to take their teaching and presentation skills to a higher level.  BEL3 is an advanced Trainer’s Course where participants will receive instruction on how to teach the basic 2-day Brain Education Teacher’s Workshop. Participants will have the opportunity to train directly with the most dedicated BE Leaders in the country by visiting five New York City schools for real-world practice teaching students, teachers and parents.  Additionally, participants learn how to coordinate BE outreach projects in their region.

The training is just the beginning! I look forward to creating a dynamic and full schedule of healing sessions with individuals, families, and parent/teacher workshops and retreats for many years to come!  

This funding campaign serves people like you.  You would love to know more about people that are receiving this kind of care, but you aren't sure through whom to give. Help me raise the funds to bring a better quality of life to Nicaragua and I will share with you their pictures, testimonies and video projects that we have accomplished.

If donating isn't within your budget, perhaps there are a few people you know that may be interested in this campaign. Please share the link to this site. Thank you so much for your consideration. 

THANK YOU!!!!

Rebecca Wheaton

Certified Body and Brain Yoga Instructor/Lic. Massage Therapist

Facilitator in Human Development & Alternative Education Leadership programming

story:
From the beginning, I wanted to make sure that I could produce a high quality product using USA-sourced raw materials as well as labor, so everything from the glass to the paper is  from the USA. Overall, my mission is to improve the quality of life for aging seniors by providing high quality, smell -based products that could elicit cherished memories and help individuals to engage in pleasant conversation with their caregivers. 

OUR STORY

As a daughter who watched her mother pass away from dementia-related illness and a daughter-in-law currently helping care for a mother-in-law with Alzheimer's, I receive tremendous joy witnessing others connect in a meaningful way with loved ones who have great difficulty remembering special times of their lives. Several years ago, I decided to use the experience I had gained working in the flavors and fragrances industry for over 20 years to create a smell-based memory care product for reminiscence therapy.  The sense of smell is kept deep inside the most ancient part of the brain and research has confirmed that smells can trigger memories far more vivid and further back in time than even images and music.  

My motto, "Reaching To Memories Through The Sense Of Smell," led me to form a start-up company called The Scent Guru Group LLC and design and trademark a product called the Essential Awakenings Smell and Memory Kit.  The prototype (very similar to what is now the finished product) consisted of carefully-developed samples of six everyday, ordinary smells (such as jasmine, chocolate and freshly-cut grass) selected to help connect the aging with memories from everyday life. The smells are meant to be administered by adults who want to engage in a "guessing" game with their elderly parents, friends, or patients.  Clue cards and smelling strips are included with the kit to help guide caregivers in the administration of the smells.  The smells are not "perfumes" and are not meant to be worn, but are safe when coming in contact with the skin.

With the prototype in hand, I volunteered my time conducting more than 25 "smelling sessions"  with a total of over 200 participants at six senior care facilities in Connecticut, New York, Arkansas, and Tennessee. Those included Atria of Stamford, CT, River House Adult Day Center in Cos Cob, CT, The Greens of Greenwich in Greenwich, CT, The Hebrew Home of the Aging in Riverdale, NY, Culpepper Place in Springdale, AR and Carriage House of Memphis, TN.  

Almost immediately I saw what a powerful impact my kits had on reminiscence and communication. During one smelling session, for example,  some of the residents at a nursing home unexpectedly started conversing with each other, sharing memories of receiving and experiencing the joys of chocolate, while others started discussing how they loved lilacs and had a lilac bush in their gardens.

I am proud to say that the prototype of The Essential Awakenings Smell and Memory Kit earned a product endorsement from Ottavio Arancio M.D., Ph.D., Columbia University Medical Center which is featured on the packaging of the final product.  And Essential Awakenings just this month was announced as the first-place winner in Connecticut of the Small Business Administration's InnovateHER 2017: Innovating For Women Business Challenge. Now onto the national competition, the results of which will be announced later this year.

With the Premier Edition of Essential Awakenings now ready to ship, we are reaching out to raise $50,000 in funds to manufacture the Second Edition of Essential Awakenings Smell and Memory Kit, which will include six other distinct smells, and a third, "Complete Edition" which will feature 15 smells.

Our mission is to improve quality of life for aging seniors by providing high-quality, smell-based products that elicit cherished memories and help individuals to engage in pleasant conversation with their caregivers.  We hope you will join us in our journey.

WHAT PEOPLE ARE SAYING ABOUT ESSENTIAL AWAKENINGS KITS

"Ruth has enhanced the lives of our residents with her smelling sessions. The scents have helped them to remember special times in their lives and to discuss it in a group. It is a truly therapeutic and relaxing hour. I am grateful for Ruth's program.” - Elanit Linder, ATRIA, Stamford , CT

"Morningside of Springdale wanted to take the time to thank you for such a wonderful event.  So many of the residents were reminded of times gone by with the smells you presented.  I very much enjoyed the opportunity you offered our area with you amazing skills.  Please come visit anytime and bring your smell goods for memories.” - Jeanie Melear, Lifestyle 360 Director, Morningside of Springdale, AR

"Lyndsay was raving about your visit to River House last Saturday.   Thank you so much for including us and sharing your talent with the River House clients.   I am so thrilled to hear about the positive response you received.   I look forward to continuing and growing our work together in the very near future.” - Donna Spellman, Executive Director, River House, Cos Cob, CT

"Essential Awakenings with Ruth is a fun and important experience for residents at any facility. The scents that Ruth creates elicit memories for our residents, and inspires socialization through conversation about what scents appeal to which people. A favorite memory from one of our first Essential Awakenings groups was when one resident kept commenting with each new scent, "It's opening up my nostrils!" This resident was smiling the entire group, and simply enjoyed celebrating a sense of empowerment through stimulating their sense of smell. With age, our sense of smell dwindles. Therefore, having a group with the goal of awakening such an identifying aspect of each person, is key to a well-rounded program. I am honored to incorporate Essential Awakenings into our programming; it adds so much to the sensory experience we hope to offer those in their last stage of life". - Beth Liebowitz, Program Director, The Greens, Greenwich, CT

THE PRODUCT

The Premier Edition of the Essential Awakenings Smell and Memory Kit is comprised of six simple, every day smells chosen because of their high likelihood of resonating with an aging population.  The smells include Jasmine, Chocolate, Pineapple, Mint, Cinnamon and Grass. Launched in June, 2017 to coincide with Brain Health and Awareness month, this edition (pictured) is now available and ready to ship!  

With your help, The Scent Guru Group hopes to roll out the Second Edition of Essential Awakenings Smell and Memory Kit, which will include six other distinct smells, in August or September of this year. And the company is hoping to launch a third, “Complete” edition with a total of 15 smells, by October, 2017  to coincide with beginning of the holiday buying season.  

 

ABOUT THE FOUNDER

 

Ruth Sutcliffe Heagney has more than 30 years of experience in the fragrance and flavor industry with background in sensory development at such corporate giants at International Flavors & Fragrances, Clairol (a division of Bristol Myers Worldwide Beauty Care), and Coty. At IFF, she developed fragrances for laundry, skin care, and household categories for major multinational clients, including P&G, Unilever, S.C. Johnson and Colgate-Palmolive.  While there she also co-authored an important IFF patent for NeutrIFF Technology.

At Clairol, she developed fragrances for all Clairol, Matrix, Mum and Aussie brands and also developed the company’s first Ammonia Hair Color and Skin Care Fragrance Collections and designed Clairol’s Quality Assurance Methodology and training efforts for its Product Development Panels. After leaving Clairol, she joined Coty as Senior Marketing Director and Fragrance Designer.  In this role, she contributed to the sales growth of Coty’s perfume business from $750 million in 2001 to $3 billion in 2014 and also developed fragrance and ancillary products from conceptual stage to launch for local, global and celebrity brands, including FIFI Awards for Halle Berry, Celine Dion, Beyonce, Katy Perry, Tim McGraw and Nautica fragrances. Since leaving Coty in 2014, she has run her own successful fragrance consulting business, Ruth Sutcliffe Consulting LLC, and in 2015 she formed the Scent Guru Group, LLC.

WE ARE READY TO SHIP AND GRATEFUL FOR YOUR HELP
story_txt:
From the beginning, I wanted to make sure that I could produce a high quality product using USA-sourced raw materials as well as labor, so everything from the glass to the paper is  from the USA. Overall, my mission is to improve the quality of life for aging seniors by providing high quality, smell -based products that could elicit cherished memories and help individuals to engage in pleasant conversation with their caregivers. 

OUR STORY
As a daughter who watched her mother pass away from dementia-related illness and a daughter-in-law currently helping care for a mother-in-law with Alzheimer's, I receive tremendous joy witnessing others connect in a meaningful way with loved ones who have great difficulty remembering special times of their lives. Several years ago, I decided to use the experience I had gained working in the flavors and fragrances industry for over 20 years to create a smell-based memory care product for reminiscence therapy.  The sense of smell is kept deep inside the most ancient part of the brain and research has confirmed that smells can trigger memories far more vivid and further back in time than even images and music.  
My motto, "Reaching To Memories Through The Sense Of Smell," led me to form a start-up company called The Scent Guru Group LLC and design and trademark a product called the Essential Awakenings Smell and Memory Kit.  The prototype (very similar to what is now the finished product) consisted of carefully-developed samples of six everyday, ordinary smells (such as jasmine, chocolate and freshly-cut grass) selected to help connect the aging with memories from everyday life. The smells are meant to be administered by adults who want to engage in a "guessing" game with their elderly parents, friends, or patients.  Clue cards and smelling strips are included with the kit to help guide caregivers in the administration of the smells.  The smells are not "perfumes" and are not meant to be worn, but are safe when coming in contact with the skin.

With the prototype in hand, I volunteered my time conducting more than 25 "smelling sessions"  with a total of over 200 participants at six senior care facilities in Connecticut, New York, Arkansas, and Tennessee. Those included Atria of Stamford, CT, River House Adult Day Center in Cos Cob, CT, The Greens of Greenwich in Greenwich, CT, The Hebrew Home of the Aging in Riverdale, NY, Culpepper Place in Springdale, AR and Carriage House of Memphis, TN.  
Almost immediately I saw what a powerful impact my kits had on reminiscence and communication. During one smelling session, for example,  some of the residents at a nursing home unexpectedly started conversing with each other, sharing memories of receiving and experiencing the joys of chocolate, while others started discussing how they loved lilacs and had a lilac bush in their gardens.
I am proud to say that the prototype of The Essential Awakenings Smell and Memory Kit earned a product endorsement from Ottavio Arancio M.D., Ph.D., Columbia University Medical Center which is featured on the packaging of the final product.  And Essential Awakenings just this month was announced as the first-place winner in Connecticut of the Small Business Administration's InnovateHER 2017: Innovating For Women Business Challenge. Now onto the national competition, the results of which will be announced later this year.
With the Premier Edition of Essential Awakenings now ready to ship, we are reaching out to raise $50,000 in funds to manufacture the Second Edition of Essential Awakenings Smell and Memory Kit, which will include six other distinct smells, and a third, "Complete Edition" which will feature 15 smells.
Our mission is to improve quality of life for aging seniors by providing high-quality, smell-based products that elicit cherished memories and help individuals to engage in pleasant conversation with their caregivers.  We hope you will join us in our journey.
WHAT PEOPLE ARE SAYING ABOUT ESSENTIAL AWAKENINGS KITS
"Ruth has enhanced the lives of our residents with her smelling sessions. The scents have helped them to remember special times in their lives and to discuss it in a group. It is a truly therapeutic and relaxing hour. I am grateful for Ruth's program.” - Elanit Linder, ATRIA, Stamford , CT
"Morningside of Springdale wanted to take the time to thank you for such a wonderful event.  So many of the residents were reminded of times gone by with the smells you presented.  I very much enjoyed the opportunity you offered our area with you amazing skills.  Please come visit anytime and bring your smell goods for memories.” - Jeanie Melear, Lifestyle 360 Director, Morningside of Springdale, AR
"Lyndsay was raving about your visit to River House last Saturday.   Thank you so much for including us and sharing your talent with the River House clients.   I am so thrilled to hear about the positive response you received.   I look forward to continuing and growing our work together in the very near future.” - Donna Spellman, Executive Director, River House, Cos Cob, CT
"Essential Awakenings with Ruth is a fun and important experience for residents at any facility. The scents that Ruth creates elicit memories for our residents, and inspires socialization through conversation about what scents appeal to which people. A favorite memory from one of our first Essential Awakenings groups was when one resident kept commenting with each new scent, "It's opening up my nostrils!" This resident was smiling the entire group, and simply enjoyed celebrating a sense of empowerment through stimulating their sense of smell. With age, our sense of smell dwindles. Therefore, having a group with the goal of awakening such an identifying aspect of each person, is key to a well-rounded program. I am honored to incorporate Essential Awakenings into our programming; it adds so much to the sensory experience we hope to offer those in their last stage of life". - Beth Liebowitz, Program Director, The Greens, Greenwich, CT
THE PRODUCT

The Premier Edition of the Essential Awakenings Smell and Memory Kit is comprised of six simple, every day smells chosen because of their high likelihood of resonating with an aging population.  The smells include Jasmine, Chocolate, Pineapple, Mint, Cinnamon and Grass. Launched in June, 2017 to coincide with Brain Health and Awareness month, this edition (pictured) is now available and ready to ship!  
With your help, The Scent Guru Group hopes to roll out the Second Edition of Essential Awakenings Smell and Memory Kit, which will include six other distinct smells, in August or September of this year. And the company is hoping to launch a third, “Complete” edition with a total of 15 smells, by October, 2017  to coincide with beginning of the holiday buying season.  

 
ABOUT THE FOUNDER

 
Ruth Sutcliffe Heagney has more than 30 years of experience in the fragrance and flavor industry with background in sensory development at such corporate giants at International Flavors & Fragrances, Clairol (a division of Bristol Myers Worldwide Beauty Care), and Coty. At IFF, she developed fragrances for laundry, skin care, and household categories for major multinational clients, including P&G, Unilever, S.C. Johnson and Colgate-Palmolive.  While there she also co-authored an important IFF patent for NeutrIFF Technology.
At Clairol, she developed fragrances for all Clairol, Matrix, Mum and Aussie brands and also developed the company’s first Ammonia Hair Color and Skin Care Fragrance Collections and designed Clairol’s Quality Assurance Methodology and training efforts for its Product Development Panels. After leaving Clairol, she joined Coty as Senior Marketing Director and Fragrance Designer.  In this role, she contributed to the sales growth of Coty’s perfume business from $750 million in 2001 to $3 billion in 2014 and also developed fragrance and ancillary products from conceptual stage to launch for local, global and celebrity brands, including FIFI Awards for Halle Berry, Celine Dion, Beyonce, Katy Perry, Tim McGraw and Nautica fragrances. story:
Forest Therapy 

For many of you, the terms “Forest Therapy” and “Shinrin-yoku” may be unfamiliar. Not to worry! The practice is relatively new to Western culture, and is only just now beginning to gain momentum as more and more people are feeling called to return to nature, and thus seek meaningful ways in which to do so. This campaign will support me in starting up my business as a certified Forest Therapy Guide so as to offer Forest Therapy services within the Okanagan region of Western Canada, as a means for people to mindfully return to nature. 

 

Benefits of Forest Therapy:

  • Boosts immune system function
  • Reduces stress
  • Reduces anxiety
  • Relieves symptoms of depression
  • Lowers blood pressure
  • Improves concentration
  • Lowers blood sugar
  • Accelerates recovery from surgery or illness
  • Detoxifies the body of digital over-stimulation
  • Increases ability to focus
  • Improves mood
  • Increases energy levels
  • Improves self-awareness
  • Deepens connection to senses
  • Greater connection to nature
  • Clears mind and heightens intuition

In a nutshell, what is Forest Therapy/Shinrin-yoku?

Shinrin-yoku is a Japanese term that translates to “forest bathing”, or “taking in the forest atmosphere”. It was developed in Japan during the 1980s and has become a cornerstone of preventive health care and healing in Japanese medicine. The idea is simple: if a person simply visits a natural area and walks in a relaxed way there are calming, rejuvenating and restorative benefits to be achieved. 

The Association of Nature and Forest Therapy writes:

"Forest bathing seems to significantly mitigate the root cause of a multitude of ailments: Excess stress can play a role in headaches, high blood pressure, heart problems, diabetes, skin conditions, asthma, and arthritis, among many other ailments.

 

“What is a Certified Forest Therapy Guide, and why do I need one?”

In much the same way a yoga instructor guides you through linking breath and movement to achieve a mindful connection between body and spirit, a Forest Therapy Guide guides you through the opening of all your senses to bring you into a deeper connection with the earth.

﻿​The Association of Nature and Forest Therapy writes, “A Forest Therapy Guide facilitates safe, gentle walks, providing instructions—referred to as “invitations”—for sensory opening activities along the way. On Forest Therapy walks, people have a wide range of experiences, some of which they feel are significant, even profound. Guides are trained in the skills and perspectives needed to be supportive witnesses of these experiences…By slowing people down and facilitating sensory experiencing, guides open the doorways through which the forest can accomplish its healing work.” - (http://www.natureandforesttherapy.org)

With a guide present to remind people of how to linger, simply be where they are, and open to the subtle sensations around them, wonder and awe are given an opportunity to reappear within their hearts.

 

Why am I passionate about nature and bringing Forest Therapy to the public professionally?

Because I love being human, and I love the forest! I full-heartedly adore experiencing nature as intimately and wildly as possibly through my senses, and I want to share that ridiculous, unbound joy with as many people as I’m able to.  I firmly believe that we are alive to live, that our capacity for emotion, sensation, and expression is as breathtaking as the earth that supports us through all our trials and explorations as a species. A number of scientific studies have also been done to confirm that there are many ways in which the forest supports our health and well-being on a physical as well as emotional and mental level. These studies may be referenced in the resources section below.

Please think for a moment…when did you last visit a forest, take off your shoes, and wrap your arms around a tree? How often do you sprawl in a river, or hang upside down from a tree branch until all your laughter falls out of your belly? And have you ever walked out of the forest feeling more stressed and uptight than when you walked in?

A large part of my inspiration for bringing Forest Therapy to the public stems from my own journey through a health crisis, and how the forest supported my healing.

When I was fourteen, I was struck with chronic migraine headaches. I was in agony every day for four years, despite being tested, scanned, examined, and put on countless drugs (which only made me sicker). I finally made a breakthrough when I started taking myself out into the forest, barefooted, and wandering where I willed, exploring nature and truly experiencing my senses for the first time. I climbed trees and sat in them for hours; I played in rivers and gave myself dirt baths. I willed my headaches away, and with daily contact with the forest, a shift into a holistic lifestyle, and avoidance of harsh fluorescent lighting, they dissipated.

Over the years, my connection with nature deepened until I was spending more time around trees than people. I could no longer think of anything besides the forest when engaged in other affairs, and I could not bear to be gone from it longer than a few days at a time. I felt myself become frazzled and unfocused, ungrounded and scattered when too much time passed without contact with the trees. I hadn't realized up until that point how enormously the forest was impacting me and by body, and how sensitive I was becoming to the harshness of the city world.

I have learned the most fundamental of life’s lessons through my playful connection with nature, and through my experiences have realize that the source of all healing stems from here.

Every Forest Therapy walk is a unique experience, as you open your senses and relax into your environment in new ways each time - tuning in to elements that had previously been beyond your reach. The further you sink into this practice, the greater the rewards for your health...and the more alive you feel!

 

The purpose of this campaign:

To raise the funds required to start up The Infinity Experience as a business (which includes certification as a Forest Therapy Guide) within the Okanagan valley, and to ultimately establish Forest Therapy as a recognized and valued therapy in Western Canada;

To bring awareness to the rising need for a reconnection with nature on personal, societal, and global scales for the survival and wellbeing of the human race, and for the wellbeing of the earth as a sensitive, interconnected, and sentient system;

And to offer everyone who resonates with my dream the opportunity to be involved with the introduction of a healing practice that offers balance, and a greater sense of connection with the wonder and beauty of the natural world!

 

What We Need & What You Get

$50,000 is needed to fuel the start-up of this business. If I do not reach my goal, the funds will still be going towards all the business start-up expenses, where they are needed most urgently:

  • Certification training
  • Business insurance
  • Business licence  
  • Business vehicle
  • Business phone
  • Website production
  • Marketing
  • Publication of book on connecting with nature

While I feel that all of you who are supporting me are total superstars and any contribution is enormously welcomed and appreciated, I am offering some special perks for those who want to make larger contributions and be directly involved in receiving the benefits of this Forest Therapy practice!

If you live out of area and are not certain that you yourself may have the ability to use these Forest Therapy walk punch cards, consider those in your life who could benefit from these walks as a gift: friends or family who may either reside in the Okanagan region or who will be visiting sometime in the future. All perk rewards are transferable to people of your choosing.

 

The Impact

The Infinity Experience Mission Statement

The Infinity Experience exists to provide Western Canada with the industry of guided Forest Therapy Walks, to reconnect individuals with nature and their senses through the practice of Shinrin-yoku, which translates to "Forest Bathing" or "taking in the forest atmosphere". 

*

Western society as a whole is suffering from NDD: Nature-Deficit-Disorder. Technology is advancing at increasingly faster rates; people are engaging with an artificially constructed world on an hourly basis, and any leftover energy goes into maintaining the stresses of their demanding lives. On average, children now spend less time outside each day than prison inmates, who are guaranteed two hours of outdoor time every day. 

The connection our species once had with the natural world is disappearing rapidly, and this spells disaster for our future. A balance between technology and natural human sensation must be found so that we can cultivate a greater awareness of ourselves and our planet's need for our stewardship. We appreciate what we love, and for us to love the forests, we must spend time getting to know them, opening ourselves to the wonder and healing gifts they offer.

Forest Therapy seeks to slow humanity down, awaken the senses, and facilitate a re-connection with nature. 

 

Challenges

The main challenges I am facing as I begin down this path are my inexperience in business and management, and a lack of start-up funding.

To overcome this I am providing myself with an internationally recognized certification training to fulfill my role as a Forest Therapy Guide, sourcing out adequate funding, and setting up a management support team.

Thanks to the support of my dearest friends and my own love for the forest, I have absolute confidence in my ability to bring together all the elements necessary to create this business and provide an extraordinary service as a Forest Therapy Guide. For all the wonderful experiences I have felt called to embrace over the years, I have never felt so passionate about any of them as I feel about my desire to help others connect with the beauty, wonder, and healing embrace of nature. 

Most of all, I have confidence in all of you who are tuning in to me and my goals! As passionate and emotional human beings, we have a fundamental desire in this life to share in each other’s happiness and success: it benefits the whole community when we can support each other.

Other Ways You Can Help 

If you’ve made it this far through reading about my campaign but don’t feel like you are in a place of being able to contribute, I take that as a sign you have been inspired and are still interested in where all of this is going. Right on, that’s awesome!

The best ways you can help me without making a contribution are to share this campaign with your network/community, post about it on social media, and share your interest by getting the word out there about Forest Therapy and the benefits of being in regular, mindful contact with the earth!

This impacts everyone, so please don’t feel limited to only sharing it with people who are stressed, depressed, or out of touch with nature. Even the healthiest and most outdoorsy amongst us benefit from slowing down and nurturing a deeper connection with our forests, so make some noise! Draw your loved ones’ focus away from their busy routines and towards nature just for a moment so that the power of the forest can reach out and touch them.

 

To those within my region & in my life:

If you have experienced being in the forest with me and have had a sampling of the impact it’s had on your wellbeing, please let people know what you experienced and that you would participate in future walks with me as your guide!

Your referrals and testimonials are so very welcomed!

 

 

Thank you!

Thank you, each and every one of you, for the incredible support, encouragement, and positivity you’ve offered me through your involvement in the realization of this campaign and my life purpose. I could not do this without you – and let me thoroughly assure you: you are who I am doing this for! Just like trees, we need each other to survive and to thrive; we are so much more brilliant when we support and nourish each other in our life endeavors.

 

Video Credits

This video was produced by Wellness Realizations Productions, directed by Shri Ananda, with additional footage provided by The Association of Nature and Forest Therapy (http://www.natureandforesttherapy.org/).

 

 

Resources for your Benefit

Videos on Shinrin-yoku / Forest Therapy

Introduction to Shrinrin Yoku 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LUfbMIGcxkM

 

Forest therapy Guide uses woodland walks to heighten senses

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8LpZiCMiofc

 

Shinrin-Yoku: The Art of Forest Bathing

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mHs1P1zEx7s

 

How Forests Heal People

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=y-wHq6yY2CI

 

How Trees Communicate

https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fd3...

 

Studies and Articles

A Retreat to Nature Can Boost Immunity and Mood

https://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/17/536676954/forest-bathing-a-retreat-to-nature-can-boost-immunity-and-mood

 

Study on Shinrin-yoku / Forest Therapy

http://www.natureandforesttherapy.org/uploads/8/1/4/4/8144400/_physiological_effects_of_shinrin-yokucortisol-2007.pdf

 

Study on Phytoncides (Essential Oils)

http://www.natureandforesttherapy.org/uploads/8/1/4/4/8144400/_phytonocides_wood_essential_oils_induce_human_natural_killer_cell_activity-_forestmedicineabstracts.pdf

 

Oprah Magazine Article on Forest Therapy:

http://www.natureandforesttherapy.org/uploads/8/1/4/4/8144400/oprah_forest_bathing.pdf

Most of all, I have confidence in all of you who are tuning in to me and my goals! As passionate and emotional human beings, we have a fundamental desire in this life to share in each other’s happiness and success: it benefits the whole community when we can support each other.


Other Ways You Can Help 
If you’ve made it this far through reading about my campaign but don’t feel like you are in a place of being able to contribute, I take that as a sign you have been inspired and are still interested in where all of this is going. Right on, that’s awesome!
The best ways you can help me without making a contribution are to share this campaign with your network/community, post about it on social media, and share your interest by getting the word out there about Forest Therapy and the benefits of being in regular, mindful contact with the earth!
This impacts everyone, so please don’t feel limited to only sharing it with people who are stressed, depressed, or out of touch with nature. Even the healthiest and most outdoorsy amongst us benefit from slowing down and nurturing a deeper connection with our forests, so make some noise! Draw your loved ones’ focus away from their busy routines and towards nature just for a moment so that the power of the forest can reach out and touch them.
 
To those within my region & in my life:
If you have experienced being in the forest with me and have had a sampling of the impact it’s had on your wellbeing, please let people know what you experienced and that you would participate in future walks with me as your guide!
Your referrals and testimonials are so very welcomed!
 
 
Thank you!
Thank you, each and every one of you, for the incredible support, encouragement, and positivity you’ve offered me through your involvement in the realization of this campaign and my life purpose. I could not do this without you – and let me thoroughly assure you: you are who I am doing this for! Just like trees, we need each other to survive and to thrive; we are so much more brilliant when we support and nourish each other in our life endeavors.
 
Video Credits
This video was produced by Wellness Realizations Productions, directed by Shri Ananda, with additional footage provided by The Association of Nature and Forest Therapy (http://www.natureandforesttherapy.org/).
 
 
Resources for your Benefit

Forest therapy Guide uses woodland walks to heighten senses
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8LpZiCMiofc
 
Shinrin-Yoku: The Art of Forest Bathing
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mHs1P1zEx7s
 
How Forests Heal People
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=y-wHq6yY2CI
 
How Trees Communicate

story:
Our story 

Heart & Hands Health Collective is a grassroots, locally-owned Community Acupuncture & Holistic Health clinic. Our focus is providing compassionate and accessible services to our community. Our mission is to transform community health into community wealth.

The acupuncture team at Heart & Hands provides an average of 750-900 sessions monthly all at $20-50 sliding scale rates, open to everyone in our community.

We are also home to high quality, inclusive services including Naturopathic Medicine, Herbal Medicine and Craniosacral Therapy. We are a bustling community hub where people from all walks of life come together to rest, recover and heal. We aim to shift and support attitudes around preventative care. 

We have always put our focus on providing accessible services for the public good over profits. We are committed to serving the Victoria community, proudly make our home in the working class North Park neighbourhood and filling in the gaps of our healthcare system.

As a tiny, values-based establishment in Downtown Victoria, it is no longer sustainable for us to remain a business due to the rapidly rising operating costs.

It is time to change the playing field. 

 

Next steps

We plan to transition into a non-profit, so we can maintain our two core principles:

  1. Maintain affordability for our client base
  2. Pay our practitioners a living wage

Cost of living continues to rise, yet wages do not.

Many in our community lack health benefits or their coverage is extremely limited. Minimum wage in Victoria is $13.85, income assistance provides $710/month and monthly disability assistance is $1133. Somehow, those with limited means need to cover basic expenses (ie. rent, food, transportation, etc.) in a city with an ever-rising cost of living. 

Our flexible rates make it more sustainable for a larger segment of our community to maintain a regular course of treatment. We want to make it possible to get well AND stay well. 

 

The crux of the issue - Property taxes

Property values downtown YYJ continue to rise, making it increasingly difficult to cover our expenses. We strongly feel that raising our rates or cutting wages are not viable solutions, which go against our mission and values.

In 2019, $10 850 in property taxes were paid to the City of Victoria. Based on the current rise in property value, our projected 2020 property tax will be approximately $12 000.

2019 was also an unexpected and uncertain year of decreased capacity and financial deficit due to Owner/Operator, Christina Chan's health crisis and continued recovery from major surgery. Becoming a non-profit has been on the back burner for quite some time. The circumstances of the past year has been that extra push to make this necessary transition. 

We need to raise a total of $15 000 =
$12 000 for 2020 property tax + $3000 for the administrative transition to non-profit

Becoming a non-profit will provide the opportunity to apply for property tax exemption with the City of Victoria in 2021. We are racing to meet the May 31, 2020 deadline. 

If our application for exemption is approved by city council, we may be granted a complete or partial exemption from property taxes for 3 years! This will alleviate a portion of our tax burdens and allow us to reinvest it back into our community!

 

Why go non-profit?

Since opening our doors in 2010, despite being a business, we have always operated with a people before profits approach. We exist as a vital service to the community, affordably supporting our community’s health and well-being at sliding scale rates. In a way, we have unofficially functioned as a non-profit for almost 10 years. And now this is our opportunity to make it official!

Becoming a non-profit:

  • Is a long term investment in our core principles
  • Maintains our ability to provide affordable sliding scale rates for community acupuncture
  • Continues to support our mission of providing accessible and inclusive holistic health services for the community
  • Alleviates a portion of our taxes so revenues can be reinvested into our organization
  • Supports a living wage, professional development and healthcare benefits for our dedicated staff
  • Creates opportunities for employees to have a bigger stake in our organization
  • Allows us to accept donations from community members and/or funders in a trust
  • Enables us to access to grants and other streams of funding 
  • Expands our reach through collaboration with other organizations and providing their members treatment subsidies  
  • Will generate funding for future satellite locations on Vancouver Island and beyond
  • Breaks new ground by becoming a non-profit organization providing full-time community acupuncture and alternative/holistic health services
  • Serves as a potential model/case study for other like-minded organizations to undergo a similar process
  • Is a stepping stone to pursuing charitable status in the future

This is a huge step towards the longevity and sustainability of providing compassionate, accessible acupuncture services in the Greater Victoria Area and beyond.

Help us build Heart & Hands 2.0! 

 

Other ways to support us!

  • Can’t make a contribution online?
    We can also accept funds via e-transfer (send to heartandhands.acu@gmail.com)
    OR
    We can collect cash/cheque contributions at the front desk :)
  • Rather than make a large one-time contribution, instead, make multiple, smaller, more manageable $5-10 contributions across the duration of the campaign
  • Organize a cash pool at your workplace, organization, school, etc. so you can make a group contribution!
  • MAKE SOME NOISE - please share our campaign page on your social media channels! More than once over the course of the campaign if you feel so inclined!
  • Send an email blast to friends, family, coworkers, classmates and other like-minded organizations. Help us spread the word!
  • Do you think our story is newsworthy? Forward our campaign onto potentially interested reporters and local news outlets! Download our press release. 
  • Boost our emotional impact! Contribute to our stories project, Humans of Heart & Hands! Our project is a living document of practitioner, volunteer & client accounts of how Heart & Hands Health Collective has made a positive impact in their lives and how community acupuncture can change the world!

story:
What We Do

The Ilan Lev Method (ILM) is a revolutionary form of hands on bodywork developed by master healer and therapist, Ilan Lev.  The Method brings an explosion of movement, life force energy, playful provocation, and joy to the body. This creates the environment in which the body's natural ability to heal itself can arise. We discover optimal range of motion, efficiency of effort, and a new understanding of ourselves, through play.

Photo by Cristina Crippa

The practitioner brings gentle, effortless movement to the client’s body allowing for a rich and powerful dialog within and between client and practitioner; like a dance. This allows new physical pathways and coordinations to emerge or become clearer, old habits to be thrown out, and physical and emotional trauma to be released. 

 

"The method perceives pain not as an enemy, but instead as a way that our body communicates with us; it relies on the knowledge that the nervous system is really smart and will adjust and realign as needed if given the opportunity." -Dance Enthusiast

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking initial funding to bring the Ilan Lev Method Training courses to the U.S.A.:

  • Lawyer & Visa Fees: $10,000
  • Flights: $4,000

  • Studio Rental: $11,000

    TOTAL = $25,000

Our donors will receive rewards ranging from individual ILM treatments (including those with the master himself) to ILM Movement Classes and of course, our eternal gratitude. They will also contribute to building a network of Ilan Lev practitioners in the United States making the practice more accessible going forwards to meet the exponential growth in demand  for the treatment and for new healers and therapists.

The Impact

At the heart of ILM is a dialogue with ourselves, others, and the world around us. The Method has the potential to change the way we approach health, wellness and wholeness, at a moment when deep listening and healing is more essential than ever for our communities and our planet. We hope that the expansion of this method will create a ripple effect across this country and the world.

As Ilan often reminds us, "Heal one person, heal the World." 

Over the past 5 years, we have been generating a growing interest and awareness of this work here in the States. From virtual obscurity, to an ever expanding group of performers, artists, and seekers of health, who all engage with and are eager to delve deeper into this extraordinary practice. We believe that this community needs to, and deserves to have the opportunity to study the art of movement and healing from this wise man, while he is still 80 years young, and able to travel. With your support and donations, we will be able to accomplish this.

              "I find Ilan's work an amazing gift to dancers and people alike. His work helps the body's own regeneration. It brings movement to blocked areas in the body, it comes with positive energy and sense of joy, it can help quicker recovery from "fresh injuries" as well as heal old ones... It helped me to become more efficient with my movement and gave me a more balanced body... His work is intelligent, thoughtful, considerate, and is a constant research of growth for Ilan himself as well as for those he works with.” -Maestro Ohad Naharin, Choreographer, Artistic Director of Batsheva Dance Company

                                                      

Risks & Challenges

In order to bring Ilan and his team of assistants from Israel to teach in New York, we need to get them all working Visas which, given the current political situation in this country, will be more challenging and expensive then ever. It's also important to us that the Practitioner Training Program take place in a location where our students can thrive. This money will help us to afford a location conducive to learning while keeping the tuition for aspiring practitioners affordable. 

We began the process of organizing this Training Program three years ago, but the budget has never balanced in such a way that we are able to afford to offer the course, despite the ever-increasing interest in the Method. With this seed money, we can hire an expert legal team to do everything we can to bring Ilan Lev and the assistants here!

Who We Are

 Ilan Lev -the founder and creator of ILM

Annie Rigney - Director of the New York Training Program and ILM practitoner and assistant 

Kate Douglas -Administrative Director for the New York Training Program 

Avishai Pollac - CEO, ILM practitioner and assistant, and member of our U.S. ILM team

Igal Furman -Senior ILM practitioner and assistant, and member of our U.S. ILM team 

A community of movers, healers, therapists, and most importantly, humans, devoted to the pursuit of knowledge, and invested in sharing, and expanding our ability to help others.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this campaign with all your friends with bodies!​ We want to create a community of shared learning and curiosity.
