story_txt:
Version Française >>>


Qi Gong is an easy and accessible way to :- Exercise your body- Improve your health and longevity- Remove your toxins- Reduce your stress- Improve your blood and energy circulation- Balance Yin and Yang, Fire and Water energies, mind and body
Hi, my name is Rafael. I'm a Frenchman and spend six months a year in Thailand, where I teach Qi Gong. I have 15 years of experience and interest in Buddhism and Eastern philosophy, Qi Gong, Tai Chi Chuan, Taoism, theology, buddhist and taoist meditation, and self-healing practices.My previous training includes Tai Chi Chuan, Hatha Yoga, Qi Gong, Buddhist Teachings, Buddhist Meditation and Reiki.
The goal of this campaign is to produce an easy to learn Qi Gong method so that you can practise on your own in your everyday life. Based on the Qi Gong course I have been teaching for the last six years, the method includes some warm-up and breathing exercises, standing practice (exercises in movement) as well as sitting practice (meditation).The "Qi Gong Essential Daily Practice Set" will feature an easy to follow video with several selectable soundtracks: voiceover with instructions in English or French (for beginners),or music and sounds of nature (for advanced students). The video will be recorded in High Definition.The 24 page booklet will also give you clearly written instructions, featuring details about qi gong postures,  principles to be followed, as well as several sitting meditations. 
You will thus have all you need for your daily or weekly practice.
By clicking here you can visit my site to get more info about Qi Gong.



The funds raised through this campaign will be used to pay for:
- Production of the video.
- Pressing costs of the dvd.
- Printing costs for the booklet and the dvd cover.
- Proof reading of the English translation of both the booklet and the video texts by a native English speaker and professional translator.
- Recording the video voiceover by a native English speaker.
Any remaining money (if any) will be used to add more exercises and to improve the layout and design of the booklet and the dvd cover.


There are two ways you can help:
- you can select one of our perks (at the top of this page on the right).
Any contribution, even the smallest, will help to bring this project to life. You can also, if you wish, add an extra amount of money to the perk selected.
 - and/or you can spread the word about this project.  
Please share the link to this campaign on your social media platforms, on your website, blog or by email, by using the Share tools under the video at the top of this page.

 




Here is the list of Perks you can choose from. 
 - FREE SHIPPING WORLDWIDE for all printed materials -


Credit
Your name will appear in the end credits of the video as a donor (~£6.5).
 
 
 

Double Credit
Your name will appear in the end credits of the video and in the booklet as a donor (~£10).
 
 
 

Digital Version
You will receive a link to download the video and its booklet. Then you can watch/read them as many times as you want on your computer, tv, tablet or smart phone. + Double Credit perk.(~£23.80)
 
 
 

Printed Version
You will receive by mail the video on a DVD and its booklet. + Double Credit perk. Free shipping Worldwide. (~£36.45)
 
 
 

Printed + Digital
All in one. Digital Version + Printed Version + Double Credit perks. Free shipping worldwide. (~£46.40)
 
 
 

Live + Printed + Digital
Come and meet me in Koh Chang, Thailand for a 3 Day Course (from May till December, valid for 1 or 2 people). + Digital Version + Printed Version + Double Credit perks.(~£167)
 
 

License for Teacher
You acquire the right to teach the method in your qi gong, tai chi, meditation or yoga school. + Digital Version + Printed Version + Double Credit perks. (~£502)
 
 

Business Angel
This will sure help a lot. Your name will appear in the end credits of the video and in the booklet as Producer. + UNLIMITED downloads of the Digital Version + 10 Printed Version perks. (~£670)
 



What are Stretch Goals? 
They are freebies you will get if we surpass our goal.
At $6000, I will add two Gi Gong meditations to the sitting practice section of the booklet. Anybody having contributed to a "Digital Version" perk or higher levels will get them for free.
At $8000, will add two guided meditations audio files to download. Anybody having contributed to a "Digital Version" perk or higher levels will get them for free.
At $10000, I will add two exercises, showing how to work with sounds, to the sitting practice section of the booklet. Anybody having contributed to a "Digital Version" perk or higher levels will get them for free.
More Stretch Goals will be added over the campaign.
 
Thank you for reading and I hope that, together, we can bring this project to life.
 


 Version Française

Veuillez cliquer ici pour voir la vidéo d'introduction en français.
Le Qi Gong (prononcer "Tchi Gong") est un moyen facile et accessible:- d'exercer votre corps- d'améliorer votre santé et votre longévité- d'évacuer vos toxines- de réduire votre stress- d'améliorer votre circulation sanguine et énergétique- de rétablir la balance entre votre Yin et votre Yang, entre les énergies de Feu et d'Eau, et entre votre esprit et votre corps.
Bonjour, mon nom est Rafael. Je suis Français et je passe six mois par an en Thaïlande, où j'enseigne le Qi Gong.J'ai 15 ans d’expérience et d’intérêt en bouddhisme et philosophie orientale, incluant Qi Gong, Tai Chi Chuan, taoïsme, théologie, méditation bouddhique et taoïste, et médecine naturelle.Ma formation comprend du Tai Chi Chuan, du Hatha Yoga, du Qi Gong, des enseignements bouddhiques, de la méditation bouddhique et du Reiki.
Le but de cette campagne est de produire une méthode de Qi Gong facile à apprendre pour vous permettre de pratiquer seul(e) dans votre vie quotidienne. Basée sur le stage de Qi Gong que j'enseigne depuis six ans, la méthose comprend des exercices de respiration et d'échauffement, des exercices de mouvement en postion debout, ainsi que des exercices à pratiquer en position assise (méditation).Cette «Méthode Élémentaire pour la pratique du Qi Gong» se présentera sous le forme d'une vidéo, avec un choix de plusieurs bandes sonores: voix off avec des instructions en anglais ou en français (pour les débutants), ou musique et sons de la nature (pour les étudiants avancés). La vidéo sera tounée en Haute Définition.Le livret de 24 pages l'accompagnant vous donnera également des instructions claires, avec des détails comme les positions à adopter, les principes à suivre, ainsi que plusieurs méditations assises.
En fait, vous aurez tout ce dont vous avez besoin pour votre pratique quotidienne ou hebdomadaire.
En cliquant ici, vous pouvez visiter mon site pour en savoir plus sur le Qi Gong.



Les fonds récoltés grâce à cette campagne serviront à payer :
- La production de la vidéo.
- Les frais de pressage du DVD.- Les frais d'impression du livret et de la jaquette du DVD.
- La vérification et la correction de la traduction anglaise par un traducteur professionnel.
- L'enregistrement de la voix off de la version anglaise de la vidéo par un natif anglais.
Toute somme restante (s'il en reste) sera utilisée pour ajouter des exercices supplémentaires et pour améliorer la présentation du livret et de la jaquette du DVD.


Il y a deux façons dont vous pouvez aider:
- vous pouvez sélectionner l'un de nos forfaits (aussi appelés contreparties) en haut de cette page à droite.
Toute contribution, même la plus petite, aidera à donner vie à ce projet. Vous pouvez également, si vous le souhaitez, ajouter une somme supplémentaire (du montant que vous voulez) au forfait choisi.
 -  et/ou vous pouvez parler de ce projet autour de vous. 
Partagez s'il vous plaît le lien de cette campagne sur les réseaux sociaux, sur votre site, votre blog ou par e-mail, en utilisant les outils de partage placés sous la vidéo en haut de cette page.

 




Voici la liste des Contreparties parmi lesquelles vous pouvez choisir. 
- FRAIS DE PORT GRATUITS dans le monde entier pour tous les objects physiques -

Credit
Votre nom apparaîtra au générique de fin de la vidéo en tant que donateur. (~7.5€)
 
 

Double Credit
Votre nom apparaîtra au générique de fin de la vidéo et dans le livret en tant que donateur. (~11.5€)
 
 
  

Digital Version
Vous recevrez un lien pour télécharger la vidéo et son livret. Vous pourrez alors les regarder / lire autant que vous le voudrez sur votre ordinateur, télévision, tablette ou téléphone. + Contrepartie "Double Credit".(~27.75€)
   

Printed Version
Vous recevrez par la poste le DVD de la vidéo et son livret. + Contrepartie "Double Credit".(~42.80€)
 
 

Printed + Digital
 Le "Tout en Un". Contreparties "Digital version" +"Printed Version" + "Double Credit".(~53.85€)
 
 
 

Live + Printed + Digital
Venez me rencontrer à Koh Chang, Thaïlande pour un stage de 3 jours (de Mai à Décembre, valable pour 1 ou 2 personnes). + Contreparties "Digital version" + "Printed Version" + "Double Credit".(~192€)

Voici quelques bonus que vous obtiendrez si nous dépassons notre objectif:
À 6000 $ j'ajouterai deux méditations de Qi Gong à la section Pratique Assise du livret.Toute personne ayant contribué à une Contrepartie "Digital Version" et au dessus les obtiendra gratuitement.
À 8000 $, j'ajouterai deux fichiers audio de méditations guidées à télécharger. Toute personne ayant contribué à une Contrepartie "Digital Version" et au dessus les obtiendra gratuitement.
À 10000 $, j'ajouterai deux exercices, montrant comment travailler avec des sons, à la section Pratique Assise du livret. Toute personne ayant contribué à une Contrepartie "Digital Version" et au dessus les obtiendra gratuitement.
D'autres bonus supplémentaires pour dépassement des objectifs seront ajoutés au cours de la campagne.
 
Merci de votre attention et j'espère qu'ensemble nous pourrons donner vie à ce projet.

story:
Short Summary

Crowds, schedules, the immediacy of once-a-year events and other stressors common at conventions and expos can be triggers for many emotional issues, especially anxiety and depression. People dealing with mental health issues (and even many who aren't) rely on the Take This AFK Rooms for taking a break and escaping the bustle of a crowded con. If Take This can't reach its funding goal to provide these AFK Rooms, most of the attendees, exhibitors, and staff who rely on these rooms will left to fend for themselves.

More than a quiet room, the Take This AFK Room is a calming space for people who need it, staffed with volunteers and clinicians who can answer questions and offer support for people who are stressed out. Some visitors simply need a break from the excitement and stimulation of a large event. Others seek conversation about mental health related issues. Still others check in to support us and our mission. We are happy to meet you all.

Since Spring 2014, Take This has hosted AFK Rooms at every North American PAX event, with around 500 visitors per day. Starting in 2015, the AFK Room has been available at every PAX worldwide, and we’ve brought it to many other events as well.


 

The Impact

Over 2,000 people just in 2016 visited AFK Rooms at conventions worldwide. And many attendees tell us they are more likely to attend a con if it has an AFK Room.

Here is what some of our visitors have to say about their experiences in the AFK Rooms (all feedback is anonymous and unsolicited):

 

"I love it... I wish I knew about it earlier."

 

"AFK room is a godsend."

 

"It was such a great place to get away from the hustle and bustle of PAX. The staff were extremely friendly and very easy to talk to."

 

"For me, I go into conventions knowing I'll get anxious with the amount of people and flow of things. It's great that this place is available. My boyfriend almost had an anxiety attack from it all but we were able to regain our calm rather quickly in this space. "

 

"As someone dealing with Sensory Integration Disorder/Sensory Processing Disorder, just knowing there is a quiet and accepting place in the convention center gives me much more freedom and comfort in how far I can push myself in what would otherwise be a pretty hostile (but fun and important to me) environment. Thank you so much."

 

Where the Money Goes

Take This is a small organization, and we run a tight ship. That having been said, running a traveling mental health educational and awareness-raising clinic year-round, across the globe is an expensive proposition.

We're asking for $200,000.

That covers establishing an AFK Room at the 7 major conventions we attend every year, plus bringing on up to five additional conventions within the next year.

Some of the major conventions where we manage an AFK Room are able to reimburse Take This for our costs (airfare, hotels, feeding people, licensed mental health workers, printing, coloring books, and other materials), but most of them aren't able to do so. And many of the smaller, less well-endowed conventions actually require more of our time and resources. So expanding the AFK Program to new conventions gets real expensive real fast.

Here's a quick breakdown of what it takes to run a Take This AFK Room:

  • Assessment: Before even starting to establish an AFK Room, Take This sends an Assessment Team to visit the convention and meet its organizers. There are many factors which might make a convention incompatible with the Take This mission, and this assessment period is vital to ensuring that our volunteers and visitors will get the care and protection they need. The Take This team then conducts a thorough analysis of a given convention, how an AFK Room will benefit the convention's attendees, and how the Take This team can work with that convention's staff to make the show more welcoming to attendees with mental health issues.
  • Recruitment: This step is the hardest. For every city where Take This hosts an AFK Room, we must establish a brand new network of like-minded clinicians and begin recruiting and training for staffing the AFK Room. Our AFK Room is fully staffed with mental health care workers, many of them licensed to practice in their particular state. Take This will often recruit a clinical coordinator, someone who is a veteran care worker in their area who can help recruit like-minded clinicians. We then thoroughly vet each care worker to ensure they are compatible with our mission and our gamer community, then conduct a series of training sessions to prepare them for staffing the AFK Room. Many of our first-time clinicians have never been to a gaming convention, and we must prepare them not only for the tasks they will be required to perform for us, but in some cases the disorientating cultural shock of immersing themselves in a convention for the first time. 
  • Consulting: One of the lesser-known aspects of the AFK Program is our work with convention staffs in training them how to provide basic attention to attendees, exhibitors, and fellow staff members dealing with mental health issues. This training was at one time optional, but has since become mandatory (at our convention partners' requests) at every convention where Take This manages an AFK Room. This training session provides not only basic mental health awareness, but simple and effective techniques and tools for helping everyone have a better experience at a convention.
  • Set-up: The weeks prior to a convention, the Take This team gathers its training materials, AFK Room amenities (like coloring books, stress squeezers, facial tissue, etc.), volunteer t-shirts, radios, gaff tape, sharpies, and more, loads up "the Big Box" and ships out to the city where we are working. The Take This team is located all over the country — and so are our materials. Transport (for both people and things) is one of our biggest costs. We must then establish a livable space for our team and volunteers for the week of an event.

Our "hard costs" for running an AFK Room (airplane tickets, hotel rooms, clinician compensation, equipment, etc.) average at around $10,000 per show, and in some cases even more. To compensate and feed our Take This staff members during the week spent working and living away from their families adds roughly $5,000 per show. 

Which means that to accommodate just the seven events already on our recurring AFK schedule costs Take This over $100,000 per year. And most of those costs are not reimbursed by our partner conventions. 

To add additional conventions to the AFK Program requires months of prep work and unavoidable start-up costs, bringing the total for a first-time AFK Room closer to $20,000. 

Meeting our campaign goal will allow Take This to fully-fund the AFK Program for an entire year, serving our seven existing partner shows, and expanding the program by up to five new shows in a year.

What You Get

Our perks for this campaign are stellar. A combination of Take This merch and offerings form our many awesome partners.

  • Sticker: This is our emblem of hope! Place it anywhere you need a reminder you are not alone.
  • Psychomancer Pin: The Psychomancer is based on a character created by our friend Kay Fedewa for the Habitica app. It is our protector, and mascot for the AFK Room. This pin was originally designed for PAX Aus 2016 and is a collectible Pinny Arcade pin.
  • Plush: The Psychomancer! In plush! Hug it, squeeze it, let it bestow upon you the blessing of hope.
  • Tote Bag: Emblazoned with the Take This logo, the humble tote bag can do all kinds of things — but mostly it will carry your stuff. This one will come filled with pile of Take This swag, making it far better than the average tote bag.
  • Exclusive Wyrmwood Hope Shield: The "Shield of Tranquility" was designed by our friends at Wyrmwood Gaming as an exclusive, limited-edition reward specifically for this fundraiser. You cannot get this anywhere else. Made of beautiful Ambrosia Maple and inlaid with soothing Turquoise, the Shield of Tranquility is suitable for carrying in your pocket as a reminder you are not alone, or for giving as a gift to anyone you feel might need hope or tranquility.
  • Special Pinny Arcade Pin: Designed by the geniuses at Penny Arcade, this pin will be available for sale at a future PAX event, but can be yours for donating to this fundraiser. This is a preview of the original art by Mike Krahulik - the final pin design will be revealed soon. This is a collectible Pinny Arcade pin!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

For more about the Take This AFK Room, or emotional first aid certification, please contact info@takethis.org.

If you are a mental health care practitioner and would like to volunteer for the AFK, please fill out our volunteer form here: http://www.takethis.org/volunteer/

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

This is a preview of the original art by Mike Krahulik - the final pin design will be revealed soon. This is a collectible Pinny Arcade pin!


 

Other Ways You Can Help
For more about the Take This AFK Room, or emotional first aid certification, please contact info@takethis.org.
If you are a mental health care practitioner and would like to volunteer for the AFK, please fill out our volunteer form here: http://www.takethis.org/volunteer/

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Moving Forward with the Feldenkrais Method: Flexibility, Balance and Pain Relief for Seniors

The Feldenkrais Foundation is raising money to bring our 12-class series, Moving Forward with the Feldenkrais Method, to senior centers throughout New York City:

  • The Feldenkrais Foundation is a non-profit organization founded in 2008 to promote greater awareness and exposure to the Feldenkrais Method, focusing specifically on low-income neighborhoods and individuals who would not be able to afford this service otherwise.
  • These classes, specifically designed for the senior population, have been proven to help seniors with balance, pain management, and mobility.
  • Your donation will help us better the lives of hundreds of seniors who would otherwise have no access to classes.

What We Need & What You Get

What does this series cost?:

  • Every series of 12 classes costs the Feldenkrais Foundation over one thousand dollars.  The Foundation provides one lead teacher and one assistant teacher at every site, as well as printed materials and props for class.
  • Donors will receive the following perks for each donation level (all tax deductible):
  1. A Life in Movement - Moshe Feldenkrais Biography (donate $100 or more)
  2. Audio recording of a Feldenkrais lesson (donate $75 or more)
  3. Free Feldenkrais Workshop at the Feldenkrais Institute of New York (donate $250 or more)
  4. Individual Feldenkrais Treatment Session at the Feldenkrais Institute (donate $500 or more)
  • All funds raised will go towards creating more programming for senior citizens throughout New York City.

The Impact

How our campaign will make a difference:

  • Feldenkrais is gentle, easy to do, and the benefits can be immediate, making it a great modality for the older adult.
  • The Feldenkrais Foundation has run this class series in three boroughs and in over 15 different senior centers.  Our wonderful client testimony speaks for itself: "I am deeply impressed by the Feldenkrais exercises. I am 78 years old and can’t handle most exercise programs. But, the Feldenkrais exercises are the most effective, easy to follow system I have ever tried. It is amazing how quickly there is an improvement." –Edith W
  • A recent study facilitated by David Zemach-Bersin (Founder and President of the Feldenkrais Foundation) and Carolyn Palmer (Certified Feldenkrais Practitioner) indicates that those who attended the Moving Forward program for a 6 or 12-week series showed better balance and flexibility.  In addition to offering older adults valuable balance and flexibility practice, Feldenkrais Moving Forward classes also provide neuromuscular support for improving movement in many aspects of daily life and self-use. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute monetarily, there are other ways to help:

  • Tell your friends about these classes and this campaign! For a schedule of current classes, visit our website www.feldenkraisfoundation.org
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools and share, share, share on social media!

story:
WE'VE REACHED OUR FIRST GOAL!

NOW IT'S TIME FOR IN DEMAND CONTRIBUTIONS!

 

                                   

Making Food Fun for Everyone!!

 

Our Mission

To make food fun for everyone again and again. Dietary restrictions don't have to be isolating. Food can taste good and BE good for everyone at the table! A healthy balance in life is the goal and it starts with what you put in your body. Our show teaches the audience how to cook with love and health in mind. It's specifically for those with food allergies and other dietary needs, but truly, it's for EVERYONE. Because everyone loves to gather around food and share wonderful times together with friends and family!

Backing this campaign with your donations and shares on social media and in emails will help us keep the momentum going and grow even larger by covering production costs for 2017. For a show that started as a "let's try this" and has turned into a cause, there is nothing more valuable than "bridge builders" like you!

Take a look at what you would be building: Allergy Actress Cooking YouTube Trailer

The Story Behind the Show

Allergy Actress Cooking keeps the joy in cooking, even for those with extensive dietary restrictions! When I was diagnosed with 7 different severe food allergies and over 20 other food sensitivities, I thought food would never be fun or tasty again. I felt lonely and frustrated (and a bit peckish). Eating yummy food shouldn't have to end in a trip to the emergency room. It got me to thinking, how can I help? As I was figuring out how to make an impact as an actress in the industry, my acting coach asked me “What makes you stand out? How do you make an impact?” My response-my personality and my food allergies. Everyone from fellow actors to showrunners approached me about my dietary restrictions on set and how I took care of myself. It was not just on set, I’ve had family and friends asking for help for years on how to cook for a loved one with allergies or how to eat a little cleaner in their own lives. So I figured, the best way to help as many people as I could eat better food and learn how to safely cook for others was to show them! Now I bring you 15 years of experience switching, swapping and experimenting to anyone who suffers from restrictive dietary intolerances. After starting out with just a video camera and a can-do attitude, I'm excited to announce I've been picked up for distribution! It is so exciting to have the opportunity to reach a bigger audience, but this means I have to be bigger, too. Which means out of pocket production costs for the first year of distributing until a larger audience is established.

Distributors Allergy Actress Cooking Just Signed With:

      

 

Check out our Facebook page!

Pledges and Rewards

Below is a chart of a few of our perks for donating. There are many more, but here are a few of the tiers!

 

The Campaign

Here is a breakdown of what the goal money raised will be spent on and a timeline for the campaign and show! 

As you can see in the chart above, $5000 will pay to hire crew members such as my editor, director of photography, camera operator, and producer. $850 will go toward equipment needs, including microphones and camera rigs. $1000 will go towards purchasing ingredients for each of the 40 episodes we plan to shoot this year, and $150 is for administrative fees.

Flex Goals:

We have surpassed our first $7,000 goal and our first flex goal of $7,500! We have now moved into the  In Demand phase. This means our page stays open for contributions! We have several flex goals in place.

1) $7,500 gets another crew member, a Production Assistant, for the show!

2) $9,500 gets a sound crew member for the show!

3) $10,500 gets a Grip for the show. This crew member can work lighting!

4) $12,000 brings us a second camera operator

5) $14,000 allows us to purchase updated cooking equipment.

6) $22,000 will take us (Our core team only) on the road for a Midwest road trip series of 4 episodes.

 

Our Timeline

February- Campaign launched on the 13th while new episodes are being released. Previously aired episodes can be found on our YouTube channel.

March- Campaign ends on the 13th and perks are being processed! Previously aired episodes continue being aired on Youtube with one new episode airing on March 19th just after the original campaign has ended.

April- Perks are sent out via email, social media, and regular mail! 4 Episodes of AAC air weekly on TV tibi and Youtube. Akyumen TV launches the series.

May-December: A new weekly episode will air on Akyumen TV and TV tibi!

 

                       Follow us on Instagram!

Your contribution goes to reaching more people with painful and frustrating diseases, and gives them the opportunity to make their lives so much better every day. You're helping a guy with a lactose allergy relax and enjoy the football game with his buddies. You're giving a boyfriend a chance to make Valentine's Day pancakes for his girlfriend with Celiac's disease. You're giving joy to a vegan with a soy allergy because she will get to enjoy Thanksgiving dinner with her family. You're making a little girl with an egg and gluten allergy the star of her class for the day because she gets to bring cupcakes to school that her whole class will enjoy.

This isn't just a TV show, it's a cause. It's a way to turn something terrible into something more than tolerable, with a little knowledge and a lot of laughs. Good food, good friends, great health.

Our Team

Mary Beth Eversole is the creator, host, and executive producer of AAC. She is an actress, voiceover artist, and musician living in Los Angeles and she loves to cook! Her need to feed herself and her desire to touch other peoples lives through her craft led her to create Allergy Actress Cooking in hopes that it would bring some ease to a diagnosis that can often be a very difficult change to life. Having worked with so many wonderful special guests on her show already, she hopes to expand the show to encompass all dietary needs in an effort to contribute to educating about maintaining a healthy life balance without feeling deprived of what life has to offer. Previous credits in the industry include: a starring role in the multiple award winning feature film "Glimpse" (soon to be out on Amazon), supporting roles in award winning short films "Morning Announcements" (aired on World Humanitarian Day in Geneva at the UN) and "You + Me" (Cannes Film Festival selection 2016 and now in worldwide distribution), and several featured and guest star roles on television in such shows as "My Crazy Ex" on Lifetime and "Parents Just Don't Understand" on the HUB Network. You can see more of Mary Beth's work at www.marybetheversole.com

 

Kätlyn and Roman Cuilla-Martinez are the awesome couple I have the privilege of being friends with and working with on this ambitious project! I love them to pieces and here is more about who they are and what they do!

Roman Cuilla Martinez is an editor working in Los Angeles, CA. His recent credits include a documentary short on Privatized Prison Healthcare (Tyler Tabor, A Life Lost), A series about inclusion for individuals with learning disabilities (Life Happens), and a narrative comedy series about a delusional starlet (Poolside Chats). He is also an accomplished director and illustrator, having worked with clients such as Travel Channel, The Dead Files, Chick-fil-a, and Yoga With Adriene. He is the current editor for Allergy Actress Cooking and will be the Director of Photography for future episodes. View his work here: www.romanlcmartinez.com

Kätlyn Cuilla-Martinez  is a producer and filmmaker working in Los Angeles, CA and is a producer for Allergy Actress Cooking. She's good at what she does, which is not writing single-paragraph professional bios, because she's very elaborate and totally unprofessional. She has been described as draconian, cantankerous, and bellicose by those who know her best. You can find her acting work at www.thatangrygirl.com and her number in the phonebook.

Volunteer Shout Outs

I have had the honor of working with several volunteers on this project over the past year. I would be remiss if I did not mention their names here:

Peter Borosh: Director of Photography for 6 soon to be released episodes

Brad Etter: Director of Photography for the campaign video and two other AAC projects

Ginger Pauley: She helped me get distribution for the show!

Steve Dalke: Camera operator for 1 episode

LauraLee O-Shell: Camera operator, PA, host of campaign launch party, and overall awesome helper with whatever I need.

Tatiana Andrea Lopez Scott: Camera operator for 2 episodes

Angela Powers Dubnow: PA for 1 episode

Kevin Lee: Camera operator for 2 episodes

Thank you to all of you who have donated your time and expertise to this project! A special thank you to all of my guests on the show, we wouldn't be where we are today without the stories, recipes, and joy you brought to the show! And a special thank you to the location we get to use for almost every shoot, without your kitchen, we'd be stuck in mine (and we all know what that looks like haha!).

To all of you who will be donating your funds, your time, your social media shares, your love: Thank You, Thank You, Thank You.....from the bottom of our hearts. Now let's go GROW a production and change some people's lives!!

story:
Founder Bio: 

I'm Madison Eker, the founder of Sum of Us Festival. I've worked in womxn’s nightlife for the past 10 years, using my expertise and influence to help strengthen the community through lgbtq+ events. Born into the personal development industry as the daughter of author T. Harv Eker, my lifelong experiences in production, operations, and marketing has allowed me to run events ranging from 2000-5000 participants. When I started Sum of Us, my goal was to combine my various experiences within the event production industry in order to harmonize mindfulness, wellness, and authenticity in a positive, empowering space. 
 

What We Stand For:

  • Zero Judgement: There are no prerequisites for participation in our community. We welcome diversity and embrace individuality.

  • EveryBody is Beautiful: We do not believe in the societal concepts that narrow the scope of ‘beauty.’ We appreciate bodies for their function and view all bodies as beautiful.

  • Open Minds, Open Hearts: Our community encourages growth by being open to new ideas and activities. With an extended heart, we view connection and vulnerability as strength.

  • Leave No Trace: We respect the environment, and aim to leave borrowed land in a better state than when we found it.

  • Consent Culture: We treasure consent by asking for permission, and only continue with any action when a verbal 'yes' is given.

  • Choose Your Own Medicine: We have the freedom to choose and discover what methods of healing work best for us as we move towards wellness, and growth.
     
  • Creative Self-Expression: Our community encourages creativity in all of its forms as a means of expression, self-discovery, and healing.
     
  • Learn From Everyone, Follow No One: We view everyone as a ‘teacher.’ We critically think about the knowledge we receive and become our truest, most authentic selves.
     
  • Intersectional Feminism: We stray away from the segregations that patriarchal institutions have created. Instead, we intersect class, race, sexual orientation, gender, etc through feminism.
     
  • Community Collaboration: Our individuality, unique talents, and knowledge add to the larger whole of our community. We encourage collaboration in the presence of one another.

What We Aim To Do:

Our goal is to bring overall wellness to the womxn, trans, and non-binary communities with an expected first-year attendance ranging from 500-1000 participants. Sum of Us has carefully selected the top educators from around the globe to lead daytime workshops ranging from yoga, body positivity, activism, fitness, artistic expression, and much more. In doing so, our primary goal is to showcase that the strength within community rests in mindfulness, awareness, education, and the willingness to grow together. We want to offer an environment where like-minded individuals can connect through wellness in all of its aspects; emotional/creative, physical, and mental.

We are fortunate to have accrued notable facilitators and artists who have amassed large fan bases. Some of our leading facilitators and artists are:

  • Katie Sowers - NFL Coach and LGBTQ+ Activist
  • Tori Deal - Reality TV Personality and Mindfulness Coach
  • Eli Erlick - Founder of TSER and Transgender Activist
  • Mads Paige - Non-Binary Model and Musician
  • Allison Tibbs - Women's Health Magazine Action Hero and Healthy Lifestyle Coach
  • Jacq The Stripper - Sex Work Advocate, Illustrator, and Clothing Designer
  • SUMif - Music Artist

...and much more. Our total social media influence (Instagram, Facebook, Youtube) has a reach of over three million people.

Our outreach is not only impactful on the larger womxn, trans, and non-binary community, but will also grow the economic prosperity of Waterford, CA where our festival is located. Our idyllic venue creates a city escape, where we support local food trucks and vendors to serve at our festival. At our venue, festival goers can take a break from workshops and enjoy paddle boarding and kayaking in the beautiful reservoir water or save their energy for the night time musical performances. We have partnered with Sound Off Experiences, where participants can dance, laugh, and partake in our unique silent disco.

Beyond our local support, Sum of Us is an emerging social impact organization, and portions of our net profit will be donated to the registered nonprofit wayOUT, an LGBTQ+ youth empowerment organization. 

Why We Need Your Help:

Sum of Us Festival provides life-changing experiences that allow US to educate, connect, and grow together. Our first annual festival will take place from May 15th - 17th 2020 at Modesto Reservoir Regional Park, in Waterford, CA. 

Sum of Us wants to keep the integrity of the festival in line with our vision. In order to ensure that our festival is safe, efficient, and of the highest quality possible, we need your help to cover the following costs:

  • Venue Costs
  • Security Management
  • Operations and Logistic Team
  • Permit Sanctions

Our founder has gone through a strenuous journey to make this event possible, taking out her 401K to start this pivotal festival. Our budget is small, but our vision is large. We have put everything we have into this festival because we know our vision matters. We believe bringing people together in wellness creates positive change in people's lives forever.

Perks:

By funding our campaign, you not only support our goal but get the chance to choose from a series of personalized perk options. Our amazing festival facilitators and sponsors have kindly worked with us to put together unique, life-altering packages.

Our perks with the lowest price point are two one-of-a-kind guided online meditation sessions led by Kaylynn Marisol, our top Body Image Mentor and Facilitator!

  • $27 - Self-Worth Online Meditation: A beautiful guided meditation to open up your heart chakra and send loving energy throughout your entire body. Listen to this as often as you need as you learn to embody and honor your whole self. This meditation is great for anyone on a journey to self-love and acceptance.
     
  • $27 - Zen Zone Calming Meditation: A fluid meditation designed to help ground you when you feel uneasy, restless or anxious. Sometimes we just need help reconnecting with our center and reminding ourselves how safe we are within our vessel. This meditation is designed to help breathe through the discomfort until you find yourself deep in the zen zone.

Kaylynn will also be offering 30-minute personalized mentor calls where you will discuss body acceptance and self-love.

  • $67 - Body Acceptance Package: In a world designed to make money off self-hate, it can be difficult to find the energy or willingness to accept ourselves exactly as we are. In this session, we will discuss concepts in the media designed to pull us further away from ourselves; advertising tactics, lack of body diversity, lack of representation, fatphobia etc. It is important that we understand how we got to a place of not accepting ourselves before we can work towards self-acceptance. Then, we will create a plan to reach body acceptance; mapping out the things you can do daily to recondition your mind, and fully accept yourself, as you are.
     
  • $67 - Self-Love Package: We often hear the term “self-love journey,” but where do we start? What can you do today to slowly help build an unbreakable bond between your mind, body and soul? This call will be focused on understanding what "being your own best partner" looks like, and mapping out the ways in which you can show up for yourself like you would your partner, your friend or family member. Are you ready to pursue your own heart? Kaylynn will help navigate this with you!

Our next price point tier focusses on coaching calls ranging in nutrition, lifestyle, focus and sex & relationships.

  • $99 - Nourishment Package: A 30-minute one on one coaching call with our specialized nutritionist Stephanie Papadakis, a Certified Holistic Nutrition Consultant, AIP Certified Coach, and Certified Grief Recovery Specialist. This call will help you create a “Customized health, nutrition, and lifestyle plan.” You will be asked questions about your current diet, lifestyle and health status in order to make thoughtful suggestions regarding diet. Stephanie will also suggest small but helpful lifestyle changes to make you, your best self.
     
  • $99 - Focus for Success: A 30-minute high-impact, action-based, coaching session to radically improve your success and your life. You will work with a One Focus Total Success expert coach to get to the source of your personal challenges (past and present) and the very specific results you want to (and will) achieve in the very near future. Additionally, you’ll receive some amazing tips you can put into practice immediately!
     
  • $99 - Health Makeover: Creating a healthy lifestyle change can be frustrating when you don't have the clarity, structure or support needed. It can also be tough to identify what to do and where to start, let alone figuring out how to make changes that will fit into your current lifestyle. Allison Tibbs, our Healthy Lifestyle Facilitator has a specialized approach to Healthy Living that focuses on creating sustainable changes that are rooted in using intuition, authenticity, and passion to ensure that you not only stick to the changes but that you feel empowered and excited to make those changes.
     
  • $99 - Sex & Relationship Therapy: Two 20-minute sexpert calls with our top sex and relationship facilitator Elizabeth McGrath, a professor at UC Berkeley and Southwestern College. During these calls, you will receive the best advice on anything sex and relationship oriented. These "sex check-ups" are small sessions that will help build important tools to improve your sex-life, and relationships forever. Elizabeth is passionate about working with people beyond judgment from a place of acceptance and connection to create remarkable and lasting transformations.
     
  • $249 - Premium Coaching Package: With this premium package you will receive not one, not two, but three coaching calls from our experts. You will have the ability to have personalized coaching calls from our above experts in nutrition, lifestyle, and focus! On top of this amazing deal, you will also receive a guided online meditation class.

Our top tier package bundles include the best deal and items in our perks list!

  • $499 - Deluxe Festival Bundle: In this bundle package, you will receive 1 x general admission weekend wristband, access to the general admission camping zone, with a free one-hour paddleboard or kayaking voucher to be used at the event! You will also receive a guided online meditation link, with two personalised mentoring calls on self-love, and body acceptance!
     
  • $1299 - Premium Festival Bundle: In this premium bundle package, you will receive up to 8 x premium weekend wristbands, access to your premium full hook-up camping spot, with a free one-hour paddleboard or kayaking voucher to be used at the event! You will also receive a guided online meditation link, with two personalised mentoring calls on self-love, and body acceptance!

 

How You Can Get Involved:

  • Come to the festival
  • Spread the word to like-minded friends
  • Donate to our fund 

What Else You Can Do:

  • If you love our idea but are unable to attend the festival, or financially support us, please help us by spreading the word via word of mouth or social media (Instagram, and Facebook @SUMOFUSFEST)
  • Visit our website www.sumofusfest.com
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!
story_txt:
Founder Bio: I'm Madison Eker, the founder of Sum of Us Festival. I've worked in womxn’s nightlife for the past 10 years, using my expertise and influence to help strengthen the community through lgbtq+ events. Born into the personal development industry as the daughter of author T. Harv Eker, my lifelong experiences in production, operations, and marketing has allowed me to run events ranging from 2000-5000 participants. When I started Sum of Us, my goal was to combine my various experiences within the event production industry in order to harmonize mindfulness, wellness, and authenticity in a positive, empowering space.  What We Stand For:
Zero Judgement: There are no prerequisites for participation in our community. We welcome diversity and embrace individuality.
EveryBody is Beautiful: We do not believe in the societal concepts that narrow the scope of ‘beauty.’ We appreciate bodies for their function and view all bodies as beautiful.
Open Minds, Open Hearts: Our community encourages growth by being open to new ideas and activities. With an extended heart, we view connection and vulnerability as strength.
Leave No Trace: We respect the environment, and aim to leave borrowed land in a better state than when we found it.
Consent Culture: We treasure consent by asking for permission, and only continue with any action when a verbal 'yes' is given.
Choose Your Own Medicine: We have the freedom to choose and discover what methods of healing work best for us as we move towards wellness, and growth. 
Creative Self-Expression: Our community encourages creativity in all of its forms as a means of expression, self-discovery, and healing. 
Learn From Everyone, Follow No One: We view everyone as a ‘teacher.’ We critically think about the knowledge we receive and become our truest, most authentic selves. 
Intersectional Feminism: We stray away from the segregations that patriarchal institutions have created. Instead, we intersect class, race, sexual orientation, gender, etc through feminism. 
Community Collaboration: Our individuality, unique talents, and knowledge add to the larger whole of our community. We encourage collaboration in the presence of one another.
What We Aim To Do:Our goal is to bring overall wellness to the womxn, trans, and non-binary communities with an expected first-year attendance ranging from 500-1000 participants. Sum of Us has carefully selected the top educators from around the globe to lead daytime workshops ranging from yoga, body positivity, activism, fitness, artistic expression, and much more. In doing so, our primary goal is to showcase that the strength within community rests in mindfulness, awareness, education, and the willingness to grow together. We want to offer an environment where like-minded individuals can connect through wellness in all of its aspects; emotional/creative, physical, and mental.We are fortunate to have accrued notable facilitators and artists who have amassed large fan bases. Some of our leading facilitators and artists are:
Katie Sowers - NFL Coach and LGBTQ+ Activist
Tori Deal - Reality TV Personality and Mindfulness Coach
Eli Erlick - Founder of TSER and Transgender Activist
Mads Paige - Non-Binary Model and Musician
Allison Tibbs - Women's Health Magazine Action Hero and Healthy Lifestyle Coach
Jacq The Stripper - Sex Work Advocate, Illustrator, and Clothing Designer
SUMif - Music Artist
...and much more. Our total social media influence (Instagram, Facebook, Youtube) has a reach of over three million people.Our outreach is not only impactful on the larger womxn, trans, and non-binary community, but will also grow the economic prosperity of Waterford, CA where our festival is located. Our idyllic venue creates a city escape, where we support local food trucks and vendors to serve at our festival. At our venue, festival goers can take a break from workshops and enjoy paddle boarding and kayaking in the beautiful reservoir water or save their energy for the night time musical performances. We have partnered with Sound Off Experiences, where participants can dance, laugh, and partake in our unique silent disco.Beyond our local support, Sum of Us is an emerging social impact organization, and portions of our net profit will be donated to the registered nonprofit wayOUT, an LGBTQ+ youth empowerment organization. Why We Need Your Help:Sum of Us Festival provides life-changing experiences that allow US to educate, connect, and grow together. Our first annual festival will take place from May 15th - 17th 2020 at Modesto Reservoir Regional Park, in Waterford, CA. Sum of Us wants to keep the integrity of the festival in line with our vision. In order to ensure that our festival is safe, efficient, and of the highest quality possible, we need your help to cover the following costs:
Venue Costs
Security Management
Operations and Logistic Team
Permit Sanctions
Our founder has gone through a strenuous journey to make this event possible, taking out her 401K to start this pivotal festival. Our budget is small, but our vision is large. We have put everything we have into this festival because we know our vision matters. We believe bringing people together in wellness creates positive change in people's lives forever.Perks:By funding our campaign, you not only support our goal but get the chance to choose from a series of personalized perk options. Our amazing festival facilitators and sponsors have kindly worked with us to put together unique, life-altering packages.Our perks with the lowest price point are two one-of-a-kind guided online meditation sessions led by Kaylynn Marisol, our top Body Image Mentor and Facilitator!
$27 - Self-Worth Online Meditation: A beautiful guided meditation to open up your heart chakra and send loving energy throughout your entire body. Listen to this as often as you need as you learn to embody and honor your whole self. This meditation is great for anyone on a journey to self-love and acceptance. 
$27 - Zen Zone Calming Meditation: A fluid meditation designed to help ground you when you feel uneasy, restless or anxious. Sometimes we just need help reconnecting with our center and reminding ourselves how safe we are within our vessel. This meditation is designed to help breathe through the discomfort until you find yourself deep in the zen zone.
Kaylynn will also be offering 30-minute personalized mentor calls where you will discuss body acceptance and self-love.
$67 - Body Acceptance Package: In a world designed to make money off self-hate, it can be difficult to find the energy or willingness to accept ourselves exactly as we are. In this session, we will discuss concepts in the media designed to pull us further away from ourselves; advertising tactics, lack of body diversity, lack of representation, fatphobia etc. It is important that we understand how we got to a place of not accepting ourselves before we can work towards self-acceptance. Then, we will create a plan to reach body acceptance; mapping out the things you can do daily to recondition your mind, and fully accept yourself, as you are. 
$67 - Self-Love Package: We often hear the term “self-love journey,” but where do we start? What can you do today to slowly help build an unbreakable bond between your mind, body and soul? This call will be focused on understanding what "being your own best partner" looks like, and mapping out the ways in which you can show up for yourself like you would your partner, your friend or family member. Are you ready to pursue your own heart? Kaylynn will help navigate this with you!
Our next price point tier focusses on coaching calls ranging in nutrition, lifestyle, focus and sex & relationships.
$99 - Nourishment Package: A 30-minute one on one coaching call with our specialized nutritionist Stephanie Papadakis, a Certified Holistic Nutrition Consultant, AIP Certified Coach, and Certified Grief Recovery Specialist. This call will help you create a “Customized health, nutrition, and lifestyle plan.” You will be asked questions about your current diet, lifestyle and health status in order to make thoughtful suggestions regarding diet. Stephanie will also suggest small but helpful lifestyle changes to make you, your best self. 
$99 - Focus for Success: A 30-minute high-impact, action-based, coaching session to radically improve your success and your life. You will work with a One Focus Total Success expert coach to get to the source of your personal challenges (past and present) and the very specific results you want to (and will) achieve in the very near future. Additionally, you’ll receive some amazing tips you can put into practice immediately! 
$99 - Health Makeover: Creating a healthy lifestyle change can be frustrating when you don't have the clarity, structure or support needed. It can also be tough to identify what to do and where to start, let alone figuring out how to make changes that will fit into your current lifestyle. Allison Tibbs, our Healthy Lifestyle Facilitator has a specialized approach to Healthy Living that focuses on creating sustainable changes that are rooted in using intuition, authenticity, and passion to ensure that you not only stick to the changes but that you feel empowered and excited to make those changes. 
$99 - Sex & Relationship Therapy: Two 20-minute sexpert calls with our top sex and relationship facilitator Elizabeth McGrath, a professor at UC Berkeley and Southwestern College. During these calls, you will receive the best advice on anything sex and relationship oriented. These "sex check-ups" are small sessions that will help build important tools to improve your sex-life, and relationships forever. Elizabeth is passionate about working with people beyond judgment from a place of acceptance and connection to create remarkable and lasting transformations. 
$249 - Premium Coaching Package: With this premium package you will receive not one, not two, but three coaching calls from our experts. You will have the ability to have personalized coaching calls from our above experts in nutrition, lifestyle, and focus! On top of this amazing deal, you will also receive a guided online meditation class.
Our top tier package bundles include the best deal and items in our perks list!
$499 - Deluxe Festival Bundle: In this bundle package, you will receive 1 x general admission weekend wristband, access to the general admission camping zone, with a free one-hour paddleboard or kayaking voucher to be used at the event! You will also receive a guided online meditation link, with two personalised mentoring calls on self-love, and body acceptance! 
$1299 - Premium Festival Bundle: In this premium bundle package, you will receive up to 8 x premium weekend wristbands, access to your premium full hook-up camping spot, with a free one-hour paddleboard or kayaking voucher to be used at the event! You will also receive a guided online meditation link, with two personalised mentoring calls on self-love, and body acceptance!

Come to the festival
Spread the word to like-minded friends
Donate to our fund 
What Else You Can Do:
If you love our idea but are unable to attend the festival, or financially support us, please help us by spreading the word via word of mouth or social media (Instagram, and Facebook @SUMOFUSFEST)
Visit our website www.sumofusfest.com

story:
Swamiji's Plea for Support

We are working now to open the Soma Matha Spiritual Center and Shakambhari Devi Temple in Richmond, in the moth of July 2013.  This will be a sacred space for people to gather for support in their personal spiritual practice and to experience and study the Vedic sciences of healing and realization: Mantra, Meditation, Puja, Ayurveda, Vedic Astrology and much more.  Please, friends, help in whatever ways you can to support this worthy project to its successful completion by donating generously and volunteering whatever time you can manage.  Our goal is to raise $50,000  by July 1st; we have already raised about $20,000.  We urgently need more donations to meet our goal to open the center by that time.  Please donate generously, spread the word to your friends, family, and acquaintances, and volunteer to help with this
charitable project.  We want to thank those who have donated already and who have supported our efforts through the years.  May we all make the most of this opportunity to give and serve for the peace of the world.  Jai Matadi!

 

Soma Matha Spiritual Center

The Soma Matha is the first of Four Mathas (Monasteries) envisioned by Gananathamritananda Swamiji for the USA. Swamiji is working to train Sannyasins (cloistered Hindu monastics) who will be the patrons of the Four Mathas. The Sannyasins (Monks and Nuns) of the Shuklabhadra Sampradaya (Spiritual Lineage) have been charge with the task of conducting a 1000 Year Yajnam (Fire Ceremony) for the upliftment of consciousness and the peace of the three worlds. To learn more about the four Mathas of the Shukla Bhadra Lineage

The Soma Matha will be maintained in time by Swaminis (Hindu Nuns) who
have dedicated their lives completely to spiritual service and the quest for the Divine. The Swaminis of the Soma Matha have been charged with the spiritual task of revitalizing people's reverence for nature and teaching the mystical and healing properties of the sacred plants as handed down from the Sages in the ancient healing science of Ayurveda. Additionally they have been called to the task of helping to teach and preserve the Rik Veda (the most ancient of the four Vedas).

Other Ways You Can Help

You could also help us by spreading the word of Soma Matha Spiritual Center to your friends, relatives, and neighbours. Please share about this via Facebook or Twitter!

About Swamiji

Swamiji works to share the Light of God with spiritual seekers from all backgrounds.  He is the founder and Spiritual Director of the Soma Matha Spiritual Center and Shakambhari Devi Temple in Richmond, Virginia, USA.  Svamiji works ceaselessly for the peace of the world by offering spiritual teachings and blessings to all who approach.  He is considered a master of the Vedic sciences of Mantra, Yantra, Puja, Yajnam, Ayurveda, and Jyotisha.  He teaches these ancient mystical sciences for the preservation of the unbroken tradition of Vedic knowledge and provides spiritual initiations, after traditional preparations, to sincere seekers for the realization of God.

 

More Information

Visit Our Website: http://www.somamatha.org

Visit Our FaceBook Page: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Soma-Matha/387071311379430

Visit Our Twitter Page: https://twitter.com/SomaMatha

story:
From Dr. Rosalind Ambrose, President of the SVG Medical Association:

 

Our Patients Need A Lifeline

I am Dr.Rosalind Ambrose, President of the St.Vincent and the Grenadines Medical Association, who annually for the past 11 years, have forged a powerful public campaign for building awareness about breast and prostate cancer. Therefore, we decided to "put our Strengths together". My campaign is one of great significance, because it seeks to acquire  financial contributions to establish an oncology centre here in St. Vincent and the Grenadines.  Currently, the cost is prohibitive and access to treatment centres (typically Trinidad) becomes an even costly venture. The magnitude of the contribution is potentially large,  because the cost of chemotherapy agents alone is very prohibitive for most patients.  Added to this is the cost of travelling to Trinidad which is the most accessible location. Patients commonly default and DIE as a result.  However, our organisation sees the way to change that awful dynamic - we must establish an Oncology Treatment Centre - here at home to Throw a Lifeline to our Cancer patients. 

What We Need & What You Get

We believe that we can get off the ground with approximately $250,000USD for the number of patients who are waiting to be assisted.  Although our location would need beds, and all the necessary furnishings for the conducive treatment atmosphere, we believe that we can solicit some of those from friendly local (and diaspora) sources.  The major part of the funding will go towards the purchase of chemotherapy agents, consumables and staffing--although we anticipate that some staffing would be voluntary.  We are continuing our search for cheaper sources in the meantime.

We have a visible  'track-record' of  bringing successful projects to a positive end. We are aiming to improve the survival rate of breast and prostate cancer patients.  Trust is demonstrated in other community services which our organisation has been providing over the years.  We have a long and credible history of administering funding to the directed source.

COME and visit. Our unique perks can be seen in the video - A country where our perspective contributors and investors can come to relax, where people can truly have the natural ambience to recuperate. Warm hospitable communities will be grateful for the survival of their friends, neighbours, relatives who are affected by cancer but see HOPE literally - on the Horizon - right in their own backyard. They would be at home where family support is paramount.

If we don't reach our goal, we will continue to give that financial assistance to our cancer  patients - to assist as many of them as we can - in the manner of our 'historical  and ongoing' program of helping to pay for 'one treatment at a time'.  When that is exhausted, I suppose our survival 'statistical graph' will return to sad days we had BEFORE crowdfunding became our option and our HOPE. 

The Impact

The IMPACT is to give health and longevity to any 38 year old mother of 3 giving her a chance to see her kids grow up and to support them in every way that mothers dream about.  The IMPACT is to see a father being available and able to be sufficiently healthy and well to watch his sons and daughters graduate from high school, college and university.  To continue to be the breadwinner HE has always dream about, TO GIVE FAMILIES HOPE , HEALTH, and a FUTURE. We aim to improve the quality of life and to SAVE LIVES of the persons affected by breast and prostate cancer. 

Our organisation has a track record of success.  About 10 years ago, we championed a NO SMOKING Campaign. We were able to encourage businesses to post visible SMOKE-FREE  signs, we mounted billboards, and ran public service ads on local TV.  We received an award from PAHO-WHO for the great work that we did.

Please see our website (www.svgmeda.com)  for annual PINK CAP CITY WALK, and more recently our annual 5K run - which are fundraising drives. Because of our Breast Cancer Awareness program (1990 - present), women are better educated on Breast Self Examinations, better educated on what to look for in the breast, more women voluntarily present themselves for mammography each year.  Our problem is - that once diagnosed, and surgery has taken place, the COST & ACCESS to Oncology Treatment becomes a virtual Mt. Everest and patients are not able to cope with the cost of meds, cost of travel and daily cost of life demands for them and their families. THEN the big sacrifice steps in when they must chose between cost of treatment and demands on the family. They then default and die. 

Risks & Challenges

The greatest challenge we anticipate is when funds are not available for the purchase of specifically required chemotherapy agents. Often times, the TIMING for RECEIVING orders for medicines can become a problem, and them we must resort to using courier services which cost MORE for bringing into this type of merchandise into the country. We have concerns as well about the SUSTAINABILITY of the project, because our fundraising efforts  can NEVER really reach the budgets needed for a sustainable project.  The patients are NOT economically able to contribute what the financial needs really are for a centre of this kind.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please Throw Our Patients a LIFELINE ! If you are not able to contribute financially you can help us to "GET THE WORD ON" to other potential contributors, philanthropists, well-wishers. You can contribute valuable TIME to send out correspondence and connect with other hopeful contributors. Utilize the Indiegogo share tools and share with your network!

Also give us some prayers and supporting words. 

Thank you so much!

story:
How about those classic Dave hugs?

Did he drive you home late one night?
Did he step up out of nowhere and save your butt?
Did your crappy day suddenly turn better when you walked through the door and David came over with his patented tigger bounce walk, chin up and grinning, and hugged you like he hadn't seen you in 20 years?
There's not much more to say. 
We all know what kind of man David is.
Life has dealt a blow to yet another person who didn't deserve it. An accident occurred while riding his motorcycle. The details are not important and frankly, they are the private business of his family. 
All we need to know is that it is very serious and that he's improving.
We can't help him out of that bed. We all feel helpless. 
What we can do is skip one $5 coffee per week and give a gift to David.
We can pay him back for each one of those hugs.

How about those classic Dave hugs?
Did he drive you home late one night?Did he step up out of nowhere and save your butt?Did your crappy day suddenly turn better when you walked through the door and David came over with his patented tigger bounce walk, chin up and grinning, and hugged you like he hadn't seen you in 20 years?There's not much more to say. We all know what kind of man David is.Life has dealt a blow to yet another person who didn't deserve it. An accident occurred while riding his motorcycle. The details are not important and frankly, they are the private business of his family. All we need to know is that it is very serious and that he's improving.We can't help him out of that bed. We all feel helpless. What we can do is skip one $5 coffee per week and give a gift to David.We can pay him back for each one of those hugs.

story:
Short Summary

Garden Shark is a heartfelt documentary that captures how improv brings new hope and meaning to the lives of people affected by dementia. Help us fund an improv class for caregivers and the people they are caring for so we can share improv’s innate ability to remove expectations, celebrate one another and enhance communication.  

 

 

Garden Shark

Garden Shark follows Inside Out Theatre’s improv facilitators as they teach caregivers, medical professionals and family members the ability to live in the moment and learn to laugh in spite of the effects of the disease. The program is designed to give respite to at home caregivers while providing meaningful activities for people with dementia. The facilitators’ ability to communicate, listen to and laugh with the people participating in the program has inspired us to make it possible for caregivers to learn these skills as well!

 

 

What We Need

We need the funds to host, facilitate and film a free improv class for caregivers and the people they are caring for living with dementia. This will allow us to share the beautiful power of improv with our wider audience. 

 

 

Why Improv?

The beauty of improv is that it’s all about saying ‘YES, AND!’ and being present in the moment. Memory isn’t required and in improv’s failure-free environment, there are no bad ideas, only creative potential and a willingness to connect. For someone with memory loss, this is a very safe place to be. Even if confusion creeps in, the group just goes with it. Improv celebrates self-expression, removes judgment and reminds us of the powers of imagination and laughter. Improv allows us to see the individual, instead of the disease. 

“The goal of the program is to bring an hour of life, laughter, joy and creativity into the lives of folks dealing with a really difficult part of their life. And to do it in a way that sets them up for success. Create a program that plays to their strengths and identifies them as creative, intelligent, funny people.” - Col Cseke, co-creator of Inside Out Theatre’s Village Improv for Alzheimer’s Program (VIA)

 

 

Why is This Class so Important to the Documentary?

Throughout the filming of improv classes designed for those living with dementia, we’ve had the opportunity to witness these people being creative, collectively telling stories, stepping out of their comfort zones, making others laugh, trying things without judgement and communicating in new ways. The skills of improv can be learned and we want to give caregivers the opportunity to experience this with the people they are caring for. 

 

 

The Impact

“Currently, more than 42,000 Albertans are living with dementia. This number is expected to increase to more than 155,000 within 30 years. Dementia doesn’t just affect the person with the diagnosis, it also directly impacts 10 – 12 individuals. Most care to a person diagnosed is provided by a spouse or family member. Caregivers provide more than 18 million hours of unpaid care to Albertans living with dementia each year. By 2038, this number is expected to increase to 68 million hours if nothing changes.” - Gordie Howe C.A.R.E.S. 2017-18 Community Report

Improv is being identified as a tool to improve the lives of adults diagnosed with dementia. Raising awareness and promoting the adaptation of creative care, such as improv, throughout the healthcare system and at home is one of our ultimate goals. By supporting the people that are pioneering this form of care, Garden Shark can bring the local improv and other artist communities (music, poetry, painting) closer to those living with dementia. We also hope to inspire other communities, organizations and countries to consider improv and creative care as a means of medicine, connection and growth.

Improv is one of many forms of creative care and we would love for Garden Shark to redefine what it means to have dementia and bring hope to those faced with this difficult disease. 

 

 

“You treat a disease, you win, you lose. You treat a person, I guarantee you, you’ll always win, no matter what the outcome.” - Patch Adams

 

Meet the Team

Garden Shark Documentary

Dawn Nagazina - Producer

Anna Cooley - Director

Kara Artym - Cinematographer

Alex Mitchell - Location Sound Recordist

Chad Blain - Editor & Composer

Brendon Rathbone - Colourist

Tammy Mandelbaum - Assistant Producer

 

Inside Out Theatre

Col Cseke - Inside Out Theatre Artistic & Executive Director and Co-creator of Village Improv for Alzheimer’s Program

Karen Johnson-Diamond - Co-creator of Village Improv for Alzheimer’s Program

Jeremy Park - Community Programs Director & Improv Facilitator

Chris Gamble - Improv Facilitator

Michelle Brandenburg - Improv Facilitator

Jacqueline Russell - Improv Facilitator

 

Inside Out Theatre's improv program, Village Improv for Alzheimer's Club or The V.I.A. Program, is offered in partnership with the Alzheimer Society of Calgary.  Click here to learn more - https://vimeo.com/156290433.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us spread the word and raise awareness by sharing our story with your friends and family. 

You can follow, share and like us on social media and use the hashtag #GardenSharkDoc.  

 

Facebook: www.facebook.com/gardensharkdoc

Instagram: @gardensharkdoc 

Website: www.gardenshark.ca

 

Thank you so much for your support!

 

Sincerely,

Anna Cooley & Dawn Nagazina

Garden Shark Team

story:
The longest ongoing mindfulness camp for young people, the Tools for Peace Summer Teen Camp offers youth ages 12-16 a transformative, sleepaway experience rooted in practicing mindfulness and cultivating compassion.

What makes the TFP camp truly unique is the Stop, Breathe & Think Workshop. There, campers meet daily in dynamic small discussion groups and learn and practice mindfulness. They also connect with their peers in a safe and supportive environment.

In addition to mindfulness practice, we make lots of time for fun, exercise, and creativity. Daytime activities include art, sports, yoga, music, crafts, swimming, and the creation of a Community Sand Mandala. Evenings at camp are always a highlight for campers—with campfires, movie nights, and karaoke. And it all happens in the tranquil mountains of Tehachapi, California.

According to a 2005 study of 80 camps by the American Camp Association (ACA), there was a significant growth in children’s social-emotional skills after a session of summer camp. 

The Tools for Peace Summer Teen Camp takes this a step further, focusing on helping campers cultivate the skill of mindfulness. Mindfulness is shown to be effective in combating stress and supporting student achievement. Teens participating in Tools for Peace programs report they are better able to:

Measuring Success

The Emotion Regulation Lab at U.C. Riverside is researching the effects of our SB&T curriculum during Summer Teen Camp. Preliminary results show positive changes in campers’ emotion regulation, self-control, self-compassion, and their feelings of compassion toward others. 

Tools for Peace is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization that relies entirely on donations to facilitate camp and provide full scholarships to teens from low-income, disadvantaged communities in the Los Angeles and the Bay areas. Every camper who wants to attend will be able to, regardless of their ability to pay.

Donations fund:

  • Camper transportation to and from camp
  • Camp staff
  • Activities and supplies
  • Healthy food & the camp chef

 

Meet some of our current and former campers, and learn how the Tools for Peace Summer Teen Camp helped them.

Georgie's dream has always been to attend college, but she spends a lot of time worrying because she doesn’t have money for tuition.

“The prices in L.A. are very high. We have to be careful about our power bill, and I’ve been to the doctor only once or twice in my life. I’m drowning in school work, but I need a college scholarship. For a while, I was even considering not going to college, which made my grades drop a little.”

She says Tools for Peace and her time at camp are a big part of being able to cope.

“Camp’s been extremely helpful. When I’m feeling stressed, I know I can give myself a break. It’s O.K. to just stop, breathe, think and just relax. Camp also makes me more aware of what I have that is good. It filters all the bad out, and it’s a way to start a new beginning.

I’m so grateful to get scholarships to camp. The overall vibe of Tools for Peace is so welcoming. I discovered friendships and met people who will always have an impact on my life.”

When Siron was 6 years old, her family immigrated to the United States from the Middle East. As newcomers to the country, her family faced economic hardship and issues adapting. But life got really hard when Siron’s older brother was sent to jail. 

“My mom cried every day; my dad was bitter. I felt really alone and isolated. It was a deep dark hole that we dug ourselves into, especially me. And I didn’t have guidance.”

Because she didn’t know how to handle her strong feelings, Siron instead nurtured negative emotions. But camp helped her to deal with life's ups and downs.

“At camp, I learned to not look for external solutions but to look inside myself to find a solution. I felt like I wasn’t alone. Without a scholarship, I wouldn’t have been able to attend camp, and I really think my journey would have been stunted. Now I know, there’s nothing I can’t handle.”

Michelle spent her pre-teen years in and out of hospitals dealing with anxiety and depression. She found it difficult to relate to people, but camp changed her perspective.

“The Tools for Peace camp has given me the tools to learn how to work with people, not focus on the negative, and understand how different people and I have a lot in common.”

Recently, Michelle has also been diagnosed with autism and believes what she learned from Tools for Peace helped put her diagnosis into perspective.

“Tools for Peace really did help me as a person. I know that I am not my disorder; my disorder is just a small part of me. 

I hated everything to do with being social, but I can now step back and take a deep breath and realize everything will be O.K. Tools for Peace helped me cultivate that, and I credit them with my confidence and growth. I have friends and memories that will last a lifetime.”

 

Tools for Peace inspires people of all ages to develop kindness and compassion in everyday life.

Founded in 2000, Tools for Peace is a 501(c)(3) organization dedicated to strengthening and supporting emotional and social intelligence as well as academic and professional success. We envision a world where everyone is connected by kindness and compassion and have created our programs to make that vision a reality.

WE BELIEVE

  • Solutions to problems begin from within ourselves.
  • In the inherent ability of all people to develop positive connection to one another.
  • Our shared capacity for kindness and compassion connects us more deeply than appearance, status, geography or circumstances.
  • The ability to thrive is attainable by anyone, regardless of social or economic background.

WE VALUE

  • Compassionate and responsive engagement that meets people where they are.
  • Safe and open forums where people can speak with courage, honesty, and confidence.
  • The unique contribution of every individual.
  • Authenticity and respect in all our relationships.

What Campers Are Learning

Campers practice mindfulness through a process called Stop, Breathe & Think.

STOP: Stop what you are doing. Check in with what you are thinking and how you are feeling.

BREATHE: Practice mindful breathing to create space between your thoughts, emotions and reactions.

THINK: Broaden your perspective, and strengthen your force field of peace through mindful activities.

The Stop, Breathe & Think curriculum was created to provide teens with the skills and tools necessary to manage their level of stress, mitigate the resulting consequences, and to help students become successful in school and in life.

Try it out for yourself by downloading the award-winning Stop, Breathe & Think app, free for iOS or Android devices.

 

#InspireKindness by sharing this campaign with family and friends on social media.
