story:
Being a kid today is tough! Layer cyber-bullying and intense peer pressure on top of raging hormones and hours of homework, and it’s no wonder that 25% of teenagers struggle with anxiety.

The TouchPoint Solution founders were so moved by this issue that they developed TouchPoints, wearable devices that alleviate stress in as few as 30 seconds.

As a proud Club Alum TouchPoint CEO Vicki Mayo is partnering with BGCA Alumni program to give back to the organization that gave her so much. With this "Buy One, Give One" campaign, you can help integrate TouchPoints into clubs throughout the country while getting a tax deduction and stress relief for yourself!

TouchPoints are twin neuroscience wearables that provide calming vibrations for stressful situations. Derived from a successful component of EMDR therapy, TouchPoints use BLAST (bi-lateral alternating stimulation tactile) technology to passively reduce stress by over 70% in as few as 30 seconds while you go about your day. Reducing stress also helps to improve sleep quality, focus, and work or school performance - empowering you to live your best, less-stressed life. Learn more at ilovetouchpoints.com.

Together, we can cover the map and spread this stress-relieving technology to thousands of kids suffering from childhood anxiety. Your donation will touch the lives of hundreds of children at Clubs and help set them on the path to living their best lives because when they're less stressed, they're capable of achieving so much. This simple tool, backed by neuroscience research and technology, puts the power of stress relief in the palm of their hands.

Your contribution will be made even more meaningful because each week you'll get to vote to choose which state to send TouchPoints to. By the end of this campaign, we hope to bring stress relief to Clubs in every single state, starting with our home state of Arizona.

For more than 150 years, Boys & Girls Clubs of America has enabled young people most in need to achieve great futures as productive, caring, responsible citizens. Today, more than 4,300 Clubs serve nearly 4 million young people annually, providing a safe place for kids and teens to learn and grow. For an estimated 16 million Club alumni around the world, the Club was not only a second home, it was a game changer. In a Harris Survey of alumni, 54 percent said the Club saved their lives, propelling them to success. Learn more at www.BGCA.org.

TouchPoints are embedded with patent-pending bilateral alternating stimulation tactile (BLAST) technology derived from leading neuropsychologist and co-founder Dr. Amy Serin's decade's worth of research on managing anxiety in conjunction with EMDR therapy.

TouchPoints use BLAST in the form of gentle, alternating vibrations to alter the brain’s stress response and shift you into the logical, rational part of your brain - allowing you to think clearly and experience calm all within seconds. This also alleviates the body sensations associated with stress (ex. stomach ache, headache). The brain’s ability to restore calm creates new neural pathways - reducing future stress in similar situations.

 

Neuropsychologist Dr. Amy Serin has spent over a decade as an EMDR therapist researching methods and tools for managing stress and anxiety. She had a breakthrough realization that BLAST technology, a component of successful EMDR treatment for PTSD, could be actually be embedded in consumer-friendly wearable devices that could be used outside of the doctor's office to relieve stress anytime and anywhere. This discovery led to the creation of TouchPoints.

While helping Club kids, we want you to experience the powerful benefits of stress relief as well. With your donation, you can opt to gift a set of TouchPoints to a Club as well as gifting yourself a set to experience the calming sensations for yourself. This alternative stress relief tool can not only help you feel more calm and relaxed, but also can improve sleep, focus, and performance. Start introducing peace into your daily life, and see the difference it makes.

story:
Let's make Integrative Medicine, particularly East Asian Medicine (which includes acupuncture) more accessible in our hospitals and medical centers.  There are barriers to working in medical facilities.  The primary barrier has been that we are new to the system.  Often each time an Acupuncturist (EAMP) is hired, he or she is the first EAMP in the system, so the problem of "re-inventing the wheel" is common.  Learn more at https://youtu.be/ACD1jr2gfnY

Instead of existing in silos, this Project endeavors to create connections, community, and share wisdom.

We are creating a set of published resources and connecting hospital practitioners to resources already published, this work is a ladder over the barrier. You still need to get moving to climb it and land on the other side with your sponsor. But this work sets up your program/clinic so it is better poised for success, by learning from the wisdom of others.  This is what the Hospital Practice living resource aims to do.    We are building this resource.  

Mission:  Create a resource of basic standards and guidelines for hospital practice while creating community of hospital practice Acupuncturists to discuss standards, guidelines, best practices, and share wisdom.

Please help fund our 2017 projects

  1. Books, the Introduction to Hospital Practice book (print and e-book)
  2. Audiobook production of the Intro to Hospital Practice book
  3. The Hospital Practice Data Project with Diane Behall
    • creating a survey, surveying the hospital practice L.Ac. community, analyzing the data and following up with interviews to round out the story. 
  4. Webinar series--hosting a series of monthly webinar presentations on topics related to hospital practice
  5. Books, the Coding and Charting Manual for the Hospital Practice Acupuncturist (print and e-book)
  6. Website set up and basic yearly operating costs

Budget Estimate breakdown for each Project

Introduction to Hospital Practice print book and e-book

$3500 includes publishing costs, copywriter/editor costs, graphic design/illustrator costs

Megan's cost of authoring the work--gratis    See the video for more details here.

 

Audiobook production of Introduction to Hospital Practice book

$2500 covers cost of equipment, software, and estimated technical audio-correction cost (contractor)and cover image graphic

 

Hospital Data Project with Diane Behall

$1800.  We are asking for this amount in the campaign.  After these numbers were set, we have gotten some more specific estimates on costs of statisticians and biometrics consultants, and other costs, which go much above the $1800 original estimate.  So, if you are a business, foundation, or nonprofit looking to specifically fund this project, please contact me directly for the full budget and proposal.  Watch our video here .

 

Webinar Series

$1200 is estimated cost of hosting a record-able webinar for 12 months.  Watch project pitch here. 

 

Coding and Charting Manual print book and e-book

$5400 estimated cost includes cost of publishing, copyediting, and illustrations.  Graphics/illustrations for this project are more complicated than for the Intro to Hospital Practice book

 

Yearly Operational cost

$4600/yr.  Basic operating costs include website set up and hosting, costs of business licenses, use of phone and internet, printer, etc.   See more at the "why this project?" video.
story_txt:
Let's make Integrative Medicine, particularly East Asian Medicine (which includes acupuncture) more accessible in our hospitals and medical centers.  There are barriers to working in medical facilities.  The primary barrier has been that we are new to the system.  Often each time an Acupuncturist (EAMP) is hired, he or she is the first EAMP in the system, so the problem of "re-inventing the wheel" is common.  Learn more at https://youtu.be/ACD1jr2gfnYInstead of existing in silos, this Project endeavors to create connections, community, and share wisdom.We are creating a set of published resources and connecting hospital practitioners to resources already published, this work is a ladder over the barrier. You still need to get moving to climb it and land on the other side with your sponsor. But this work sets up your program/clinic so it is better poised for success, by learning from the wisdom of others.  This is what the Hospital Practice living resource aims to do.    We are building this resource.  Mission:  Create a resource of basic standards and guidelines for hospital practice while creating community of hospital practice Acupuncturists to discuss standards, guidelines, best practices, and share wisdom.Please help fund our 2017 projects

Webinar series--hosting a series of monthly webinar presentations on topics related to hospital practice
Books, the Coding and Charting Manual for the Hospital Practice Acupuncturist (print and e-book)

story:
I know, you're busy!

You're juggling work, family, friends, and finances - how could you even TRY to prioritize yourself in a time like this?

But really...how could you not?  

In order to take care of others, you need to take care of yourself.  And we're here to remind you to GoLoveYourself! every day!

GoLoveYourself! is the first monthly subscription box of it's kind, calling you to become the best possible version of yourself through professionally curated, thematic resources.  Each box contains:

  • one newly released or yet-to-be-released self-help book,
  • 2-3 resources to either help you put the strategies from the book into action or make it stick,
  • reading-experience-enhancers, such as tea, candles, or other self-care related items, and
  • access to additional resources, accountability and support through our online community.

 

This subscription box is all about helping you to be the best you you can be and reminding you to take time for yourself.

We are also the only monthly service that connects all subscribers in a Facebook forum to discuss the content of our books, share insights, hold each other accountable, and grow together as a learning community. 

 

 

Come on, Sharon, is this some kind of new frou-frou pamper box?!

No way!  Self-care may have recently caught on as an obsession with the millennial generation, but it's far from new.  The history of self-care is long, with its earliest documentation in Greek society, and with overlaps in activism, political resistance, psychology and medicine.  And this is more than self-care.  This is self-actualization. This is support and community while we're on our collective adventure (5 Steps to Pursue Self-Actualization). 

 

 

Discover a new idea each month!

Learn about yourself and the world around you as you gain new insights.

Change your thinking and change your habits as you focus solely on one area for the whole month.

Energize as you embrace vulnerability and connect with others about our experiences.

Join the movement!  

 

Not ready to dive in?  Consider helping me by:

  • gifting a box to the favorite reader in your life for the holiday/new year season!
  • buying a three month subscription for someone you love!
  • getting the word out! Send an email, share a tweet, repost on Facebook!

The purpose of this campaign is to:

  • determine interest levels for a service of this kind.  While a number of articles point to the demand for self-actualization products and services, there's no substitute for testing out the market.
  • share the campaign with a large audience.  

The desired impact:

  • normalize self-care, self-help, and self-actualization.
  • raise self-awareness and help people across the country to fulfill their potential.
  • cultivate a growing community of like-minded individuals to exchange resources, share experiences, and celebrate growth.

Funds from this campaign will be used to:

  • 70% - fulfill orders and rewards!  (All prices include shipping!)
  • 15% - fund business start-up costs, such as web design 
  • 10% - pay fees 
  • 5% - serve as buffer room for unforeseen costs that may arise

Risks and challenges are a part of any new business.  Luckily, I can't foresee anything that can't be overcome.  The campaign ends October 15th, giving me a month to finalize product orders and a month to ship.  While specific products provided may change, it should in no way impact our ability to fulfill orders in time for the holidays!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Phylicia Darling and I'm a certified Life Coach. My wife and I are starting a business to bring the things I've learned in my life and from my education to anyone seeking to enrich their life, improve their relationships, and to find fulfillment for themselves. My background is in Social Work, of which I have a bachelors degree. During my time in school, I studied several approaches to human behavior and therapeutic modalities. After graduating, I began working in drug treatment and mental health and became certified in Dialectical Behavior Therapy (DBT). DBT is a great model to help anyone elevate their lives and address the limitations they are putting on themselves. DBT and the things I've learned in my certification course, inspired the content and Tracks we are creating for Darling Life Coaching. Along with my formal training, I also have my own personal journey that I've learned from. For a long time, I only learned the hard way, which meant a lot of hard lessons. By getting through the difficulties in my life, I have found not only what balance means to me, but how much work goes into maintaining that balance. 

In a lot of ways, being a Life Coach is my dream job. I am a people collector and care deeply for everyone I meet. I have had amazing people in my life to help teach me about myself, and I want to do the same for others and give them the resources they need to grow into who they want to be while obtaining their goals. By helping fund our start up costs, you will not only be contributing to helping me make my dreams a reality, but you will be giving to my future clients and the investments they make into their futures and the countless others whose lives they will better along the way. 

From our family to yours, thank you so much for investing in our future and the futures of so many others!

What We Need & What You Get

We are hoping to raise $5,000 to start our business. All funds will go to start up costs to help get us off the ground, such as webhosting and domain, licensing and legal, CRM annual cost, insurance, and some marketing funds. If we reach our goal, a portion of the funds will go toward the fees for my wife and I legally changing our last name to Darling (something we've wanted to do since we were married and to help streamline certain business aspects). Come on, you know you want to be a part of that! 

Now we aren't asking for funds for nothing, we have some pretty great perks. My wife and I have a few talents that we think are worth a buck or two, and we hope you find one to suit your generosity. 

The Impact

The impact we stand to make with our business, is what makes me so deeply passionate, and spurs my desire to create Darling Life Coaching. In my time working with others, I have been trusted to participate in what, for many, becomes a life-changing process. I have witnessed first-hand, many individuals reclaim their lives and begin to experience genuine happiness and success. When someone decides to seek out our services, they will learn and obtain all these different skills and tools that they will take out into their life, utilize, and see sustainable results from. I guarantee, it works if you work it!

Risks & Challenges

The largest hurdle in this process, has been believing that my wife and I can start our own business. Luckily, that is only my hurdle, as she is a rockstar that believes she can do anything. In the time since, we have had several conversations regarding risk factors, and putting solid plans in place to overcome those hurdles and potential hurdles. For instance, a big question we asked ourselves was "How do we maintain constant clientele?" To which we have responded by generating verbal interest with several of our friends, family members, and acquaintances. The interest and response has been overwhelming.  Hurdles in starting and running your own business are inevitable and necessary. We feel confident to utilize the skills we will be teaching to others to overcome any obstacles in our path.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you're not in a place to donate, here are some other ways you can help us out. First and foremost, share our indiegogo to your network! Also, give us some love on our instagram by following @phyliciamac. If there are other non-monetary ways that you feel you can help support us then hit us up.

story:
Who We Are

Hi, we are Hunger’s Heroes. We are a group of undergraduate students from the University of Tennessee. As you can imagine, our lives at the university have rapidly changed due to the COVID-19 crisis. Our university, like countless other schools, have been shut down. Due to these schools being shut down, students facing food insecurity who rely on their schools for meals are going hungry across the country as well as in East Tennessee.

Having worked with food bank organizations in the past, we are all very passionate about solving the issue of hunger. Because of this, we are running this fundraising campaign to raise money for the non-profit Second Harvest. Second Harvest is a food bank that serves the hungry in the East Tennessee region. They partner with over 550 other non-profit organizations to help wage its war on hunger and poverty. Second Harvest serves 143,000 people on average every month. Our goal is to do our parts to end as much hunger in East Tennessee that we can.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We plan on raising $1,000 for Second Harvest. This money is going to be going towards the Food for Kids Program. Many kids do not know where their next meal is going to come from. Many kids only get to eat at school. So what happens after school or on the weekends? This is where Second Harvest comes in. Raising money for this program will help feed a lot of hungry kids during out of school hours that might not get to eat otherwise. 

If you donate, you will be able to choose from a variety of perks! Each perk has a monetary value attached to it. See what you can claim over on the right side of the page!

 

The Impact

Hunger is a huge problem facing East Tennessee. According to Second Harvest, there are 167,020 people going hungry in East Tennessee right now. Not only that, but 1 in every 5 children are going hungry in East Tennessee. By donating to our campaign, you will be making a huge impact in the fight against hunger. Last year, their Food for Kids program served meals for 12,680 children weekly at 280 schools in the region. With your help, these children, and more, will no longer have to worry about where their dinner or weekend meals will come from. Every $1 donated to the Second Harvest cause translates into 3 meals that will be going towards a hungry child. $10 is enough to feed a child for a month. $100 is enough to feed a child for a year. So little can make such a big impact, but we can’t do this alone. That’s why we’re asking for your donation of any amount.

 

Risks & Challenges

There are many risks and challenges that come along with running this campaign. One of these challenges can be reaching our goal. Raising $1,000 is very tough and it will be challenging to reach that goal in such a short amount of time. Another challenge we face is spreading awareness of our campaign in order to reach our $1,000 goal. We’ll be doing our best to get the word out, so see the other ways you can help down below!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to donate to the campaign, don’t worry! There are other ways to contribute to fighting hunger. The Second Harvest organization has many different ways you can help, such as volunteering! Visit their site down below to see what else you can do to make a difference. Also, if you cannot donate, please share the campaign, using either social media or the Indiegogo share tools! Every bit of effort helps fuel the fight against hunger!

 

Second Harvest of East Tennessee:

https://secondharvestetn.org/

story:
Need a Work Reboot? 

We spend our lives at work. There's no reason for them to be miserable. And yet too many people dread heading into the office each morning. That could be for any number of reasons, like: 

  • You're not in a position that aligns with your professional passion;
  • You're not valued for the skills you bring to the table, or empowered in your role;
  • You work with toxic co-workers or managers - the narcissists and bullies of the world that do nothing but bring people down.

If any of those statements ring true for you then Work Reboot can help get you in a better place. It's a 3 month virtual program that will empower you to create a professional experience that you can be excited about. The program includes 12 live weekly meetings via video conference, homework in between, and access to an exclusive community group where you can interact with other members in the program during and after our work together. 

Here's the journey you'll take: 

  • Part 1: Who you are. You've spent years (perhaps decades) in the position you're in, and that leaves a lot of baggage to take care of. The first month is about peeling back all the layers and re-discovering who you are, what makes you happy, and building your confidence to set you up for success. 
  • Part 2: Chart your course. In month two, we shape your future, including creating a clear idea of your ideal professional experience, shaping a plan to help you achieve it (inside or outside of your current organization), and building a strategy for you to achieve and maintain work/life balance. 
  • Part 3: Stay on track. Our last month is all about building momentum and keeping you on track to achieve your goals and creating your ideal professional experience.

Here's a quick video that will answer a few more questions about the program: 

 

I'll Guide Your Journey

I'm Karlyn Borysenko, and for the last five years I've run Zen Workplace. I'm an organizational psychologist and work with individuals and organizations around the world to help them create amazing work experiences by infusing humanity back into the process. 

But the sad truth is that most organizations who need someone like me will never hire me because they don't want to admit they need someone like me! So anyone working in those organizations has one of two choices - they either keep it business as usual or they work with someone like me one-on-one for thousands of dollars. 

That's why I'm creating Work Reboot - to give people the option to get the same advice and guidance as my one-on-one clients get in a group setting. That brings the price point down for everyone, and makes it available to a lot more people. 

For me, this is personal. I've had horrible professional experiences. I've worked for narcissists. And when I finally found happiness, I kicked myself all the time for not dealing with the situation sooner. Work Reboot is the solution that I wish I had when I needed it. 

What I Need & What You Get

Work Reboot is a program that I've been using for years with my one-on-one coaching clients that I want to bring to a broader audience at a more affordable price point. This campaign will support the infrastructure to make that happen. Supporting this campaign is also the only way to get to participate in the first session of Work Reboot, starting in June 2017. 

The minimum I need to make this happen is $5,000, which amounts to about 20 participants in the program through this campaign - a very achievable number! The funding of this campaign is fixed - if I don't reach the $5,000 then the program doesn't run in June. 

To get there, I've got some amazing perks lined up, including discounted access to Work Reboot, one-on-one coaching, and other online trainings that will help you be more successful at work. Here's the list: 

About The Benefits

For contributions at the $25 level and below, you're eligible for some swag and you're able to attend one of my live pro trainings (a $29 value). Training topics cover everything from mindfulness at work, to advancing up the career ladder, to effectively managing people.

See the full list of 2017 pro training topics here. 

At the $15 dollar level, I'll also send you a really cool stress ball for you to keep on your desk at work. It's got an awesome jelly texture that you can squeeze the hell out of to relieve some tension anytime you find yourself in the position of wanting to punch the wall (or your coworkers). 

For a little bit more, you'll be able to pick out a t-shirt at the $25 level. My company is called Zen Workplace so we've got a zen theme to the shirts. You'll get to pick from one of two options: 

  

If you want access to all of my monthly Pro trainings, members only office hours, discounts on future programs like this one and more, you can get a Zen Workplace Pro Membership. A contribution of $60 will get you 6 months, or you can give $100 and get a full year. That's a discount of 50-60% off the normal price and it's only available through this campaign!

At the $150 level, you will get a single ticket to Mental Health Day, a one-day online conference featuring 15 speakers on topics that will help you reduce your stress and find your personal sanity at work. You'll also get lifetime access to all the recordings in case you miss a session or want to refer back to one in the future. This is 25% off the normal price of $199. 


 

Ahh, now we get to the really good stuff! The investment to join Work Reboot in all future iterations will be $375, but everyone who contributes to this campaign will have the opportunity to get the same program at a nice discount: 

  • The first five people to sign up will get Work Reboot for $200, almost 50% off the price. 
  • The next ten people will get it for $250, 33% off the price. 
  • Everyone after that will get it for $300, which is still $75 off the price after this campaign. Not too shabby!

Want additional one-on-one coaching? My clients pay me about $300/hr or $2000/month for one-on-one work, but you can add it onto your Work Reboot experience for much less than that. 

  • Get Work Reboot and one coaching session with me for $400
  • Get Work Reboot and one month of coaching with me for $1000. 

The coaching sessions are in very limited quantity! If you know you want it, grab it early.

The Impact

Regardless of if you're contributing to this campaign to enroll in the program or you're getting one of the other perks, your contribution will have a big impact. You will help to change people's lives. That's not an exaggeration - that's the literal truth. Anyone who has ever been in a less than ideal work situation knows the toll it takes. This program will guide participants to the next professional step that is right for them and make a very real difference in their day-to-day experience.

Here are some testimonials from my other clients: 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute now? That's ok! Get the word out and share this campaign with your friends! You can also keep in touch by joining my mailing list to stay up-to-date with future opportunities.
story_txt:
Need a Work Reboot? 
We spend our lives at work. There's no reason for them to be miserable. And yet too many people dread heading into the office each morning. That could be for any number of reasons, like: 

You're not in a position that aligns with your professional passion;
You're not valued for the skills you bring to the table, or empowered in your role;
You work with toxic co-workers or managers - the narcissists and bullies of the world that do nothing but bring people down.

If any of those statements ring true for you then Work Reboot can help get you in a better place. It's a 3 month virtual program that will empower you to create a professional experience that you can be excited about. The program includes 12 live weekly meetings via video conference, homework in between, and access to an exclusive community group where you can interact with other members in the program during and after our work together. 
Here's the journey you'll take: 


Part 1: Who you are. You've spent years (perhaps decades) in the position you're in, and that leaves a lot of baggage to take care of. The first month is about peeling back all the layers and re-discovering who you are, what makes you happy, and building your confidence to set you up for success. 

Part 2: Chart your course. In month two, we shape your future, including creating a clear idea of your ideal professional experience, shaping a plan to help you achieve it (inside or outside of your current organization), and building a strategy for you to achieve and maintain work/life balance. 

Part 3: Stay on track. Our last month is all about building momentum and keeping you on track to achieve your goals and creating your ideal professional experience.

Here's a quick video that will answer a few more questions about the program: 

 
I'll Guide Your Journey
I'm Karlyn Borysenko, and for the last five years I've run Zen Workplace. I'm an organizational psychologist and work with individuals and organizations around the world to help them create amazing work experiences by infusing humanity back into the process. 
But the sad truth is that most organizations who need someone like me will never hire me because they don't want to admit they need someone like me! So anyone working in those organizations has one of two choices - they either keep it business as usual or they work with someone like me one-on-one for thousands of dollars. 
That's why I'm creating Work Reboot - to give people the option to get the same advice and guidance as my one-on-one clients get in a group setting. That brings the price point down for everyone, and makes it available to a lot more people. 
For me, this is personal. I've had horrible professional experiences. I've worked for narcissists. And when I finally found happiness, I kicked myself all the time for not dealing with the situation sooner. Work Reboot is the solution that I wish I had when I needed it. 

What I Need & What You Get
Work Reboot is a program that I've been using for years with my one-on-one coaching clients that I want to bring to a broader audience at a more affordable price point. This campaign will support the infrastructure to make that happen. Supporting this campaign is also the only way to get to participate in the first session of Work Reboot, starting in June 2017. 
The minimum I need to make this happen is $5,000, which amounts to about 20 participants in the program through this campaign - a very achievable number! The funding of this campaign is fixed - if I don't reach the $5,000 then the program doesn't run in June. 
To get there, I've got some amazing perks lined up, including discounted access to Work Reboot, one-on-one coaching, and other online trainings that will help you be more successful at work. Here's the list: 


About The Benefits
For contributions at the $25 level and below, you're eligible for some swag and you're able to attend one of my live pro trainings (a $29 value). Training topics cover everything from mindfulness at work, to advancing up the career ladder, to effectively managing people.
See the full list of 2017 pro training topics here. 

At the $15 dollar level, I'll also send you a really cool stress ball for you to keep on your desk at work. It's got an awesome jelly texture that you can squeeze the hell out of to relieve some tension anytime you find yourself in the position of wanting to punch the wall (or your coworkers). 

For a little bit more, you'll be able to pick out a t-shirt at the $25 level. My company is called Zen Workplace so we've got a zen theme to the shirts. You'll get to pick from one of two options: 
  


If you want access to all of my monthly Pro trainings, members only office hours, discounts on future programs like this one and more, you can get a Zen Workplace Pro Membership. A contribution of $60 will get you 6 months, or you can give $100 and get a full year. That's a discount of 50-60% off the normal price and it's only available through this campaign!


At the $150 level, you will get a single ticket to Mental Health Day, a one-day online conference featuring 15 speakers on topics that will help you reduce your stress and find your personal sanity at work. You'll also get lifetime access to all the recordings in case you miss a session or want to refer back to one in the future. This is 25% off the normal price of $199. 

 
Ahh, now we get to the really good stuff! The investment to join Work Reboot in all future iterations will be $375, but everyone who contributes to this campaign will have the opportunity to get the same program at a nice discount: 

The first five people to sign up will get Work Reboot for $200, almost 50% off the price. 
The next ten people will get it for $250, 33% off the price. 
Everyone after that will get it for $300, which is still $75 off the price after this campaign. Not too shabby!

story: Please support us! We can't do it without you...
story_txt: Please support us! We can't do it without you...

story:
Overview

 

Botanica Galactica is seeking to build a cafe and botanical tea bar within its current space, and expand our offerings as a collective wellness space. The cafe would feature feature fresh, nutritious and seasonal fare rooted in Mexican, Latinx and Mediterranean traditions, and tea blends crafted with herbs designed to heal and support overall well-being and health. Having this space will create the opportunity for us to host nutrition and cooking classes for both adults and children, host CSA share pick-ups and weekly wellness offerings for the community. We seek to support our community in a holistic approach, nourishing minds, bodies and souls. 

 

Our Story 

 

We are three Latinx women with roots in Milwaukee who have bonded over our passions for food, wellness and the community. Our individual journeys to health and wholeness, unite us in this endeavor to create a space that feels inclusive of all, celebrates our collective roots and ancestry, and serves as a platform for sharing and learning from each other. After previously encountering many obstacles while accessing health and wellness in our community, we hope to offer our knowledge through practical resources as a way of dismantling those barriers, within a diverse and affordable space that reflects the beauty of what our community has to offer.  

 

We are seeking to raise $50,000 which would go directly towards permits, construction, furniture, programming and equipment to make this dream a reality. 

 

 

Who We Are 

 

Mariyam Nayeri is a chef and yoga teacher who grew up between the north and south side of Milwaukee with her Mexican-American family until moving to Brooklyn in 2002. Returning home in 2018, she created Botanica Galactica with the spirit of community in mind. Influenced by the everyday radiance and diversity found in her former neighborhood of Bed-Stuy, she hopes to bring to Milwaukee, the city that raised her, the same love and sense of community that held her while away.   

Michelle Alfaro is the owner of Bonadfide Teas. She was raised in a single-parent household by her father who imparted upon her the importance of cherishing the beauty of her hispanic roots and culture. She handcrafts  tea blends with an intention to feed the soul, and the respect she has for herbs and their compounds is a synergy of wellness she wants to share in this space.

Dominique Alvarado is a native Milwaukeean, Xicana, and foundress / owner of Algo Dulce, an artisan food product line of culturally conscious beverages inspired by her Mexican heritage. Her love and appreciation for food Is heavily influenced by her grandmother and her upbringing on a farm in Mexico which influenced her plant-based cooking style.

 

The Space - Botanica Galactica

 

It is our intention to create a space in which we gather to collaborate and celebrate the rich and beautiful history of our community as reflected in anyone who walks through our doors. Currently, Botanica Galactica offers a variety of wellness programming focused on supporting and healing our community. It is our intent to expand our offerings to create regular programming that is accessible and welcoming to all. We will do this by partnering with local practitioners and building out a collective in which others will be able to share their offerings in a space that is communal, supportive, and guided by the desire to bring health and wellness to our community.  

We will also continue to support and promote emerging creative entrepreneurs by continuing to host vendor markets. In addition, vendors will have the opportunity to feature their offerings on a rotating basis as part of our retail offerings.  

Food and drink offerings from the cafe will be nutritious, seasonal and affordable, beginning right in our own backyard with a small garden that will be created. We are passionate about food justice, and plan to support nutrition and knowledge for all through education and partnerships with local farms, bridging and fostering the important connection of food to its  source. Education on food topics would be offered through cooking and nutrition classes for all ages. Beyond the holistic benefits, the cafe is crucial to the survival of our space as it will be able to provide a flow of income that will help to sustain the entire business and its wellness and arts programming. 

 

 

 

Why This Neighborhood 

 

Walker’s Point was a point of arrival for many new families to the city of Milwaukee, and it personally holds a lot of significance for us and our own history within this city. The building that is Botanica Galactica was the original Our Lady of Guadalupe mission, the first space to serve Mexican immigrants in Milwaukee from 1926-1946. The neighborhood is predominantly Latinx, and Mexican, and as the city has grown and expanded, and gentrification has begun to leave its imprint, our own roots have felt upended, and the call to serve those within our community has never felt more prudent. 

 

Within this community each of us has witnessed perpetual health problems due to nutritional deficiencies, high infant mortality rates due to lack of pre/post-natal support systems, and mental health problems due to the post-traumatic stress caused by incidents of violence.

 

This space is a way to renounce the afflictions that have rippled through our families and communities, it’s a way to rise up and reconnect with all of our powers. Healing ourselves and our community with natural plant medicine, nutrition and self-care. It is a way to begin to share knowledge with our children, fortifying them with lessons in nutrition, mindfulness practices and a village that is here to support them. It is a way to support mothers-to-be with movement classes, education and discussion groups. We plan to partner with other neighborhood organizations in order to help foster conversations, inclusivity and support around these topics. 

 

I love it! How can I support?

 

Great! Thank you so much! We have planned a special array of offerings from aguas frescas to private dinners and yoga classes for our donors. Each one imbued with a sense of all that this space means to us.  

 

The Impact 

Throughout the past year, we have been able to host numerous wellness offerings and gatherings focused around BIPOC and LGBTQ+ groups such as yoga, children’s programs, and healing and art circles. Our driving focus has been the role that these modalities and mediums offer to help heal. We have also created a vendor’s market called Mercado Magic which is intentional in it’s goal of inclusiveness and accessibility to all, and support of small business entrepreneurs. Initial workshop participants indicate an overall increase in their interest to pursue individual and collective forms of artistic expression and social solidarity within the space and throughout the community.


 

Risks & Challenges

We acknowledge that creating this space takes a lot of work, commitment and dedication. The acknowledgement of the breadth of this workload is why we have decided to take on this project as a team. Our team of professionals in food, wellness, marketing and finance are committed to nothing less than success. We are also well-aware of the necessity of community partnerships and the power behind them, which is why this is such a large component of our plan.  Our collective journeys include years of experience, including Mariyam’s role as co-founder of Cafe Chula, a Mexican cafe in London in 2012, which is currently thriving and continuing to leave its impression on its Camden Town location. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to able to make a monetary contribution, we ask for your help by sharing this campaign with others. If this is a project that resonates with you, please help us spread the word. Every little share helps so much! 

Video

Production + Direction + Editing : Vianca Fuster 

 

Photography  

Charlie and Taylor Photography

Herrada Photography

story:
La Bioguia es una gran familia. En sus inicios, Ernesto (Alma mater), soñó con una revolución donde la sustentabilidad y el amor marcaran el camino para unir a miles de personas en todo el mundo y construir un nuevo paradigma.

Así comenzó. Compartiendo vía facebook mensajes de inspiración para quienes también buscaban un cambio en su vida. Sin tomar dimensión de lo que realmente estaba generando, se creó un sitio web en el que todos podrían escribir artículos, y más gente comenzó a sumarse al proyecto. Así, la familia se formó y fue creciendo cada vez más. Hoy, somos más de 17 millones de personas quienes nos comunicamos, compartimos ideas, dudas, proyectos, consejos y sobre todo, un sueño: hacer del mundo, un lugar mejor.

 

Desde lugares muy diferentes del mundo, cada una de ellas empezó a reconocer en sí misma ese “gen” Bioguía. Desde preparar  una receta con vegetales orgánicos, hasta aprender la técnica para construir una casa con materiales naturales, o ideas para reutilizar objetos en lugar de arrojarlos a la basura. El aporte de cada uno y el deseo de construir, desde su lugar, ese nuevo paradigma de amor y sustentabilidad,  fue el corazón que hizo latir a La Bioguía, y que comenzaba a hacerse eco en todo el mundo.

Hoy, esta la historia sigue, y los genes se multiplican cada vez más.Gracias a cada uno, la familia de La Bioguía creció y se convirtió en lo que es hoy: la comunidad más grande sobre sustentabilidad en el mundo de habla hispana.

Habernos visto crecer tanto nos emociona. Escuchar historias como las de Víctor que viviendo en “la isla de la basura”, construyó una balsa con botellas plásticas para ir a pescar gracias a una nota de La Bioguía, nos llenan de alegría, pero también nos recuerdan que el desafío que tenemos por delante es enorme. Queremos que cada vez haya más historias como éstas; relatos de personas y de organizaciones que ya están cambiando el mundo y que pueden inspirar a otras a seguir su ejemplo.

 

En este momento, La Bioguía está ante una oportunidad de crecimiento exponencial. Sabemos que el “gen” que fuimos descubriendo está dormido en muchas más personas. Solo tiene que despertar. Y para eso necesitamos de tu ayuda.

Imagínate qué sería del mundo si todos nos animásemos a descubrir ese gen de amor y sustentabilidad que nos hace pensar, actuar y sentir por quienes tenemos al lado, y por ese mundo que queremos.

Hoy estamos ante la oportunidad única de lograrlo. ¡Podemos transformar la escena sustentable del mundo entero! Éste es el momento. Podemos dejar que ese “gen” permanezca despierto sólo en nosotros o hacer que, como un efecto dominó, siga expandiéndose y creciendo aún más.

Sabemos que lograr este sueño no es fácil, y que en el camino tenemos que asumir gastos que exceden nuestra propia capacidad de generarlos; desde servidores y hosting hasta alquiler de oficinas. Pero para esto están las familias, ¿no crees? ¡Para apoyarse! Dejar que este hermoso proyecto se estanque no es una posibilidad; ¡hacerlo crecer y expandir sí lo es! Hoy somos una gran comunidad y seguimos creyendo que este sueño que todos compartimos es posible si cada uno hace un aporte para lograrlo.

Al igual que sucede cada día con cada comentario que haces, cada idea que sumas, o cada imagen que deseas compartir, con tu colaboración tienes la oportunidad de generar un impacto positivo, real y aún más grande del que hoy, como ha pasado en el principio, podríamos imaginar.

Eres el protagonista de esta misión. ¿Vas a dejar que esto que logramos juntos quede simplemente aquí, o estás dispuesto a pasar a la próxima etapa?

¡Suma tu aporte!

 

Recompensas:

Porque creemos que lo bueno se contagia y que cuanto más das en la vida, más viene hacia ti, queremos darte algo a cambio de tu aporte. ¡Pero algo que realmente valga la pena! Tú eres especial y por eso las recompensas que elegimos también lo son. Con ellas podrás expandir aún más tu gen bioguía y seguir creciendo en este camino de amor y sustentabilidad que has escogido. ¡Tú te lo mereces! ¡Disfruta de tus Bio Recompensas!

 

Aclaración: Todas las recompensas son en formato digital.

Hoy somos una gran comunidad y seguimos creyendo que este sueño que todos compartimos es posible si cada uno hace un aporte para lograrlo.Al igual que sucede cada día con cada comentario que haces, cada idea que sumas, o cada imagen que deseas compartir, con tu colaboración tienes la oportunidad de generar un impacto positivo, real y aún más grande del que hoy, como ha pasado en el principio, podríamos imaginar.Eres el protagonista de esta misión. ¿Vas a dejar que esto que logramos juntos quede simplemente aquí, o estás dispuesto a pasar a la próxima etapa?¡Suma tu aporte! Recompensas:Porque creemos que lo bueno se contagia y que cuanto más das en la vida, más viene hacia ti, queremos darte algo a cambio de tu aporte. ¡Pero algo que realmente valga la pena! Tú eres especial y por eso las recompensas que elegimos también lo son. Con ellas podrás expandir aún más tu gen bioguía y seguir creciendo en este camino de amor y sustentabilidad que has escogido. ¡Tú te lo mereces! ¡Disfruta de tus Bio Recompensas! Aclaración: Todas las recompensas son en formato digital.

story:
What is Literacy Lounge?

Literacy Lounge was an idea that Harmony thought of while going through a flare up from her lupus in the Fall of 2017. She wanted to create a better reading experience for others to help them relax because reading has been an important part of her life.

By using black literature we want to highlight the many black authors that may have gone underrepresented, we believe that with this box, we can provide cultural diversity and representation for the African American community in the subscription box market. Our goal is to provide you with the topics to start healthy conversations.

After long nights of planning, working with others on our branding, videos, content, and products, we are finally on the verge of launching our new subscription box!

In today's society, we are always on the go whether we are checking emails, finishing up school, or taking care of our family. Within all of this we seem to forget to make time for ourselves. With Literacy Lounge we want to bring your serenity by giving you items that enhance your reading experience and/or help you relax. 

 

What's in the Box?

Literacy Lounge will include one book and 2-4 items that go along with the book and/or stimulate relaxation.

After choosing a book and writing down our thoughts, we take the time to look at our takeaway and how we can highlight a specific theme(s) throughout the book. Then we start to take ideas and turn them into reality and how we can bring them to life. Items included will go along with the theme and/or stimulate relaxation. 

For our Indiegogo campaign we have created an exclusive box that will give you a taste of what's in store. Below we have items that will be included in our Founder's Box.

  • The Bluest Eye by Toni Morrison
  • 3 bags of Mighty Leaf Tea
  • Branded Bookmark
  • Poem by Mahogany L. Browne
  • Branded Sticker
  • Self Love Card

 

Where the Funds Will Go

A lot of the hard work is done for our Founders Box and a few branded items like our shirts, but we need your help to take the next step. Your contributions will help us continue to build a better website, reduce costs of bulk orders, and marketing.

Please take the time to choose a perk that matches or exceeds what you would like to contribute. We want to thank you for not only believing  in us, but something that we believe in as well.

Below we have a chart that shows you exactly where these funds will go.

 

 

Meet the Team

Harmony

Lawton, OK

Founder

Harmony was inspired to create something for her fellow peers through her love for reading. She is a recent graduate from the University of Central Oklahoma with a Fashion Marketing degree. Her favorite quote is "We Read to Know We Are Not Alone." - C.S. Lewis

 

Dorion

Oklahoma City, OK

Co-Founder

Dorion is a recent graduate from the University of Central Oklahoma with a Business Administration degree. He grew up as an athlete, but discovered his love for reading through business books like "Startup Land". His favorite quote is “Not all readers are leaders, but all leaders are readers.” - Henry Ford

 

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challenge will be reaching our niche audience which are those that understand the importance of promoting and reading books written by Black authors and the significance of self care. Together, we can create a box that is not only valuable but also impactful to the community.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that everyone cannot give through a monetary value, but we know that everyone has something to offer and we have them listed below!

  • Share this page with the Indiegogo share tools and our social media @literacyloungebox online!
  • If you know anyone that may be of assistance to us, you can reach us at support@theliteracylounge.com.
  • Word of mouth! Tell your friends and family about us.

 

Thank You!

Without your support there would be no Literacy Lounge. Again, we want to thank you for checking out our page and hope that we can bring you value whether that be through our subscription box or our content. 

Until Next Time...

 

- Literacy Lounge

story:
TreckHub seeks to create economic and social development locally in the area.

By itself our company will be able to develop the local economy of the zone by means of the manufacture and commercialization of footwear, since what it seeks is to create employment in the area that we will tackle, at the same time that we give added value to the inhabitants by mean of labor training seen as a form of education and promoting the certifications offered by CONOCER (National Council for Standardization and Certification of Competencies). This gives us three ways to reduce poverty, first is the direct employment provided by our factory, then there are the indirect jobs that arise around us trough our providers and finally the jobs and businesses that our workers can create using the training and knowledge that we have granted them, thus increasing their purchasing power. The initial training that will be given will be to develop the shoes of recycled materials through a craft process, on the other hand will also seek to certify those who engage in some skills and crafts works through the ECO217 (a certification provided by the governmental entity Secretary Of Public Education) in order that they can also train more people.

 

Because the government has not implemented programs that seek to solve the problems of employment development of the local economy that are effective, TrekHub seeks to collaborate with the same and diverse empathic companies with the cause to generate a positive response capable of generating a significant change. This is confirmed by data presented by CONEVAL (National Council for the Evaluation of Social Development Policy) which is an agency charged with measuring poverty in Mexico and evaluating social programs and policies of the federal government, according to the "Poverty and Evaluation in the state of Veracruz 2012 " 1, the state government implemented a series of programs that sought state development, in 2010 there were 74 programs to support education, 49 for economic well-being and 35 for health. Only 4 were used to promote employment. However the government has abandoned most of the programs, we are aware that to fight poverty we require employment as a fundamental pillar.

In terms of financial viability, TrekHub represents a good option in terms of return on investment for the following factors:

  1. A) According to data provided by the Ministry of Economy, which is a governmental entity responsible for analyzing and promoting the economic development of the country, in Mexico only four states concentrate 94% of the value of the production of footwear: Guanajuato 70% , Jalisco 15%, Estado de México5%, and Distrito Federal 3% 2. It is important to identify that 94% of footwear production is located in the central-north region of the country, which increases the costs of moving the product to its Commercialization in the south of the country. Being located in the southern region, we can offer better prices to our customers thus having an advantage over our competitors. In addition, our suppliers of raw materials are located in the same region, which further reduces our logistics costs.

 

  1. We currently have companies that know our product and are interested in

acquiring it to market it in the southeast region of the country, we only need enough capital to start the production on a larger scale.

story:
Our Story

We are AVM Survivors, Fighters, and members of Ben's Friends Patient Support Communities.

 

And we are awesome!  Just ask any of the 7500 members of our 24 support groups.  Each and every one of them is affected by a rare disease and actively sharing stories, supporting each other, and raising awareness.

 

AVMSurvivors.org is our support group for those affected by AVM (Arteriovenous Malformation) a deficiency in the cardiovascular system characterized by abnormalities between the arteries and veins. Malformations can occur in different parts of the body, and can cause fatal strokes when the tangled blood ruptures.  With Nearly 3000 members across the globe, AVM Survivors is our first and largest community and was created as a result of Ben's brain hemorrhage in 2006 and his desire to connect with others who shared his experience.


As this year's Team Captain, Shalon is excited to use the walk as an opportunity to hang out with her AVM family.  While she typically only knows them online, the connection and feelings of kinship shared by each member couldn't be more real if she saw them daily.  AVMSurvivors.org is the kind of group that is brought together by tragedy, uncertainty, and hardship, but stays together because of the awesome people, kind hearts, and generous spirit of our members.


The Impact

This is officially the third year AVMSurvivors.org has participated in the TAAF Aneurysm & AVM walk in beautiful San Francisco.  We KNOW how important it is to raise awareness and support TAAF(The Aneurysm & AVM Foundation.)  We KNOW how scary it is when people find out that they, or a loved one, has suffered a bleed or stroke.  And we KNOW just how lucky they feel to connect with others who understand what they are facing.  After all, we ARE survivors and fighters!


This Awareness walk is growing each year and is allowing all of us to make an impact, to share knowledge, and to help people.  What is better than that???  Nothing!  So help us help others.  Consider this your good deed for the day.  And actually, go ahead and consider this your good deed for the year too!  (Of course that does require a bigger donation.)


What We Need & What You Get

This year's fundraising event is twofold and will be split 80/20.

First and most importantly we are raising money for TAAF in their mission of being, "Dedicated to bettering the lives, support networks, and medical care of those affected by aneurysm and other types of vascular malformation of the brain."  TAAF is strictly a pro-bono organization with virtually no administrative costs. The goal is to direct money where it is needed — into research and public education. You can see the many ways you can help by going to the TAAF website and viewing the Get Involved or Donation sections of their website.


Secondly we are raising money to support Ben's Friends Patient Communities.  A smaller portion (20%) of this fundraiser will help to pay for the AVM Survivors site, which is free of charge to all members.  BensFriends.org is a mission-driven company dedicated to providing safe and supportive patient communities for anyone affected by a rare disease.  Your donation will help us continue to build communities and provide much needed and free support to thousands of people affected by rare diseases.


What do you get???


Other than the warm and fuzzy feeling you get by doing something good for another person, we actually have "stuff!"  Fun and Pretty things (Special AVM edition Brainbows, Lion Snaps, and Butterfly Charms,) AVM Walk T-shirts (I'll message you for size info), Hugs...yes, I said hugs, awesome Art Work, and even dinner with our fearless leader Ben!  And just to help entice you, here is a sneak peek of a few of our items!  Our newest T-shirt design is great.  And how cute our all of our little Fun or Pretty items?  Seriously, how can you resist?

 

 Check out our tiers to the right and decide just how much you love us and want us to love you back!  Well, we love you anyways no matter how much you decide to donate.  Heck, we will love you just for checking out our page cause that's how we are.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share the love!  No really, PLEASE SHARE.  Email your friends and family, and post a link to our fundraising site www.indiegogo.com/avmsurvivors on your facebook page.  And of course, don't forget to "like" all of us too!  (TAAF, Ben's Friends, and AVM Survivors all have their very own facebook pages.)

Since you are feeling so generous now anyways, how about writing about us on your blog, or submitting our story to other "Feel Good" sites and news outlets.  Post a comment above to tell us you think we are super cool.  Don't forget to visit us often to find out how our fundraising is going and to watch our very cool Movie Trailer again.  But ultimately, please let others know how they can help us out!

story:
Our Story

“This song was a unique opportunity to talk about addiction not only from the perspective of the addict but also from the perspective of their loved ones. The message is very different from traditional songs that seem to always perpetuate a mentality of self victimization which is exactly the kind of misguided thinking that perpetuates the mental obsessive side of alcoholism & addiction.In the end the moral of the story is about holding on to not giving up on ourselves or the people who are trying - who are really, really trying to make and better themselves.”- Tommy Vext

BAD WOLVES have enjoyed tremendous support from their fans, their WOLFPACK, over the years and have decided to give back to those in need, and those in recovery with a second video for their song "Sober," featuring footage from the film 'Sno Babies.' The video portrays the devastating impact of addiction on families and relationships, while remembering that recovery is possible for those who can stay the course.  

The Campaign...

 

To coincide with the release of the video and to support recovery organizations and those suffering from opiate addiction, BAD WOLVES have launched the this crowdfunding campaign.  The idea is simple:

Our goal is to raise $10,000.

To benefit these organizations and provide resources for those in recovery, a limited edition #wolfpackrecovery hoodie is available EXCLUSIVELY for this campaign. Once you purchase a hoodie, someone from our team will reach out to you for your size. 

We aim to use the video’s release as a platform to raise awareness of GRI’s efforts to provide access to recovery support services all around the U.S, and Rock To Recovery’s efforts to use the healing power of music to help overcome addiction, eating disorders and a variety of mental health issues. A portion of the proceeds from the sale of the Sno Babies Soundtrack will go towards helping GRI’s efforts with recovery organizations. Additionally, 100% of the profits from this #wolfpackrecovery Indiegogo campaign will go towards helping Rock To Recovery.

The Statistics tell the story...

- According to the National Survey on Drug Use and Health (NSDUH), 19.7 million American adults (aged 12 and older) battled a substance use disorder in 2017.

- Almost 74% of adults suffering from a substance use disorder in 2017 struggled with an alcohol use disorder.

- About 38% of adults in 2017 battled an illicit drug use disorder.

- That same year, 1 out of every 8 adults struggled with both alcohol and drug use disorders simultaneously.

- In 2017, 8.5 million American adults suffered from both a mental health disorder and a substance use disorder, or co-occurring disorders.

- Drug abuse and addiction cost American society more than $740 billion annually in lost workplace productivity, healthcare expenses, and crime-related costs.

About Rock To Recovery: 

Unlike any other foundation, Rock to Recovery helps people heal by making them a part of the band and the music. They don't just listen to the music, they play it. It's more than just a foundation, it's a family. Rock to Recovery's non-profit entity donates its services to state-funded programs and indigent rehabs like Salvation Army and Clare Foundation, programs for at-risk youths including Turning Point and North County Lifeline, as well as Breath of Heaven and the Wounded Warriors of the USAF. The musical nature of its songwriting sessions has proven to be a unique and clinically therapeutic tool, which effectively helps those suffering from PTSD, depression, suicidal ideation, anxiety, addiction and eating disorders. The event will be an excellent opportunity to celebrate Rock to Recovery’s current work, learn more about the program and celebrate its successes, as well as support its goals for future action. Learn more at: www.rocktorecovery.org

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some fans will be unable to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Spread the word! Share the campaign using the Indiegogo share tools.

If you're interested in joining the cause or you are an individual in recovery or on your way to recovery, check out badwolvesnation.com for more information.

story:
Who We Are

We are 4 students at The University of Tennessee who are raising money for Paws and Badges, a local 501(c)3 non-profit organization located in Knoxville, Tennessee. Paws and Badges is an organization that matches trained dogs, who were rescued from local shelters, with people that have PTSD, primarily First Responders and Veterans. We chose this organization because PTSD is a devastating disorder, with little attention brought to it. This organization has shown us that the power of companionship can completely turn around lives.

Paws and Badges was founded in 2015 by B&B K-9 Obedience. Mike Bartleson was a retired Knox County Sheriff who had 7 years of canine handling and training experience, which is how B&B K-9 came into existence.  With the help of a small group in the community, Paws and Badges was born. The program aims to help as many as 25 clients per year, treating their PTSD conditions.

Mike Bartleson pictured on the right

What We Need

The cost of training service dogs is around $20,000 and takes up to 9 months to train the dogs to be certified as active service dogs.  This means that Paws & Badges must provide the necessary tools, shelter, and food for 9 months before the dogs are adopted. Our group’s goal is to raise $1,000 to help provide food for the dogs while they are getting trained.  

What You Get

Setting up a reward/perk system will be our way of giving back to those who donate to our campaign. The first perk will be a $10 social media shoutout from our Facebook.  The second perk will be set at $25 and it will be a chew toy to be shipped out. The third perk will be a $50 Custom T-shirt, and finally the last perk is $100 and it will be a personalized video shoutout along with a T-shirt

How it Helps

By setting up this campaign, we will be able to help Paws & Badges through the donations on our Indiegogo page. Sharing this campaign will help bring in more donations. These donations will help to pay for food for the dogs giving them the energy to help these suffering veterans. Your donations aren’t just paying for operating costs, they are changing lives. The impact these dogs have on those suffering with PTSD is indescribable.

Service dogs are trained to detect sudden changes in their owners’ behavior and physical changes their owners’ go through while having a flashback or heightened anxiety.  This means that when a veteran who has PTSD goes into a flashback, the dog can sense this and will bring his owner his medication or some water to help. These donations go to helping make those with PTSD more comfortable and allow for these dogs to complete their training and to help do their part for our veterans.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Other ways to help instead of money could be something as simple as a social media shout-out for Paws & Badges Facebook. By shouting out their social media page on your own personal account, it brings publicity to the organization from people who may have never heard of them before. Another way to help Paws and Badges without donating money would be to donate your time and effort to help handle the dogs as well work on projects.

When you donate, whether it be money, time, or anything else, you are making such a positive impact on the Knoxville community and giving hope to those who may have lost it.  For further information on volunteering or any other questions, feel free to check out Paws & Badges website.

story:
The Botanical Bus changes the paradigm of top-down health care that offers limited services to meet the overwhelming demands of growing health disparity. Our clinic recognizes the knowledge of the people as an unlimited, invaluable resource and is driven by the proven success of the self-healing community model in which holistic health is empowered by-the-people, for-the people.

 

Who We Are:

The Botanical Bus: Bilingual Mobile Herb Clinic is a 501c3 nonprofit organization.

Our founding team includes Jocelyn Boreta (community organizer), Angeles Quiñones (Promotora de Salud), and Lily Mazzarella (clinical herbalist). We are joined by a growing bilingual community of elders and children, agricultural and service workers, cooks and herbalists, teachers and students, connecting across generations and cultures to empower holistic health from the ground up.

 

What We Do:

Since the 2017 North Bay fires, we have come together with founding partners La Luz Center, Corazon Healdsburg and North Bay Organizing Project, to host clinics at Latinx health centers, community gardens and social justice events throughout Sonoma County. Our programs include a sliding-scale mobile clinic, promotora-led wellness workshops, and community medicine gardens.

In 2020, the Botanical Bus will:

  • Engage 1000 wellness workshop participants in the exchange of herbal remedies, recipes + medicine made in community
  • Empower a team of 6 promotoras to lead regular wellness workshop in their communities
  • Connect 650 mobile clinic clients with holistic health practitioners
  • Cultivate 3 community medicine gardens at clinic sites 

 

What the Funds are For: 

35% will be for program development with partner organizations such as blue prints for medicine gardens, door-to-door community outreach, organization of holistic practitioners, and future fundraising.

30% will be for providing our growing team of promotoras with stipends for the powerful work they are doing in their communities.

25% will be for clinic supplies such as soil + seeds; teapots, tables + chairs; and bountiful herbs + medicine making supplies.

10% will be for start up + campaign fees

Any funds raised above our goal of $20,000 will go toward our larger goals for 2020 of raising $60,000 for mobile clinic infrastructure- a van that will house a permanent herbal clinic! We are so thankful for your support! 

 

Risks and challenges

In these uncertain times, we have been hard at work, building the relationships and community on which The Botanical Bus is founded. Face-to-face connection and door-to-door outreach are vital to the success of our clinic programs….and they require time and money. Future program development is predicated on strategic planning and performance measurement on the community level. We will be seeking further funding from ethical corporate and private sponsors in order to acquire our mobile setup—namely, a van housing a permanent herbal clinic! We are thrilled at the prospect of getting this crucial part of our vision off the ground (and on the road). We know we can do it! Our hearts are in this and we are excited to invest more resources into our growing organization.

 

www.thebotanicalbus.org 

www.facebook.com/bilingualmobileherbclinic 

www.instagram.com/botanical.bus/

story:
I don’t want to do anything. I just want to do what I want. Sometimes I’m interested in everything, sometimes in nothing. I don’t want to do anything so I can’t do anything wrong. I want to forget about desire, forget about time, forget about money. I dreamed about being who I am for such a long time. I am ready. 

 

Video shot and edited by Danielle Küchler Flores
