story:
[ENGLISH BELOW]

VIVEKA surge de Casa Virupa, un centro y comunidad budista en Tavertet. Queremos que cualquiera que venga aquí pueda aprovechar la tranquilidad y aislamiento de la cabaña para hacer práctica espiritual (retiros), o para hacer un trabajo creativo o de investigación, o simplemente para disfrutar del silencio y la naturaleza.

VIVEKA es un proyecto de casitas de madera para hacer retiros o para pasar unos días en tranquilidad en Tavertet, Cataluña.

Si bien VIVEKA está principalmente pensado para que practicantes de meditación tengan un sitio donde hacer retiros estrictos, también creemos que es ideal para cualquier persona que busque un espacio donde recogerse y vivir unos días en serenidad, en un entorno absolutamente natural y alejado del vaivén de la ciudad.

VIVEKA es una palabra pali que significa “reclusión”, “aislamiento” o “retiro”. El Buda consideraba que la práctica de los retiros era fundamental para el desarrollo espiritual, para observarse y apreciar la soledad, para cultivar la atención y la gentileza. 

 

Queremos que las cabañas ofrezcan una sensación de aislamiento total, y por ello la ubicación de las cabañas está suficientemente alejada de los caminos que rodean Casa Virupa pero, a la vez, lo suficientemente cerca como para poder acceder a ellas desde las principales inmediaciones de la casa sin dificultades.

Otro de los objetivos es que las casitas estén bien integradas al entorno y que sean lo más discretas posible, para no romper con la armonía del paisaje. Por ello quisimos priorizar materiales de origen orgánico y ecológico:

En cuanto al interior de las cabañas, queremos que sea sobrio, pues creemos que en la simplicidad hay mucha riqueza, pero evidentemente no renunciaremos a la comodidad, que hará de la cabaña en un cálido hogar para cualquiera de sus retirantes. 

Las casetas tendrán entre 15 y 20m² y constarán de una habitación con una cama, un espacio para hacer la práctica, una cocinita y una mesa para comer, además de un baño sencillo con ducha. Algunas de las cabañas, como la piloto, tendrán también un entrañable porche donde disfrutar de las puestas de sol.

 

Hemos querido compartir y crear comunidad en el proyecto de VIVEKA porque nos parece una oportunidad única, ya que se trata de algo excepcional y diferente en el país. 

Desde que ideamos VIVEKA hasta la campaña de Indiegogo hemos valorado muchas propuestas profesionales, materiales y presupuestos, y finalmente nos hemos decantado por las opciones de calidad que impliquen un mayor respeto al entorno y un mayor confort dentro de la casita.

Los 10.000 € de esta campaña sirven para finalizar la cabaña piloto y dar unas condiciones al terreno que destinamos a Viveka para que pueda haber más casitas. Si superamos el objetivo que nos hemos propuesto, empezaremos la construcción de otra cabaña.

 

Aquí te explicamos la evolución del proyecto desde sus inicios y cómo tenemos previsto que avance:

**Consultar condiciones de las recompensas.

 

Hay uno de los factores clave para que Viveka sea un proyecto tan increíble: el paisaje. Tavertet es uno de los lugares más bonitos de Cataluña, y es que sus espectaculares acantilados con vistas al Pantano de Sau, la magia de la niebla acompañando la salida de sol, y una vista de 360 º de toda Cataluña (desde los Pirineos, el Pedraforca o el Montseny), no dejan indiferente a nadie. 

 

Uno de los retos de Viveka es cómo llevar el agua y la luz a las cabañas, precisamente por lo aisladas que están. La primera opción es llevar el agua y la luz desde la casa principal, pero si eso no fuera posible, lo resolveríamos haciendo que cada casita tuviera su propio sistema de abastecimiento a través de placas solares y un tanque de agua que podríamos ir llenando cada vez que se necesitara.

Si bien el aislamiento es de calidad, podríamos encontrarnos que para un invierno duro (como el del 2018), el material empleado no fuera totalmente suficiente. También tenemos pensada una alternativa: instalaríamos una estufa de pellets y reforzaríamos el aislamiento de la cabaña con otros materiales.

 

Detrás del proyecto de VIVEKA está Casa Virupa, una comunidad budista integrada por personas con diferentes intereses y formaciones pero con una misma inquietud:  la apuesta por una forma de vida encaminada a la felicidad de todos los seres. 

Casa Virupa es un proyecto fresco, dinámico y joven, por eso también abrimos nuestras puertas para que cualquiera que busque tranquilidad y conocer su mente pueda hacerlo aquí, y por eso vamos programando cursos, retiros, enseñanzas, talleres... en relación a la meditación y a la filosofía budista.

Ahora bien, en el proceso de elaboración de VIVEKA nos han ayudado muchísimas personas que no viven con nosotros en Casa Virupa pero que forman parte de nuestra red, son nuestra familia escogida y también la de sangre. A todos ellos debemos un proyecto tan ambicioso como es Viveka y les agradecemos desde lo más profundo de nuestro corazón su implicación desinteresada, valiente y generosa con VIVEKA y, por extensión, con Casa Virupa.

Conócenos más aquí:

www.casavirupa.com

www.facebook.com/casavirupa

www.instagram.com/casavirupa

Escucha esta entrevista (en catalán) al director de la comunidad de Casa Virupa, Román Sánchez Orpella.

 

*********************************

*********************************

 

VIVEKA is a project born out of Casa Virupa, a Buddhist center and community in Tavertet. Our wish is for everyone who comes here to be able to take advantage of the calmness and isolation of the cabin for their spiritual practice (retreats), for a creative or research project, or to simply enjoy nature and silence.

 

VIVEKA is a project of little wooden cabins for going on retreats or for spending some peaceful days in Tavertet, Catalonia.

While VIVEKA is mainly conceived for meditation practitioners to have a place to go on strict retreats, we also believe it is ideal for anyone who wants to take refuge and live in a serene and fully natural environment, far from the hustle and bustle of the city.

VIVEKA is a pali word that means “reclusion”, “isolation” or “retreat”. Buddha considered retreats to be fundamental for spiritual growth, to observe oneself and appreciate solitude, to cultivate attention and gentleness.

 

We would like these cabins to offer a feeling of total isolation and comfort, which is why the cabins we’ll be constructing will be sufficiently removed from the paths that surround Casa Virupa while, at the same time, be close enough to access them from the vicinity of main house without any difficulty.

Another of the objectives is for the little houses to be well integrated with the environment and for them to be as discreet as possible, so as not to break the harmony of the landscape. For this reason we wanted to prioritize organic and ecological materials:

Regarding the interior of the cabins, we want them to look sober since we believe there is much richness in simplicity, nevertheless, they will offer a minimum level of comfort that ensures the cabin is a warm home for the those on the retreat.

The cabins will be between 15 and 20m2 and will include a room with a bed, a space for one’s practice, a little kitchen and a table for meals, as well as a simple bathroom and a shower. Some cabins, like the pilot one, will also have an endearing porch to enjoy the sunset.

We have wanted to share and enlarge our community in the VIVEKA project since we consider it a unique opportunity, something very exceptional and different in the country.

From the moment we first conceived VIVEKA until the Indiegogo campaign we have valued proposals by many professionals regarding materials and budgets, and we have finally chosen the quality options that will allow for a greater care of the environment and a greater comfort inside the cabins.

The 10.000€ from this campaign will be used to finalize the pilot cabin and give the land we have chosen for Viveka the right conditions for constructing more cabins. If we surpass the goal we have set for ourselves, we will begin the construction of another cabin.

At the end of 2018 we started to elaborate a project of retreat cabins, and we consulted different professionals who advised us on which were the fundamental elements for constructing beautiful, modest and comfortable houses to live in.

Here we show you the evolution of the project from its inception and how we envision its development:

There is a key factor that makes VIVEKA such an incredible project: the landscape. Tavertet is one of the most beautiful places in Catalonia, with spectacular views of the Sau Reservoir, magical sunrises through the fog, and a 360º view Catalonia (including the Pyrenees, the Pedraforca and the Montseny mountains), all of which have never left anybody indifferent.

One of the risks of VIVEKA is equipping the cabins with water and electricity due precisely to their isolation. Our first option will be to bring water and electricity from the main house, but if that was not possible, we would solve it by providing each little house with its own supply system through solar panels and a water tank that we could keep filling whenever necessary.

Although the cabins will be well insulated, it could be that on a very harsh winter (such as the 2018 one) the materials we have used were not strong enough. The alternative in this case would be to install a pellets heater and reinforce the insulation of the cabin with other materials.

 

Behind VIVEKA there is CASA VIRUPA, which is a community made up of people with diverse interests and educational backgrounds sharing a common motivation: finding a way of life that is oriented towards the happiness of all sentient beings.

Casa Virupa is a fresh, dynamic and young project, so we open our doors for anyone searching for tranquility and better understanding of their mind to come do it here. This is why we are programming courses, retreats, teachings and workshops in relation to meditation and Buddhist philosophy.

That being said, many people who don’t live with us in Casa Virupa but belong to our network have helped us in the process of developing VIVEKA, people who are our chosen family as well as blood relatives. We owe all of them for such an ambitious project as Viveka and we thank them from the bottom of our heart for their disinterested, brave and generous implication in VIVEKA and, by extension, Casa Virupa.

Get to know us better here:

www.casavirupa.com

www.facebook.com/casavirupa

www.instagram.com/casavirupa

Listen to this interview (in Catalan) with the director of the community of Casa Virupa, Román Sánchez Orpella.

 

 

*********************************

*********************************

Ilustraciones / Illustrations: Fabio Castro (https://www.instagram.com/fabiocastro27/).

A todos ellos debemos un proyecto tan ambicioso como es Viveka y les agradecemos desde lo más profundo de nuestro corazón su implicación desinteresada, valiente y generosa con VIVEKA y, por extensión, con Casa Virupa.Conócenos más aquí:www.casavirupa.comwww.facebook.com/casavirupawww.instagram.com/casavirupaEscucha esta entrevista (en catalán) al director de la comunidad de Casa Virupa, Román Sánchez Orpella. ****************************************************************** VIVEKA is a project born out of Casa Virupa, a Buddhist center and community in Tavertet. Our wish is for everyone who comes here to be able to take advantage of the calmness and isolation of the cabin for their spiritual practice (retreats), for a creative or research project, or to simply enjoy nature and silence. VIVEKA is a project of little wooden cabins for going on retreats or for spending some peaceful days in Tavertet, Catalonia.While VIVEKA is mainly conceived for meditation practitioners to have a place to go on strict retreats, we also believe it is ideal for anyone who wants to take refuge and live in a serene and fully natural environment, far from the hustle and bustle of the city.VIVEKA is a pali word that means “reclusion”, “isolation” or “retreat”. Buddha considered retreats to be fundamental for spiritual growth, to observe oneself and appreciate solitude, to cultivate attention and gentleness. We would like these cabins to offer a feeling of total isolation and comfort, which is why the cabins we’ll be constructing will be sufficiently removed from the paths that surround Casa Virupa while, at the same time, be close enough to access them from the vicinity of main house without any difficulty.Another of the objectives is for the little houses to be well integrated with the environment and for them to be as discreet as possible, so as not to break the harmony of the landscape. For this reason we wanted to prioritize organic and ecological materials:Regarding the interior of the cabins, we want them to look sober since we believe there is much richness in simplicity, nevertheless, they will offer a minimum level of comfort that ensures the cabin is a warm home for the those on the retreat.The cabins will be between 15 and 20m2 and will include a room with a bed, a space for one’s practice, a little kitchen and a table for meals, as well as a simple bathroom and a shower. Some cabins, like the pilot one, will also have an endearing porch to enjoy the sunset.We have wanted to share and enlarge our community in the VIVEKA project since we consider it a unique opportunity, something very exceptional and different in the country.From the moment we first conceived VIVEKA until the Indiegogo campaign we have valued proposals by many professionals regarding materials and budgets, and we have finally chosen the quality options that will allow for a greater care of the environment and a greater comfort inside the cabins.The 10.000€ from this campaign will be used to finalize the pilot cabin and give the land we have chosen for Viveka the right conditions for constructing more cabins. If we surpass the goal we have set for ourselves, we will begin the construction of another cabin.At the end of 2018 we started to elaborate a project of retreat cabins, and we consulted different professionals who advised us on which were the fundamental elements for constructing beautiful, modest and comfortable houses to live in.Here we show you the evolution of the project from its inception and how we envision its development:There is a key factor that makes VIVEKA such an incredible project: the landscape. Tavertet is one of the most beautiful places in Catalonia, with spectacular views of the Sau Reservoir, magical sunrises through the fog, and a 360º view Catalonia (including the Pyrenees, the Pedraforca and the Montseny mountains), all of which have never left anybody indifferent.One of the risks of VIVEKA is equipping the cabins with water and electricity due precisely to their isolation. Our first option will be to bring water and electricity from the main house, but if that was not possible, we would solve it by providing each little house with its own supply system through solar panels and a water tank that we could keep filling whenever necessary.Although the cabins will be well insulated, it could be that on a very harsh winter (such as the 2018 one) the materials we have used were not strong enough. The alternative in this case would be to install a pellets heater and reinforce the insulation of the cabin with other materials. Behind VIVEKA there is CASA VIRUPA, which is a community made up of people with diverse interests and educational backgrounds sharing a common motivation: finding a way of life that is oriented towards the happiness of all sentient beings.Casa Virupa is a fresh, dynamic and young project, so we open our doors for anyone searching for tranquility and better understanding of their mind to come do it here. This is why we are programming courses, retreats, teachings and workshops in relation to meditation and Buddhist philosophy.That being said, many people who don’t live with us in Casa Virupa but belong to our network have helped us in the process of developing VIVEKA, people who are our chosen family as well as blood relatives. We owe all of them for such an ambitious project as Viveka and we thank them from the bottom of our heart for their disinterested, brave and generous implication in VIVEKA and, by extension, Casa Virupa.Get to know us better here:www.casavirupa.comwww.facebook.com/casavirupawww.instagram.com/casavirupaListen to this interview (in Catalan) with the director of the community of Casa Virupa, Román Sánchez Orpella.  ******************************************************************Ilustraciones / Illustrations: Fabio Castro (https://www.instagram.com/fabiocastro27/).

story:
To contribute to the campaign

 
  1.  Click the pink "Back It" button at the top of the page (this works on your computer or your phone)
  2. Then either
  • Enter a Contribution amount - or -  
  • Select a "Perk" to get as a thank you for donating: There are different perks associated with selected donation amounts.

Either way, we thank you for helping yourself and millions of other women access this unique resource!

What the funding covers

$85,000 will cover website development, marketing, and content development for Amazing Over 40. Anything that you can contribute helps us fund some small piece of our vision: to make comprehensive free information easily available to all women who need it.

We want to provide ongoing, free content for all women, as well as premium content that goes more in depth, like webinars, the opportunity to connect with Dr. Hoppe in real time, access to real-world retreats, and collaborations with experts in various fields.

Read on for more about our vision and project.

Every woman over 40 has a story....

It might be about her mother, her grandmother, or even herself.

When we were younger, we didn't have answers to the confusing questions that arose for us when our moms made us leave the pool or the mall "right this minute" because, as it turns out, she was having a menopause-induced hot flash/ hormonal emotional surge. Or when she was depressed but we didn't know what that even *was*, let alone what to do with it.

Women’s health and wellness just weren’t talked about back then.

Today, we have resources that we didn't have before: an awareness of women's issues and better access to a wealth of information on the internet.

But despite these advances, we are still left with a void when it comes to easy access to a full range of clear, researched information.

Seeing your doctor is time-consuming and usually expensive. And sorting through information on the internet can be overwhelming and confusing.

Enter Amazing Over 40: the world's first online resource specifically geared toward women over 40, curated by a World Renowned OB/GYN, Author, Speaker, & Women's Wellness expert. This website, once live, will offer both free and premium training options covering health, wellness, sex, disease and prevention, and diet and exercise.

As a long time OB/GYN and a woman over 40, Dr. Diana Hoppe is uniquely positioned to deliver this resource, and in addition to her professional and personal experience, Amazing Over 40 will draw on the experiences of a vast community of women over 40, all helping each other work through the sensitive, often misunderstood issues all women will eventually face. 

About the Creator

Dr. Diana Hoppe has a vision to positively change women’s lives. She believes ALL women should feel amazing at 40, 50, 60, and beyond. Dr. Hoppe is a board-certified OB/GYN with over 25 years of clinical experience, a practicing physician and Health & Wellness Coach, a published author and frequent speaker around the globe, and, most importantly, a woman over 40 who understands what you or a loved one might be going through. Her approach to women’s health integrates western and holistic methods, and she excels at translating complex scientific and medical information into understandable and easy applicable ways for women to manage their health; from natural ways to treat hot flashes to bio-identical hormone therapy during the peri-menopausal and menopausal years.

Dr. Hoppe has written two books: Healthy Sex Drive, Healthy You: What Your Libido Reveals About Your Life, which received the award for best Published Non-fiction, Self-Help and Inspiration in June 2011, and Am I Normal? A Woman’s Guide to Female Sexuality.     

She has appeared on numerous local and national television and radio shows, including the Dr. Oz Show. She is a frequent contributor to women’s health magazines, including Vogue, Women’s Health Magazine, Fit Pregnancy and Brides Magazine.

Why this project?

Recognizing the need for women over 40 to take better care of their health, Dr. Hoppe previously developed the Amazing Over 40® Health Coaching program; providing tools for women to help other women transform their health through weight loss maintenance and the implementation of a healthy lifestyle. Now, she wants to make this information and community available to women around the world.

Now more than ever, women need accurate information about their health, the tools to benefit from that information,  guidance to make the best choices, a thriving community for support, and a way to make their voices heard on issues of their own health and wellness.

In her practice, Dr. Hoppe offers a full spectrum of healthcare that is both professional and compassionate, all within a warm, peaceful, and healing environment. Amazing Over 40 will bring this sense of caring and community to the web.

We’re excited for you to join the movement!

Amazing Over 40 will include videos and downloadable materials that will help you assess, track, and improve your wellness, covering topics like

  • Self-care and learning to put yourself first
  • Stress reduction and bringing FUN back to your life
  • Sex and Intimacy
  • Lifestyle choices to improve your health and decrease risk of major diseases, like diabetes, heart disease and dementia
  • Nutrition and a balanced diet
  • Perimenopause and menopause
  • What to talk to your doctor about (recommended lab tests, vitamins & supplements, etc.)

Why Amazing Over 40 is necessary:

  • There isn’t enough easily accessible, reliable health and wellness information for women over 40. Currently, our content is available as a series of private trainings and presentations. We want to make this information and these tools available to anyone at any time, while also providing a safe community that women can rely on for support throughout their journeys.
  • In the U.S. alone, as of 2015, there were approximately 75 million Baby Boomers (ages 51-69) and 66 million Gen Xers (ages 35-50). (Pew Research from here.) Millennials will start turning 40 in 2023. That means there are almost 100 million women in the U.S. who are already experiencing these issues or will be soon. A lot of women need this resource!
  • Our physical and psychological environments are changing rapidly. With current healthcare issues, it is even more important to be aware of and prepared to manage our own wellness holistically.

Dr. Hoppe worked with GIA Wellness to create a health coaching program for their distributors - the Women in Synergy Program. To date, there are over 50 trained professional Health Coaches enrolled and certified by this program.

In 2014 and 2015, Dr. Hoppe created the Vibrantly You programs for women to get together and receive information re. living the most vibrant lives possible, including hormone therapy, sexual intimacy and anti-aging strategies. Over 250 women participated in these programs.

Other ways you can help

Share our campaign with everyone you know who is or cares about a women over 40 (we’re guessing that’s everyone). The more exposure the project gets, the better!  Use the Indiegogo share tools to get the word out: Indiegogo promotes campaigns with high traffic volume and a large number of social shares.

Get to know us

  • www.amazingover40.com
  • www.drdianahoppe.com
  • https://www.facebook.com/DrDianaHoppe/

story:
The Project:  I once had someone ask me, "How do you teach someone how to ride a horse?"  I thought about it for a while, then said, "You don't.  You teach them how to have a relationship with a horse." This Project is about horses connecting to youth who are in trouble, and about the healing which can occur.  We want to expand on our initial work, build on our initial success, and further develop our own unique form of culturally based equine therapy/therapeutic horsemanship, blending our own traditions with mainstream ideas to network with existing funding streams to build a sustainable project. We need your support to do this.

Our home. Native Americans represent less than one percent of this country's population and yet when you take a look at everything negative mainstream society keeps track of, we're leading the statistics.  What most don't know is that Standing Rock is a beautiful place to live.  It's here among our own people that our children have their greatest struggles and their greatest strengths.  We are actively working to retain our language and spiritual heritage, and we are working on bringing horses back into the lives of the people.  We strongly believe that if we can reintroduce horses back into the lives of our people, then our children, grand children and those not yet born will once again flourish.

Home of the Hunkpapa Lakota, the Standing Rock Sioux Reservation encompasses two counties, Sioux County in North Dakota and Corson County in South Dakota.  Both counties made the list of the ten poorest counties in the Nation with over 40% of residents living in poverty.  A recent study conducted by a university in Wisconsin identified Standing Rock as one of the least healthy places in the United States.  Studies show that Native American communities are 100 percent affected by alcohol and drugs, one third of Native American women have experienced some form of sexual assault or violence in their lifetime, Native American communities are seeing epidemic rates of diabetes, heart disease and cancer. 

Our youth. Everybody wants to feel connected in this world.  We all have a unique human need to feel a part of something.  Today, I don't think that our youth feel that.  I don't think they feel connected to their people through their language or their spirituality.  I don't think they feel connected to mainstream society or the rest of the world for that matter.  What we're trying to do is to help them to center themselves again.

A report by Stephanie Woodard for NBC News recently said, "A youth-suicide epidemic is sweeping Indian country, with Native American teens and young adults killing themselves at more than triple the rate of other American youth, according to federal government figures."  In 1997, Standing Rock went through a suicide crisis and in 2000 we went through another.  I have personally lost a younger brother and a younger cousin to suicide.  What I learned from this experiences is this, we can't wait for the United States government or State Governments to give us much needed resources to rebuild our communities, we can't even wait for own Tribal governments or a program.  As a people, we have everything we need to create change.  We know that we can do better. We can surround them with support and love.  We can create a system of care that acknowledges and gives merit to the cultural and spiritual teachings of my people.  I strongly believe we can make a difference with your help. 

Our horses. The Lakota people have a point of origin story of the horse and the gift they brought to our ancestors.  Our ancestors knew and understood the horse, referring to them as a sacred relative.  Sunkawakan Oyate ki, The Horse Nation.  The word for horse in Lakota is sunkawakan.  Sunka means, beautiful, pure and innocent.  Wakan is the ability to create life and destroy life, both good and bad.  When you put them together, you get a glimpse at the spiritual understandings our ancestors had of our sacred relative, sunkawakan.

On July 19th, 1881 Sitting Bull and the Hunkpapa turned themselves in at Fort Buford.  It was a hard time for the Hunkpapa when they gave up their weapons and their horses.  It is said that Sitting Bull said to his son, Crowfoot, "My boy, if you live, you will never be a man in this world, because you can never have a gun or pony." We often talk about the affects the Indian Wars, forced assimilation, U.S. federal Indian policy and boarding schools have had on our people, but what we seem to have forgotten was how traumatic the loss of horses was to our ancestors. 

What happens when youth and horses come together. Becoming one with the spirit of the horse is not a horsemanship model, it's a way of life.  I am certified to provide Equine Assisted Learning (EAL) and Equine Assisted Psychotherapy (EAP) by both the Equine Assisted Growth And Learning Association (EAGALA) and Greg Kersten's, OK Corral Series.  It was Greg who encouraged me to develop my own approach to equine therapy by saying, "Don't let anyone tell you how to do this.  Your people have always been gifted with horses."  And you know what?  He was right.  Our people have always known that horses can affect you in powerful ways. 

One day, while working with a group of middle school students on a different reservation, I had turned three horses loose in an arena.  I told the students, "If those horses represented Tunkasila, I want you to go and develop a relationship with the Creator."  I watched as a  young lady approached a horse that earlier had acted standoffish.  She approached the horse tentatively at first, and when her confidence faltered, the horse took a step towards her.  The young lady took a step closer and the horse lowered its head and pulled the young lady in close.  They both just stood there holding each other.  When the activity was over, I invited the students to circle up in the center of the arena.  One by one, I asked each of them about their experience, when it was the young ladies turn, I asked, "I noticed when you approached that horse, the horse reached for you and pulled you close.  What do you think was happening at that moment?"  The young lady was silent for a while then answered, "The horse knew what I was going through."  I later learned that the young lady had just lost her mother.  This is just one example of the powerful healing moments I'm blessed to be a part of.  This is why I believe so much in what I do. Becoming one with the Spirit of the Horse is a unique experience that uses the spirit of the horse to create a path to healing.

Our Races.  We come from a horse culture.  In 2006, a friend of mine hosted war pony races at his ranch in Kenel, SD and invited me to be a sponsor.  As I sat there that day, I realized something was happening on a spiritual level, the horses were doctoring people because of their healing abilities.  I went home and talked to my wife about what I seen and we decided to sponsor our own races.  As family and friends heard of our intentions, many came forward in support and pledged races.  In 2007, we hosted our first Sungkiyangkob Pi (Horse Races) in the Long Soldier community and this year will mark our 7th year honoring our ancestors and the horse nation. 

In 2011, our tiospaye (Lakota Traditional Kinship System) sponsored an oskate (Traditional Celebration) to honor our ancestors victory at the Battle of the Greasy Grass, also known as the Battle of the Little Bighorn.  It quickly grew and has become a favorite event for competitors and spectators alike.  The celebration consists of a traditional social dances, horse races, victory dance and a feed.  It is an immersion event where the Lakota language is spoken and our oral histories are told.  This will be our third year hosting this oskate and we have received tremendous support from the people.  Several families have pledged dance specials and horse races.  Many different bands of the Oceti Sakonwin (Seven Councils Fires) of our nation come to compete in friendly, but fierce tribal competition on horseback. 

We aren't doing this for ourselves, we're doing this for our people.  Unfortunately, many live outside of our way of life and are suffering.  We do this to help them to center themselves and reconnect with who they really are, everyone has a place in our tiospaye.  It is our belief that we are still connected to our ancestors, we have a genetic memory.  At one time in our history, our ancestors were considered to have been one of the greatest light cavalries in the world, their horsemanship was legendary.  A warrior and his horse were a powerful weapon, but today they've come back into our lives as healers.

Our Next Steps: What we need from you. We would like to blend our own culturally based equine therapy/therapeutic horsemanship with our years of experience with the wraparound process and systems of care development, to create something unique, something that is driven by the people, a project that is strength based and needs driven and will provide unconditional care.  We need your support to make this dream come true.

The National Wraparound Initiative defines wraparound as, "...an intensive, holistic method of engaging with individuals with complex needs (most typically children, youth, and their families) so that they can live in their homes and communities and realize their hopes and dreams."

We believe we have the experience to make this happen.  In 1998, I was hired by the Sacred Child Project, a demonstration project funded by the Substance Abuse Mental Health Service Administration (SAMHSA) and the Center for Mental Health Services (CMHS), as a care coordinator, where I implemented the wraparound process with Native American families.  The very first training I went to was with Dr. John VanDenBerg.  I spent two days listening to him talk about the wraparound process, and what impressed me the most was that it sounded like he was talking about our Lakota way of life.  The last thing he said at the end of our two days together was, "I feel blessed to be a part of this process."  At that point in my career, I really needed to know what that felt like.  Over the years, John has become a good friend and mentor of mine.  He is well known for his contributions to the wraparound process and systems of care communities and is a volunteer consultant to this project.

I have twenty four years of experience in human services, working with children, families and communities and am considered an expert on Systems of Care, the Wraparound Process, Family Engagement and Equine Therapy.  Today, I am self employed and have sixteen years of experience consulting with tribes, states and national organizations.  I've presented at tribal, state and national conferences across the United States and Canada, but now want to focus my attention on my own homelands.  We've gone through seven generations of decline, it just might take us seven generations to come back out of this again.  We have to have the foresight that what we're doing today is going to have such a long reaching impact, that we're going to touch seven generations into the future.  That's how strong we have to be in our faith today.

Accountability: How we will spend your money and why.

We already have the land, we have the horses, we have the youth, but we need the physical tools.  Specifically, during the first year while we build a permanent funding base, we will spend your money on the following:

·  Arena. The Standing Rock Sioux Reservation has eight tribal communities spread out over 2.3 million acres of land and travel can be a barrier to services and supports.  We need a portable arena made of 10’ welded corral panels that will allow us to be mobile so we can travel to the eight communities.  Instead of asking youth to come to us, we want to be the ability to go to them.  Safety is important and the arena will need to be about 100’ by 80’.  36 panels X $120/panel = $4320

·  Tipi. We are in need of seven lodges which we will use as part of the cultural lessons to the youth.  Each part of the teepee has special significance, as we assemble the lodges, we teach the story of woope, our seven spiritual laws and star knowledge.  It has become a powerful team building exercise.  We also talk about the roles of men and women and the sacred gift of life.  The seven lodges also represent the Oceti Sakonwin, or seven council fires of our nation.  One 16' lodge with poles, cover, door and liner costs would cost $1,500 x 7 = $10,500

·  PA System.  We are in need of a good quality PA system that would be used to provide sound at our community equine events, i.e.,  horse races, Battle of the Greasy Grass Celebration, Equine Assisted Learning events.  PA System = $2,500

·  Gasoline and vehicle costs.  When we take the program to other places, we need to buy gasoline and oil for the trucks and trailers, and sometimes repair our old trucks. We need $3000  for transportation costs.

·  Advertising. We have to get the word out about the program. We will use word of mouth, but also will buy advertising on tribal radio and press.  We need $3,000 for advertising and developing short film clips for use in publicity.

·  Consultants.  We would like to be able to pay consultants to assist us in creating Lakota language immersion events.  The money donated would be used to pay consultant fees, travel and lodging for Lakota speakers, two announcers for the oskate and singers. 

Consultants = $5,000

·  Food.  The Lakota have a strong belief that food is medicine that can heal and strengthen our bodies and our spirit.  We are asking for assistance in making sure that we have the ability to provide nutritional meals are our gatherings.  Food = $1,680

·  Total Costs for the Year. We estimate the equipment and related costs for the first year at $30,000

Perks.  The words of a traditional wopila olowan (Song of giving thanks), that is sung to honor families during giveaways reminds me of why providing perks is so important to this project.  "Tuwe sece kun, taku ota luha kin, oyate kin wi canku, toksa ake luha ki."  Translation - Whoever gives alot to the people, later will receive.

The Lakota people have a long cultural tradition of honoring through gifts and it's important to us that we include this value in this project.
story_txt:
The Project:  I once had
someone ask me, "How do you teach someone how to ride a horse?"  I thought about it for a while, then said,
"You don't.  You teach them how to
have a relationship with a horse." This Project is about horses connecting
to youth who are in trouble, and about the healing which can occur.  We want to expand on our initial work, build
on our initial success, and further develop our own unique form of culturally
based equine therapy/therapeutic horsemanship, blending our own traditions with
mainstream ideas to network with existing funding streams to build a
sustainable project. We need your support to do this. 
Our home. Native Americans represent less than one percent of this
country's population and yet when you take a look at everything negative mainstream
society keeps track of, we're leading the statistics.  What most don't know is that Standing Rock is
a beautiful place to live.  It's here
among our own people that our children have their greatest struggles and their
greatest strengths.  We are actively
working to retain our language and spiritual heritage, and we are working on
bringing horses back into the lives of the people.  We strongly believe that if we can
reintroduce horses back into the lives of our people, then our children, grand
children and those not yet born will once again flourish.
Home of the Hunkpapa
Lakota, the Standing Rock Sioux Reservation encompasses two counties, Sioux
County in North Dakota and Corson County in South Dakota.  Both counties made the list of the ten poorest
counties in the Nation with over 40% of residents living in poverty.  A recent study conducted by a university in
Wisconsin identified Standing Rock as one of the least healthy places in the
United States.  Studies show that Native
American communities are 100 percent affected by alcohol and drugs, one third
of Native American women have experienced some form of sexual assault or
violence in their lifetime, Native American communities are seeing epidemic rates
of diabetes, heart disease and cancer.  
Our youth. Everybody wants to feel connected in this world.  We all have a unique human need to feel a
part of something.  Today, I don't think
that our youth feel that.  I don't think
they feel connected to their people through their language or their spirituality.  I don't think they feel connected to
mainstream society or the rest of the world for that matter.  What we're trying to do is to help them to
center themselves again. 
A report by Stephanie
Woodard for NBC News recently said, "A youth-suicide epidemic is sweeping
Indian country, with Native American teens and young adults killing themselves
at more than triple the rate of other American youth, according to federal
government figures."  In 1997,
Standing Rock went through a suicide crisis and in 2000 we went through another.  I have personally lost a younger brother and
a younger cousin to suicide.  What I
learned from this experiences is this, we can't wait for the United States
government or State Governments to give us much needed resources to rebuild our
communities, we can't even wait for own Tribal governments or a program.  As a people, we have everything we need to
create change.  We know that we can do
better. We can surround them with support and love.  We can create a system of care that
acknowledges and gives merit to the cultural and spiritual teachings of my
people.  I strongly believe we can make a
difference with your help.  
Our horses. The Lakota people have a point of origin story of the
horse and the gift they brought to our ancestors.  Our ancestors knew and understood the horse,
referring to them as a sacred relative.  Sunkawakan
Oyate ki, The Horse Nation.  The word for
horse in Lakota is sunkawakan.  Sunka
means, beautiful, pure and innocent. 
Wakan is the ability to create life and destroy life, both good and
bad.  When you put them together, you get
a glimpse at the spiritual understandings our ancestors had of our sacred
relative, sunkawakan. 
On July 19th, 1881
Sitting Bull and the Hunkpapa turned themselves in at Fort Buford.  It was a hard time for the Hunkpapa when they
gave up their weapons and their horses. 
It is said that Sitting Bull said to his son, Crowfoot, "My boy, if
you live, you will never be a man in this world, because you can never have a
gun or pony." We often talk about the affects the Indian Wars, forced
assimilation, U.S. federal Indian policy and boarding schools have had on our
people, but what we seem to have forgotten was how traumatic the loss of horses
was to our ancestors.  
What happens when youth and horses come together. Becoming one with the spirit of the
horse is not a horsemanship model, it's a way of life.  I am certified to provide Equine Assisted
Learning (EAL) and Equine Assisted Psychotherapy (EAP) by both the Equine
Assisted Growth And Learning Association (EAGALA) and Greg Kersten's, OK Corral
Series.  It was Greg who encouraged me to
develop my own approach to equine therapy by saying, "Don't let anyone
tell you how to do this.  Your people
have always been gifted with horses." 
And you know what?  He was
right.  Our people have always known that
horses can affect you in powerful ways.  
One day, while working
with a group of middle school students on a different reservation, I had turned
three horses loose in an arena.  I told
the students, "If those horses represented Tunkasila, I want you to go and
develop a relationship with the Creator." 
I watched as a  young lady
approached a horse that earlier had acted standoffish.  She approached the horse tentatively at
first, and when her confidence faltered, the horse took a step towards
her.  The young lady took a step closer
and the horse lowered its head and pulled the young lady in close.  They both just stood there holding each other.  When the activity was over, I invited the
students to circle up in the center of the arena.  One by one, I asked each of them about their
experience, when it was the young ladies turn, I asked, "I noticed when
you approached that horse, the horse reached for you and pulled you close.  What do you think was happening at that moment?"  The young lady was silent for a while then
answered, "The horse knew what I was going through."  I later learned that the young lady had just
lost her mother.  This is just one
example of the powerful healing moments I'm blessed to be a part of.  This is why I believe so much in what I do.
Becoming one with the Spirit of the Horse is a unique experience that uses the
spirit of the horse to create a path to healing.
Our Races.  We come from a
horse culture.  In 2006, a friend of mine
hosted war pony races at his ranch in Kenel, SD and invited me to be a sponsor.  As I sat there that day, I realized something
was happening on a spiritual level, the horses were doctoring people because of
their healing abilities.  I went home and
talked to my wife about what I seen and we decided to sponsor our own races.  As family and friends heard of our intentions,
many came forward in support and pledged races. 
In 2007, we hosted our first Sungkiyangkob Pi (Horse Races) in the Long
Soldier community and this year will mark our 7th year honoring our ancestors
and the horse nation.  
In 2011, our tiospaye (Lakota
Traditional Kinship System) sponsored an oskate (Traditional Celebration) to
honor our ancestors victory at the Battle of the Greasy Grass, also known as
the Battle of the Little Bighorn.  It
quickly grew and has become a favorite event for competitors and spectators alike.  The celebration consists of a traditional
social dances, horse races, victory dance and a feed.  It is an immersion event where the Lakota
language is spoken and our oral histories are told.  This will be our third year hosting this
oskate and we have received tremendous support from the people.  Several families have pledged dance specials
and horse races.  Many different bands of
the Oceti Sakonwin (Seven Councils Fires) of our nation come to compete in
friendly, but fierce tribal competition on horseback.  
We aren't doing this
for ourselves, we're doing this for our people. 
Unfortunately, many live outside of our way of life and are suffering.  We do this to help them to center themselves
and reconnect with who they really are, everyone has a place in our tiospaye.  It is our belief that we are still connected
to our ancestors, we have a genetic memory. 
At one time in our history, our ancestors were considered to have been
one of the greatest light cavalries in the world, their horsemanship was
legendary.  A warrior and his horse were
a powerful weapon, but today they've come back into our lives as healers.


Our Next Steps: What we need from you. We would like to blend our own culturally based equine
therapy/therapeutic horsemanship with our years of experience with the
wraparound process and systems of care development, to create something unique,
something that is driven by the people, a project that is strength based and
needs driven and will provide unconditional care.  We need your support to make this dream come
true.

The National Wraparound Initiative defines
wraparound as, "...an intensive, holistic method of engaging with
individuals with complex needs (most typically children, youth, and their
families) so that they can live in their homes and communities and realize
their hopes and dreams."

We believe we have the experience to make
this happen.  In 1998, I was hired by the
Sacred Child Project, a demonstration project funded by the Substance Abuse
Mental Health Service Administration (SAMHSA) and the Center for Mental Health
Services (CMHS), as a care coordinator, where I implemented the wraparound
process with Native American families.  The
very first training I went to was with Dr. John VanDenBerg.  I spent two days listening to him talk about
the wraparound process, and what impressed me the most was that it sounded like
he was talking about our Lakota way of life. 
The last thing he said at the end of our two days together was, "I
feel blessed to be a part of this process."  At that point in my career, I really needed
to know what that felt like.  Over the
years, John has become a good friend and mentor of mine.  He is well known for his contributions to the
wraparound process and systems of care communities and is a volunteer
consultant to this project.

I have twenty four years of experience in
human services, working with children, families and communities and am
considered an expert on Systems of Care, the Wraparound Process, Family
Engagement and Equine Therapy.  Today, I
am self employed and have sixteen years of experience consulting with tribes,
states and national organizations.  I've
presented at tribal, state and national conferences across the United States
and Canada, but now want to focus my attention on my own homelands. 
We've gone through seven generations
of decline, it just might take us seven generations to come back out of this
again.  We have to have the foresight that
what we're doing today is going to have such a long reaching impact, that we're
going to touch seven generations into the future.  That's how strong we have to be in our faith
today.

Accountability: How we will spend
your money and why.
We already have the land, we have the horses, we have the youth, but we
need the physical tools.  Specifically, during
the first year while we build a permanent funding base, we will spend your
money on the following: 
· 
Arena. The
Standing Rock Sioux Reservation has eight tribal communities spread out over
2.3 million acres of land and travel can be a barrier to services and
supports.  We need a portable arena made
of 10’ welded corral panels that will allow us to be mobile so we can travel to
the eight communities.  Instead of
asking youth to come to us, we want to be the ability to go to them.  Safety is important and the arena will need
to be about 100’ by 80’.  36 panels X
$120/panel = $4320
· 
Tipi. We are
in need of seven lodges which we will use as part of the cultural lessons to
the youth.  Each part of the teepee has
special significance, as we assemble the lodges, we teach the story of woope,
our seven spiritual laws and star knowledge.  It has become a powerful team building
exercise.  We also talk about the roles
of men and women and the sacred gift of life. 
The seven lodges also represent the Oceti Sakonwin, or seven council
fires of our nation.  One 16' lodge with
poles, cover, door and liner costs would cost $1,500 x 7 = $10,500
· 
PA System.  We are in need of a good quality PA
system that would be used to provide sound at our community equine events,
i.e.,  horse races, Battle of the Greasy
Grass Celebration, Equine Assisted Learning events.  PA System = $2,500
· 
Gasoline and vehicle costs.  When we take the
program to other places, we need to buy gasoline and oil for the trucks and
trailers, and sometimes repair our old trucks. We need $3000  for transportation costs. 
· 
Advertising.
We have to get the word out about the program. We will use word of mouth, but
also will buy advertising on tribal radio and press.  We need $3,000 for advertising and developing
short film clips for use in publicity. 
· 
Consultants.  We would like to be able to pay
consultants to assist us in creating Lakota language immersion events.  The money donated would be used to pay
consultant fees, travel and lodging for Lakota speakers, two announcers for the
oskate and singers.  
Consultants = $5,000
· 
Food.  The Lakota have a strong belief that
food is medicine that can heal and strengthen our bodies and our spirit.  We are asking for assistance in making sure
that we have the ability to provide nutritional meals are our gatherings.  Food = $1,680
· 
Total Costs for the Year. We estimate the equipment and related costs for the
first year at $30,000 

Perks. 
The words of a traditional wopila olowan (Song of giving thanks), that
is sung to honor families during giveaways reminds me of why providing perks is
so important to this project.  "Tuwe sece kun, taku ota luha kin, oyate kin
wi canku, toksa ake luha ki."  Translation
- Whoever gives alot to the people, later will receive. 

The Lakota people have a long cultural tradition of honoring through
gifts and it's important to us that we include this value in this project.

story:
Our Story

"Guitars Under the Stars 2019" is the effort of three total strangers from as far across the globe as Sweden and Australia, who are linked together by a common desire to use their music for a greater cause. In this project, Matt Manzella (guitar, USA), Lara de Wit (piano, Australia), and Joel Sandberg (piano, Sweden) came together to arrange an EP of Disney cover songs ("Under the Sea", "Tale as Old as Time", and "A Whole New World") to raise money for Beaumont Children's Hospital in Royal Oak, Michigan.

100% of all money raised through this campaign will go directly to Beaumont Children's Hospital.

Beaumont Children's Hospital sees 150,000 children and teens each year, and offers 24-7 emergency pediatric care. The hospital's Pediatric Intensive Care Unit (PICU) helps young patients with serious injuries or illness receive care from board-certified doctors who specialize in pediatric critical care medicine.

Beaumont Children's Hospital also delivers over 17,000 babies each year, with board-certified Neonatologists caring for high-risk, premature and critically ill newborns around the clock.

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We've set our target goal at $1,000, but I'm hopeful and confident that we can exceed our goal with your generous help. 
  • In addition to a digital download of the "Guitars Under the Stars" songs and digital booklet, we're excited to offer additional perks such as studio-used guitar picks, hand-written thank you notes, and autographed album art!

 

The Impact

With 100% of the money raised through "Guitars Under the Stars 2019" going directly to Beaumont Children's Hospital, the money will be used in ways such as:

  • Providing teddy bears to each child for comfort.
  • Student heart checks.
  • Therapy services for children with autism and their families.
  • Special red wagons used to transport children throughout the hospital as needed.
  • Pediatric cancer infusion chairs for a child's comfort during treatment.
  • Customized therapy bikes for children with special needs.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please consider sharing this campaign on social media, along with the hashtag #GuitarsUnderTheStars2019
  • Consider using the Indiegogo "share" tools at the top of this page.

story:
Duplass Brothers present - Do More 104

 

What is #DoMore104?

To celebrate the release of our new show Room 104, we’ve teamed up with the Wounded Warrior Project and DEC Artists to do more good. 

The idea comes from our belief that there is always room to do more good things for others. How can we help? How can we do more? So we’re raising money to support the men and women of our armed forces and thank them for all they've done. 

Let’s do more together.

How does it work?

First, we're donating 100% of all donations made between July 12, 2017 and August 2, 2017 through the "Back It" button on this website directly to Wounded Warrior Project. 

Second, we've created a limited edition hand-pulled silkscreen poster from LA artist Teachr, and are selling prints, artists proofs, and other items in the Room 104 Store. We’re donating 50%* of the purchase price of every item sold in the Room 104 Store between July 12, 2017 and August 2, 2017 to the Wounded Warrior Project, and will match the total donation up to $5,000. And we ship worldwide too!

Third, for each time someone uses the hashtag #DoMore104 between July 12, 2017 and August 2, 2017, we’ll donate 10¢ to Wounded Warrior Project, up to another $5,000.

All in all, that’s $10,000 we’re ready to chip in. So spread the word, do some good, and check out Room 104 on HBO starting July 28th!

Room 104 Store

Limited Edition Room 104 Silkscreen Print - Los Angeles street artist Teachr created a Room 104 print.

  • Get one signed, numbered & embossed by the artist
  • Get one signed by Mark, or Jay, or Mark & Jay.
  • Hand printed on 100LB archival paper stock 

 

Buy A Sticker Pack 

  • We created 5 stickers based off the Limited Edition Room 104 print. This gets you all 5! Post them up around town, or throw one on your laptop!

 

Buy the Collectible Postcard Pack

We created 5 postcards based off the Limited Edition Room 104 print, and made a set of collectible postcards.

  • Only 250 of each design made
  • One liners on the back of each card.
  • Write your friend a note, or put it on your fridge!

Facetime with Mark

  • Have you ever wanted to ask Mark for some advice? Or talk about your favorite scene or character? Well here is your chance! (Only 5 available, get it fast!)

 

About Wounded Warrior Project:

Wounded Warrior Project® (WWP) serves veterans and service members who incurred a physical or mental injury, illness, or wound, co-incident to their military service on or after September 11, 2001 and their families. 

Offering programs ranging from mental heath and wellness to employment and education, WWP provides free services to address the needs of wounded warriors and fill gaps in government care. 

With the mission to honor and empower Wounded Warriors, WWP is the hand extended to encourage warriors as they adjust to their new normal and achieve new triumphs. 

---

*50% of the purchase price of every item sold in the Room 104 Store between July 12, 2017 through August 2, 2017 to the Wounded Warrior Project. The remaining 50% of purchase price will go to printing/ production/ packaging/ handling/ and all the other things it takes to put this campaign together so everything runs smooth, and we can get you your stuff and pay the people that put this all together. Thank you for the support!

NOTE: #DoMore104 is a campaign created by Mark Duplass & Daniel Dart.

story:
Who We Are

Our team, Feeding Happiness, consist of four University of Tennessee students who have bonded over a passion for helping those in need in our community. The team has seen the overlooked struggle of those hungry or undernourished in our community and have decided to pair with the local nonprofit, The Love Kitchen, to try and provide meals to those suffering from hunger in our community.

Two sisters, Ellen and Helen Ashe, founded The Love Kitchen and their vision was to help God feed his children and end hunger for those suffering in the Knoxville community. On February 14, 1986, the Love Kitchen first served 22 people at the church now known as Kingdom Life Restoration Center in east Knoxville. Today, The Love Kitchen is a 501(c)(3) organization operating in its own building about two blocks from where it all started and serves over 3,000 meals each week to those that are elderly, disabled, homebound, and/or homeless.

The Project 

You can be a part of Ellen and Helen’s mission to resolve the undernourishment and hunger that exists in our community. Your generous donation goes a long way, because The Love Kitchen operates solely off of private donations and volunteers.

One hundred percent of your donation will go directly towards providing money for meals made and provided by The Love Kitchen. Each meal made by the Love Kitchen costs 43 cents. Our goal is to raise a minimum of $2,000 dollars in order to raise enough money to pay for the cost of 4,651 meals. By reaching this goal, we will be able to provide the funds for over a weeks worth of meals that are made and delivered to those in need.

What You Get

We thank everyone for the support and generous donations that vary in all amounts. All contributions are greatly appreciated and positively make a difference in our efforts to help end hunger and undernourishment in the Knoxville Community.

For a donation of $10 you will receive a “The Love Kitchen” logo sticker. When making a $25 donation you will receive a special video shout out on our social media page thanking you for your generosity. For a donation of $50 you will receive a special spot on a wall piece with your name on it that will hang in The Love Kitchen. For donations of $100 you will receive a sticker, a special shout out on our social media page, and a spot on a wall piece with your name on it that will hang in The Love Kitchen. For a donation of $250 you will receive a signed picture of the staff, a shout out video, and a personal thank you letter.   

How it Helps the Community

The Love Kitchen serves over 3,000 meals each week with more than eighty percent of those meals being delivered to homebound recipients. Every Wednesday they provide an in-house breakfast and emergency food bags filled with both canned and dry goods for people to take with them. Thursdays, an in-house lunch is served, and volunteers deliver meals to the elderly, disabled, and/or homebound.The Love Kitchen’s purpose extends beyond feeding the community by also providing a safe haven for all of those in need of a secure place to go.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you would like to support our campaign but cannot currently please share our mission. You can spread the word by sharing our campaign over social media through liking our posts or by following us on Facebook, Instagram, or Twitter. You can also volunteer and become a direct part of offering concerned citizens the opportunity to reduce human suffering in a land so bountiful that none should go hungry.

On the behalf of The Love Kitchen, Feeding Happiness thanks you for your generosity and determination for this organization.

Every Wednesday they provide an in-house breakfast and emergency food bags filled with both canned and dry goods for people to take with them. Thursdays, an in-house lunch is served, and volunteers deliver meals to the elderly, disabled, and/or homebound.The Love Kitchen’s purpose extends beyond feeding the community by also providing a safe haven for all of those in need of a secure place to go.Other Ways You Can HelpIf you would like to support our campaign but cannot currently please share our mission. You can spread the word by sharing our campaign over social media through liking our posts or by following us on Facebook, Instagram, or Twitter. You can also volunteer and become a direct part of offering concerned citizens the opportunity to reduce human suffering in a land so bountiful that none should go hungry.On the behalf of The Love Kitchen, Feeding Happiness thanks you for your generosity and determination for this organization.

story:
We believe a change in healthcare is coming. Maybe you can feel it, too. The time for herbal medicine is now. 

Do you have a vision to revolutionise healthcare? Are you working to connect people with plants in your community? Are you ready for a wellness system focused on the health of people and the planet?

We believe that herbal medicine has a vital role to play in the emerging integrative healthcare system. We're excited to be a part of this work and we know that, together, we can seed the growth of a system that is grounded in nature, empowers individuals and connects communities.

Our lives are ever demanding and so is our health. I know there are people out there who have yet to become aware of what herbal medicine can do to support their health. Here is one of my stories to how I was introduced to herbal medicine:

I suffered excruciating time of the month where I’d faint or be out for two days every month which means my work, relationships, and goals were always affected. I was given a pill to pop daily but my symptoms never resided. I needed to find another answer.

Along came my studies into the world of Health Science. Where I was able to start to understand my body and learn about the medicinal benefits of food and medicinal herbal medicine. From the specific constitutions to how they have worked for 1000s of years with specific actions. I’d finally found the answers I was looking for. Through my experience I am now on a mission to help woman who are suffering symptoms were they are getting a band aid approach.

I’m currently studying a Bachelor of Health Science where I am attaining my degree in Naturopathy. I am creating a company with a line of products that can add to your quality of life. I will be doing this through opening a supplementary store which will provide the option of herbal remedies to health symptoms. While adhering to one of the naturopathic principles Docere, where I will be sharing knowledge to further empower our customers towards feeling good.

I’ll be starting off with two products Fem-Aid and Women’s Energy Balance. With product expansion to even more specific health concerns of anxiety, sleep, brain, immune, plus so many more.

 

​To provide the best informational products in the health & wellness industry that improve the quality of life of our customers. I believe that natural remedies, herbs and food can help prevent disease and increase quality of life. That the mind-body-spirit connection to physical illness is always present, and that integrating eastern views to western medicine can heal the body. By pre-ordering one of our brand new products or merchandise items below, you will forever be apart of taking The Feel Good Society to the next level. With your help we will be able to:

  • Get our dream started to make our supplements on demand so you don’t have to wait months at a time. 
  • Fulfill unlimited orders instead of limited batches.
  • Use a professional manufacturing facility to create the highest quality product possible in large quantities. 
  • Help to fund our packaging to make sure our products get as safe as possible to you. 
  • Ship products faster and more efficiently with the use of better computer programs and record keeping software. 
  • Expand our line of products to meet a wider range of customer needs.  
  • One day, get our products into retail stores. 
     

Herbal medicine is an ancient form of healing that has been used for thousands of years in every culture. The World Health Organization states that 80% of people worldwide rely on herbs as their primary source of medicine. In a time when I was afraid I would never feel like myself again, herbal medicine helped to turn my world around. Herbs empower us to take care of our health.

Here are your options to show your support with details of our gift in return to you:

Perk 1 - $50 AUD: Encouragement donation plus TFGS official bag or glass bottle

Perk 2 - $100 AUD: Good Starter provides you with the choice of either Fem-Aid or Personalised Herbal Blend for Energy Balance Support like the example plus the TFGS offical health starter merch kit (glass beaker, spoon, bag & bottle)

Perk 3 - $120 AUD: TFGS Biggest Fan provides you with both products (Fem-Aid and Personalised Herbal Blend for Energy Balance Support like the example) plus the TFGS offical health starter merch kit (glass beaker, spoon, bag & bottle)

ADDITIONALLY - You can also make a supportive contribution that doesn't come with any perks but I'd love to be able to send something physically to say thank you. Though virtual love is always welcomed and guaranteed too. 

PRODUCT WOMENS ENERGY BALANCE: 

Life is all about balance. But with the many expectations we put on ourselves we often neglect this aspect, and only find out when we’re already experiencing discomforts. Restoring your inner balance is a quest worth exploring. Women’s Energy Balance is here to bring support and guidance on yours. This all-in-one solution helps with any feminine battles you’re fighting. Face them head-on by taking 30 drops of this power tonic daily. Its powerful ingredients will leave your hormones in check, and your spirit carefree. 

GOOD FOR: Energy & Vitality | Hormonal Balance | Healthy Libido | PMS Relief

FOR WHO: To all women who would like to be the ultimate girl bosses that they are, without a whirlwind of hormones dragging them on a monthlong rollercoaster ride: Women’s Energy Balance is for you. 

THE STARS OF THE SHOW: All hail Chaste Tree Berries, the queen of regulators, here to restore hormonal balance. It may help stimulate progesterone and normalise oestrogen. It has been used to treat menstrual cycle pain, as well as menopause problems. Additionally, Dong Quai Root is here to support your female health, by increasing levels of oestrogen.  

You know we love ourselves a good it-couple. Ashwagandha and American Ginseng are here to steal the spotlight. Both stimulating one another, they bring back that spark of vitality that rudely abandons you when you’re PMS-ing.

Damiana is the natural aphrodisiac much needed to help you feel your utterly gorgeous self at any stage of your cycle. Get that mojo going and lift your spirit with a little help from your new floral friend. 

Lastly, we’ve got Gotu Kola Leaf in the mix, ready to regulate your hormonal output. Fear not, as balanced days are ahead.  

This above product can also be personalised to your specific health goals. 

PRODUCT FEM-AID:



Sayonara to the days of uncomfortably sitting out that monthly fit your uterus throws. Fem-Aid is here to calm your womb’s temper, by giving her a little extra lovin’. Some nourishment, a sprinkle of muscle relaxation, and a dash of uterine strength. This genius cocktail helps regulate your hormones all month long. No fear, for relief is here. Take 30 drops a day to make those crummy cramps go away.

GOOD FOR: Premenstrual Syndrome Relief | Regulating Period | Period Cramp Relief

FOR WHO: We’ve all got that one friend who has zilch issues when her monthly friend pays a visit. Fem-Aid isn’t for her, but for the ones aspiring to be like her. Banish those days of cramps and mood swings, and go live your best life. 

THE STARS OF THE SHOW: The combined actions of Chaste Tree Berries Leaf and Dong Quai will make sure your hormones are like yin and yang: balanced as can be. In the meantime, Dong Quai will support uterine health and strength: both much needed while on your period. To double the action, so will Red Raspberry Leaf.

Cramp Bark and Nettle Leaf will both nourish your body with micronutrients used to support healthy cycles, such as calcium and magnesium. 

Wild Yam is here to support reproductive health, but more importantly: it is said to reduce cramps. Paired with Garrya Leaf, which will support healthy muscle relaxation, cramps will be a no-show from now on. 

To support your liver, Oregon Grape Root is added to the mix. A healthy liver is essential to balance your hormones. To enhance the whole formula and elevate it to its full potential, Licorice Root wraps up Fem-Aid.

BONUSES:

The Feel Good Society branded educational bag for botany lovers + more goodness advised for certain perk levels too. 

About The Feel Good Society: Specialises in evidence-based personal care for your wellness needs through the use of science and herbs. We firmly believe in the power of knowledge, and that the deep mind-body-spirit connection can be restored, healed, and nurtured with a holistic approach. The Feel Good Society promotes the delicate balance between Western and Eastern medicine practice to empower health and make it accessible to anyone.


“I love this formula. I have traditionally used acupuncture to address migraines that arise prior to the period. As a result of the recent world events, I could not partake in acupuncture. I decided to try this formula to address PMS issues. It is truly a miracle product – I have had not one migraine prior to my period or cramps during the period. It works for me and hope it works for you!" - Amy

“Okay I’m shook. I went off birth control back in October after being on it for 10 years from being diagnosed with PCOS at the age of 16. From then on, my cycle was between 45-47 days with awful PMS symptoms (bloating, irritability, CRAMPS, etc.). I also think I was so used to the fake pill period that a real period was hell. So - I bought 3 bottles of Fem-Aid because Suzzi recommends using for 3 months. I have only finished one bottle and my cycle went down to 36 days and I had the best period of my life. Manageable cramps, almost no bloating, etc. I am so thankful - thank you!!” - Georjenna

“Im so grateful for this product. I have been told by so many doctors that the only answer to my periods was birth control. I finally decided to take my health into my own hands. Along with adjusting my diet (following woman code protocol) I have been using Fem-Aid to increase my reproductive health and balance my hormones. My periods are insanely better and more regular. Everything Suzzi touches turns to gold. You cannot go wrong with these products especially paired with habits and practices that support their use.” - Simone

“I absolutely LOVEEEE this product. This was my first herbal product purchase & I’m so happy with the results. I am a new mom of two, I was constantly overwhelmed with a lot on my plate and no energy in the tank. Now I manage everything so much better. So thankful for this <3” - Joy

“I’ve been taking this twice a day for 5 months to relieve physical energy struggles like fatigue and brain fog that were keeping me wanting to sleep all day long. I’d gone through some trauma at work that left me struggling to get out of bed. My doctor said nothing was wrong with me but I knew something wasn’t right. When i found woman energy balance I felt like I had finally received the support I was looking for. Now I wake up before the sun, got promoted to work I love and feel like I can do so much more. So so so thankful for this formula.” - Michelle

DISCLAIMER:

These statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. The Feel Good Society does not intend for any statements to take the place of advice given by your medical professional. It is intended for informational purposes only. Always consult your medical professional before taking any supplement or beginning a new regimen. These products should not be used by those who are pregnant or nursing. If you have a pre-existing condition or are on prescription medication, always consult with your physician first. These products are not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent disease. Please ensure you check out our FAQs section for more details. 

Shipping + Production Time:

Since our expansion is so new, this pre-order campaign is helping us gauge how much inventory we'll need. We will be putting in our order for production as soon as we can determine the amount of units to order based on the IndieGogo sales (we're aiming to do this halfway through the campaign to get a head start).

Once our order is in, production takes 8-10 weeks. As soon as everything is ready, your items will be shipped out to you (shipments take 3-5 business days to leave the warehouse). Please note: for shipments destined outside Australia, The Feel Good Society is not responsible for any brokerage fees and/or duties and taxes.

I will be posting updates on our progress through the 'Updates' section on this campaign as we go along. You'll be getting those updates straight to your e-mail so that you're always in the loop! We promise that we will work hard to get this done as quickly as we can.

 

Suzzi Hartery

Suzzi is completing her second degree after having fallen in love with natural medicine from personal use, and is the creator of thefeelgoodsociety.com. She has been writing articles about her research on chronic illness, pathophysiology and herbal medicine for over the past three years. She see the importance of showing her community there is another way to support your health and well-being. She's incredibly passionate about herbal medicine and what it can do for the body.

Shaun Staddon

Having run his own company for over twenty years and partner to Suzzi for 14 years. His the guy who is the backbone of operations and grew up on a farm where natural remedies were the first thought to any aliment or health need. 

Plus of course, the team wouldn't be complete without all the friends and family that have stayed up long hours to help us along the way. We love you!

We understand some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #TFGS2020 and tag me as well @suzzihartery and also @thefeelgoodsociety so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers and please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support! We are so looking forward to launching.

Thanks again,
Suzzi (& Shaun)
