I have always put my horses and other people's horses well-being first. I have not hesitated to help whether it was financially justifiable or not, I feel that the karma from this will keep opening the right doors and continue to support the work I feel so dedicated to. 
If you are not a horse owner, but are interested in energy/healing work, we can arrange non-horsey rewards. If you would like to help in a practical way with building fences or renovation work for example, don't hesitate to get in touch! 
Recommending and sharing our campaign in any way will help us greatly if you are not able to contribute financially. You can use the Indiegogo share tools to do this, or send the link via social media, Thank you so much! We are grateful you took the time to learn more about the Beyond Boundaries Equine Retreat!

story:
Competition on Facebook - Now: 10/2 to the 13/2:

Have You seen our speciel "just before spring - offers with low prices"

We make a lottery where You can win 2 night stay + breakfast for 2 persons in Our Mongolien Yurt tents, When You share and like our Crowdfunding campaign, plus like our Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/centerforpeaceandjoy/

The competetion is running from today saturday 10/2 to tuesday 13/2 

Tjeck out our speciel "just before spring - offers with low prices"

Who are We?

  • A Danish heart centered couple who loves People, Nature, and our beautiful World
  • We live in Denmark, close to Aarhus in our old stone-timbered house at a cozy and beautiful nature spot with beautiful landscape, the stream running and forest on our land.
  • We believe and experience that if/when people tap into their hearts wisdom, they will be with great stuff for themselves as well to other people and the world.
  • "What does Your heart sense"? is an important question we like to ask you many times along the other training.

 

Why this campaign?

  • In Lars's summer holiday he wrote in his bucket list:                                                                            That he likes to experience peace in the world within our time living.                                      It gave us a lot of talks, which led to this initiative:                                                                     Center for Peace and Joy  - Connectedness with nature and within.
  • We will ask people who come here; what ideas they have to help peace in the world?
  • Our desire is to create a peaceful haven where people can find room and space for relaxation and connectedness with themselves, each other and the nature.
  • We seek financial assistance to restoration of our old stable, so that it can be used as a course venue and café for the people who stay in the Mongolian Yurt tents and people who will join our courses and retreats in general.
  • We will build a cozy kitchen-café
  • We will build nice and cozy teaching facilities as part of the kitchen-café.                                   A part of the training room will be a glasshouse with woodburning stove, so we can sense the beautiful naturescenery, weather shifts, animal life: such as deers and birds life.
  • We will build shower and toilet facilities
  • Upstairs under the roof, we will build 2-3 rooms, where people can have accommodation during their, retreat, wellness, training, connectedness with nature and  within.

 

What does your contribution mean to the project?

  • Before we bought this beautiful place three years ago we knew that we would create a special center with cources and connectedness to nature.                                                       You can help that our facilities are used, and help new ones to come forward.
  • A center where people get nearer to their hearts wisdom, helped by peace and nature.
  • You might think, like we do, that the world needs people and places where people can find peace, joy and energy to tab into their longing for peace, love, flow and joy etc.                    At the same time the same People all can help Peace in the world to come forward, by adding their love, heart message and their share.

 

  • We would really appreciate if You like to help share this message, on Facebook or directly to Your friends spoken or by email J
  • When You back our campaign You Yourself can come and stay in the Mongolian tents and enjoy the beautiful nature scenery on our land and in the beautiful nature around us.
  • So back us – we are looking forward to meet You.
  • You can come and stay in the Mongolian tents from march 2018- June 2019

We thank for Your time and interest shown.

And invite You to help us, grow Center for Peace and Joy. 

We wish You the best - and invite Joy and Peace in our world to come forward.

Lene Heiselberg Vang & Lars Heiselberg Vang Jensen

story:
The Story on Aether Wellness

Hi! I'm Alyssa (she/her) and I'm the founder of Aether Wellness. (Psst "Aether" is like "ether"--just the British spelling because the AE represents my initials!) 

Aether is a culmination of my passion for how the body moves; a mix of yoga and bodywork (plus eventually nutrition) for all-around wellness that balances your mind, soul, and body. 

Starting a business during a pandemic is tough, and I've taken some big leaps already with my funds (like getting a shiatsu table and investing in custom bolsters!). Coming up with the costs associated with my licensure, insurance, software needs, and other start up costs all at once is tough when I can't actually practice until the company is official.

That is where I'm hoping you come in. 

 

What I Need & What You Get

My goal is to raise $2,500. My projected expenses for the first three months of business (outlined below) total a little over $1,900, and Indiegogo will keep about $100 of that. Additionally I am hoping for a $500 cushion for unforeseen expenses (and a bottle of good wine to celebrate the official launch!)

What you get for helping me:

  • for a $25 donation, you'll get 33% off a 60-minute session at Aether
  • for a $50 donation, you'll get 50% off a 90-minute session at Aether
  • for a $100 donation, you'll get 50% off a 90-minute session at Aether and you are entered in a drawing for a 120-minute shiatsu session

What I need to launch:

  • Certificate of Assumed Name ($50)
  • License - City of Minneapolis ($55)
  • Rent - studio space for three months ($725)
  • Website - annual hosting ($215)
  • Liability insurance ($150)
  • Electronic Health Record software ($80*3 months=$250)
  • Suction cupping set ($80)
  • Herbs for moxibustion ($20)
  • Auricular Therapy seeds and beads ($20)
  • Therapeutic magnets ($30)
  • Laundry detergent ($75)
  • Business cards ($20)
  • Fliers ($50)
  • Utilities for three months (estimate $200)
  • Fees from Indiegogo (estimate $100)

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone has extra funds! Heck, if I did I wouldn't be creating this campaign. So, if you love me and money doesn't seem to be loving you right now, here are some other ways you can support me:

  • Spread the word! Let your friends and family know that I offer bodywork and send them my way.
  • Follow me on social media! Instagram and Twitter at @aetherwell.
  • Check out my website, and share it: aetherwell.com.
  • Share links to my campaign.
  • Send me a message of support! Positive affirmations are much appreciated.

story:
We Love Science. We Need Magic. The Little Green Monster shows us an ultrasound image of a tumor, a parent with an IV receiving chemotherapy, and subsequent hair loss. The monster celebrates family time with laughter, cuddling under the night sky, and celebrating special memories.

Families need high quality, beautiful literature about living with cancer. There are very few available on the market. And, many families cannot afford to buy a children's book, which may feel like an extra during the high cost of cancer treatment. Literature is an important mirror for children to express their emotions during this difficult time. Help put The Little Green Monster in the hands of cancer-impacted families!

NOTE: All depictions of perks are to give you an idea of what is to come. You will receive a plastic frisbee, a hard copy of the book, a cotton/recycled plastic t-shirt, an .mov Video, a fabric doll, a live author reading event... Not drawn paper versions!

story:
About the Founder & the Nonprofit

My name is Tina LeMar.  I have been a yoga and meditation instructor for over fifteen years.  It has been my passion and life for many years.  When people ask me why I started teaching I always say the same thing..."It saved my life."  How, you ask?  I grew up afflicted with very low self-esteem that led to panic attacks, agoraphobia, and severe anxiety.  I also have scoliosis (curvature of the spine) which made my spine very weak.  I played a lot of sports growing up and it all made my back much worse. I ended up with several herniated discs and was in severe pain for six months, barely able to walk.  What saved me from the pain in my mind and in my back?  YOGA & MEDITATION.  With meditation my self-esteem and confidence grew and it crushed my anxiety and panic attacks.  I am no longer a victim of my mind.  And I rehabbed my back with yoga ONLY (and Advil). Today I walk with strength and without pain.  It is truly amazing.  THIS is how yoga and meditation saved my life.

I felt so incredibly grateful that I became a yoga instructor, opened a business, and had a successful business and practice for over fifteen years.  In all of those years I met so many wonderful people, from all walks of life.  I met people in chronic pain, people with unmanageable stress, people at the point of breaking from sadness and low self esteem, people suffering with panic attacks, agoraphobia, and anxiety and depression just as I had, addicts and alcoholics and many more.  I was blessed to see, year after year, the incredible changes that yoga and meditation had made on these individuals.  I especially saw significant changes in people with chronic pain, addictions, and low self esteem.  I saw these people, at the most raw state of being, calling for help, with no strength or voice left.  These people were at their end mentally and physically.  They wanted to die because they thought it would be easier.  Yoga and meditation changed their lives.  When they stretched they felt open, vulnerable, and able to cry and start over.  When they meditated I asked them to speak kindly to themselves, to tell themselves they are worthy of life and love and happiness.  They smiled, and cried, and began to heal.  I saw it.  Right in front of me.  It was glorious and beautiful.  I saw HOPE.

What Sheltered Yoga does is bring HOPE and TOOLS TO REHABILITATE & THRIVE to individuals just like the ones I described. Through yoga, meditation, wellness and self esteem workshops they learn to believe in themselves again.  To feel love that lessens their fear.  To feel confidence and strength that abandons weakness.  To work with their pain and change their relationship with it.  To see and feel hope.  To LIVE instead of just SURVIVE.

What We Need 

Sheltered Yoga is asking for $5,000.  We hope to raise even more if possible.  This money will go directly to funding the services we provide.  We hire yoga/meditation instructors, psychologists, wellness coaches, inspirational speakers on positive thinking, self esteem, and learning how to love oneself. And we bring these workshops right into homeless and women's shelters in Philadelphia and the surrounding area. We hope to expand to Camden, Trenton, and Newark, NJ as well, as these are much needed locations. We offer the professionals that we hire a competitive hourly wage in order to maintain strong instructors that are consistent.  This in turn will help create stability and openness within the homeless and women's communities. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign PLEASE. The more people contribute in whatever way they can, the more people we can help. It is such an important effort.  Please help today.

story:
Hello, my name is Caroline North.  I would like to give you a little background on why I’m asking for your financial support.

For the past 20 years, I have been teaching riding with an emphasis on developing the horse and human connection thorough balance of mind, body and spirit for the betterment and joy of both horse and rider. 

My husband Matt and I own a riding stable located about 40 minutes south of Buffalo, NY. Our goal is to use Kripula Yoga techniques as the foundation to bring the benefits of the unique, but powerful, combination of yoga and horses to our students and students in our neighboring communities. 

In my own pursuit of this balance, I turned to yoga. I have been practicing yoga on a regular basis for over 20 years. During that time, I realized the mindfulness, breath awareness, the nuances of physical and mental control yoga can develop greatly enhanced my skills as a rider and teacher.  These skills also helped connect me to my horses and enhance their lives and well-being on a much deeper level than I ever expected!

Over the years I have been introduced to a variety of yoga styles. Kripalu’s yoga program mirrors the balanced approach towards mind, body and spirit I use in my horsemanship program. This type of yoga stands out from all the rest which is why I'm turning to you for financial backing. I would like to train for my Kripalu Yoga Teacher Certification course in December, 2019.

Why should you support me?

Yoga has sustained the test of time as one of the oldest and most practiced mediums of generating balance, healing and connection.  I personally experience what powers can be revealed through practicing yoga.  Combining Kripalu yoga and the pureness of the horse allows students to flourish through teaching both yoga and horsemanship. It is a magical connection which will drive honest communication and lead to true healing. Your financial support will make a difference not just to me, but to many students in need of the horse and yoga connection to move forward in their lives. 

I am convinced becoming a Kripalu yoga teacher certification is the key to opening the Light of Yoga that heals both body and mind. This course will give me the credentials to bring the best of yoga and horsemanship together to benefit students of all ages and abilities. 

The Impact on Many Lives

The power of bringing yoga and horses together teaches joy and harmony and fosters relationships, our communities and our world. Research has shown countless numbers of people can be helped - those with PTSD, unbalanced emotional, physical or mental - backgrounds have all benefited through animals and yoga.

Being able to relate with another being is a fundamental ability we all need. Helping others learn to connect and balance their lives is an invaluable tool to navigate our world today.  I have already been doing this in a limited manner on my farm, now its time to branch out further into the community.

Please consider financially supporting me in my pursuit of providing an outstanding program. Reflect on the impact this unique opportunity will have in  student’s lives. I hope to offer this program to anybody who has an interest and hope to continue to move it forward with a Kripalu education. But remember, this is only the beginning.  In Western New York, our community centers lack gentle supportive physical programs for our seniors, youth and people seeking to stay closer to home.  My goal is to also teach in school programs, senior centers and provide classes in local parks and farms.

What will I do for you?

Check out the perks!  Cool mandalas, T-shirts and gift certificates! I will list all sponsors on my website (if authorized by the sponsor) and promote them at every public opportunity where I work or demonstrate my program. Please keep in mind you will be supporting something innovative and positive.  And finally, please keep in mind your support could be the key that provides the financial backing for a program that will change lives forever.

Namaste

"May the light within me honor the light within you!" 

Thank you for considering supporting my program. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Caroline needs $4700 for tuition and housing costs for the month of the 200 hour yoga teacher training at the Kripalu Center starting December 1st, 2019.
  •  Check out the perks!  Handmade mandala notecards, artwork, Namaste T-shirts, Gift Certificates for classes and riding lessons, and even a special yoga and horses retreat day!
  • If our goal isn't quite reached, then every little bit helps.  If our goal is reached and exceeded, Caroline will be able to pass the funds on to the Kripalu scholarship program to help other hopeful yoga students.

Risks & Challenges

Being a Horsewoman and a farm owner, Caroline faces all sorts of physical, mental and financial challenges every day.  She has 20 years of experience in riding these challenges out, whether it's an upset horse, a bad hay year, a unexpected vet bill, or a struggling student. 

She has learned how to adapt and change her perspective to come up with creative solutions to challenges, as well as the will to persevere.  Yoga has played a big part in knowing when to stop and rest, to change positions, and how to sacrifice some things and build on others.  She is confident with this breadth of experience, bringing Yoga to her corner of the world will be a resounding success!

Other Ways You Can Help

If monetary contribution is not an option you can still help!

Please like and share our links on Facebook, through email and start conversations!  Every little bit of good will helps!

story:
Sobre el proyecto

#ReseteAss nace con la intención de dar la bienvenida al 2021 con positivismo, ilusión y buen rollo. Está claro que el rojo no funcionó en 2020, por eso hemos apostado por romper con la tradición y jugarlo todo al verde. 

Esta NavidAss cambia la manera de dar la bienvenida al año nuevo con #ReseteAss, la ropa interior solidaria que dona todos sus beneficios a la investigación contra la COVID. 
 

 

¿Para qué es la financiación?

Todos los beneficios de la campaña de Navidad de DDB Health Barcelona irán destinados a la investigación del Hospital Sant Joan de Déu para hacer de 2021 un año mucho mejor y más seguro para todos. 

 

Sobre DDB Health Barcelona

Somos DDB Health Barcelona, una agencia global, joven y fresca especializada en health care y wellness que rompe con las reglas de comunicación en ambos sectores.

Formamos parte de la red global de DDB Health, presente en 6 países. En Bacelona contamos con un equipo multidisciplinar científico, creativo, estratega y de espíritu rebelde, con el que afrontamos los briefings con originalidad, buscando la diferencia en cada proyecto en el que nos involucramos. Siempre focalizados en resultados.

Tenemos la experiencia y los conocimientos para afrontar cualquier reto, incluso los que parecen imposibles de solucionar. Tenemos la actitud necesaria para atrevernos a todo. Pero sobre todo, estamos aquí para demostrar que con creatividad y estrategia podemos conseguir un mundo más sano, en el que el bienestar y la salud es nuestra prioridad.

story:
Background

Room Here is a non-profit that focuses on Healthier Minds at Work. We started as a small group of Utah CEOs that gathered after losing a friend to suicide and have started this non-profit as we saw how much how widespread of an issue mental health is.

Our #mentalfitness movement will normalize the conversation and help people, companies and communities work together on mental wellness.

We have over 50 tech companies and startups like Weave, Homie, Chatbooks, Degreed, Jane.com and Dsco supporting our movement and are excited to involve the whole Utah tech and startup community after we launch!

How Are We Launching?

We're launching in a record-breaking way by breaking the record for World's Largest Cardboard Fort with over 13,000 boxes and we need your help!!! The fort is symbolic of the ways companies will create Room Here within their companies for conversation and safety. 

What We Need & What You Get

Your support will:
- Help us buy/rent materials for the launch: massive amounts of tape, art supplies, trailer to transport 13,000 boxes (!)
- Help us further our mission to normalize the conversation around mental fitness.
- Help us train more Roomies (mental fitness allies) in the tech companies and startups throughout Utah.

Backer benefits include:
$1 - List your name as a supporter of the movement on our website. Any and all support helps!

$5 - Above benefit + Room Here sticker!

$10 - Above benefit + attendance at our open house to see our record breaking fort! (did we mention 13,000 boxes???

$25 - Above benefits + your name on a box on our contributor wall

$40 - Above benefits + Room Here t-shirt

$100 - Above benefits + personal shout out on our social media

$250 - Your company’s logo on our Company Supporter box wall

$2,500 - Sponsor a Room Here Room (only 2 of 6 room remaining)

The Impact

In this Covid-crazy world, there's never been a more important time to focus on mental fitness. Stress, anxiety and uncertainty are at all time highs, and we need to work together to help each other through this. 

We appreciate your support and this grassroots movement can't succeed without the backing of our community! Thank you!

Risks & Challenges

We're already well on our way to accomplishing our goal! We have close to 11,000 of the 13,000 boxes collected so far. Unlike other crowdfunding projects, there are very few risks to us completing this world record.

Can't Contribute?

We still need lots of help!

  • Come break a world record with us! Sign up to build with us here!
  • Follow us on IG @room_here

Thanks for your help!

story:
Thank you all for taking the time to read this. As you all know, our beloved friend, brother, co-worker, family man, and 007 clone passed on St. Patrick's day. The most selfless man I know with the heart of gold always looked after all of us. He did it so well, he sacrificed his own health to do so. His life of servitude stood out as an all-encompassing hug to anyone and everyone around him. Very seldom did we get the chance to hug him back. Now is that chance. In order for us to give him the send-off he deserves and give each of us one last chance to see him, we are requesting some monetary assistance. While we all think he is worth the moon and the stars, whatever you can spare will go miles. I thank you all for the time and support during this challenging time. I/we love you all!

- Jay

story:
Every day we receive 3-4 new cases of sexual abuse.

For a child who has experienced this trauma, the healing journey is crucial to each child living an emotionally, mentally, and physically healthy life.  Which is why we would like to bring the therapeutic experience of a healing garden to the Children’s Advocacy Center of Kent County.

The Healing Garden at the Children’s Advocacy Center of Kent County will be a space where children who have experienced the trauma of sexual abuse will be able to benefit from the therapeutic elements of nature. There will be native plantings, flowing water, and even a drum circle to provide sensory stimulation, which research shows has a positive impact on healing from trauma.

Why would a healing garden be beneficial to the children that we serve?

We have an opportunity to utilize nature as a healing tool for the children that we serve.  The outdoors is naturally restorative and therapeutic, and provides an opportunity for the children to work through their treatment process while experiencing the healing benefits of the outdoors.

How would the healing garden be incorporated into counseling sessions?

The healing garden would be incorporated into practicing coping skills like mindfulness and relaxation techniques.  The garden can provide a richer sensory experience for the children to practice these skills.

Is there research on the positive impact of healing gardens on victims of trauma?

Documented studies have explored the benefits of nature in working with trauma survivors.  The research has shown that the exposure to nature has had many benefits, including; decreasing stress and anxiety, and increasing relaxation and self-esteem.

How can you get involved?

Support the campaign by purchasing a garden feature or making a contribution!  The Children’s Advocacy Center supports children at their most vulnerable: when they are recovering from the disruptive experience of sexual abuse. For a child who has experienced this trauma, the healing journey is crucial to each child living an emotionally, mentally, and physically healthy life.  A healing garden at the Children’s Advocacy Center of Kent County will be a key piece of that journey.

We have an opportunity to utilize nature as a healing tool for the children that we serve.  The outdoors is naturally restorative and therapeutic, and provides an opportunity for the children to work through their treatment process while experiencing the healing benefits of the outdoors.

How would the healing garden be incorporated into counseling sessions?
The healing garden would be incorporated into practicing coping skills like mindfulness and relaxation techniques.  The garden can provide a richer sensory experience for the children to practice these skills.

Is there research on the positive impact of healing gardens on victims of trauma?
Documented studies have explored the benefits of nature in working with trauma survivors.  The research has shown that the exposure to nature has had many benefits, including; decreasing stress and anxiety, and increasing relaxation and self-esteem.

How can you get involved?
Support the campaign by purchasing a garden feature or making a contribution!  The Children’s Advocacy Center supports children at their most vulnerable: when they are recovering from the disruptive experience of sexual abuse. For a child who has experienced this trauma, the healing journey is crucial to each child living an emotionally, mentally, and physically healthy life.  A healing garden at the Children’s Advocacy Center of Kent County will be a key piece of that journey.

story:
Funding:

This fundraiser is to help defray the cost of building a portable six-person, propane powered steam sauna.  I will also be applying for a grant in Apogaea’s “seed money round” grant round this spring, any remaining costs will be come from my pocket.  All money from this fundraiser goes directly into purchasing supplies to build the sauna:

  • $420 R-max octa-yurt with vinyl hinges, velcro closure & plastic floor.
  • $600 Cedar floor & benches
  • $400 Convection heater, plumbing & water storage
  • $280 Privacy curtain & changing area

 

2018 is right around the corner and I have BIG plans to share this awesome experience with my community.  Barring any unforeseen circumstances my plan is to bring the Steam Sauna to:

- Pagan Bunny Burn in March (Elk Creek Ca)

- Apogaea in June (Valdez Co)

- Elsewhence in September (Bailey Co)  

Thanks so much for considering to support my next project.  I've decided not to include "perks" with this campaign - and instead will be putting every dollar toward building the sauna.   In my eyes, the opportunity to relax and recuperate with beautiful souls outshines stickers and key-chains any day.

story:
Our Story

Our names are Angie Alt, NTC, CHC and Mickey Trescott, NTP and we are the nutritional therapy team behind Autoimmune Wellness, a website, podcast, and associated social media channels dedicated to seeking health and building community for those with autoimmune diseases. With five autoimmune diseases between us, we found our path to better health and stronger community through the Autoimmune Protocol (AIP) and now it is our mission to share this approach. (If you would like to learn exactly what the AIP is, you can find a comprehensive guide here.)

In addition to writing books, creating tools, supporting individuals in our private practices, and teaching other practitioners how to use AIP, one of the ways we work to share this approach is through advocating for and participating in the medical research process. We pursue medical research to move AIP beyond anecdotal evidence and make its application a bigger part of the conversation in the conventional medicine world.

Our Newest Research Project and Goal

We were privileged to help lead the first two medical studies of AIP in 2016 and 2018. In 2019, we are teaming up with MD/PhD student Lucy Mailing, a laboratory researcher in the Division of Nutritional Sciences at the University of Illinois and senior research associate for the Kresser Institute, to further AIP research by conducting a small pilot medical study entitled, “Effects of an anti-inflammatory diet on the gut microbiome and gut barrier function in eczema and psoriasis patients.”

We’ll be using a very similar study design as we used in 2016 and 2018, utilizing SAD to AIP in SIX, an online group health coaching program, to transition participants to AIP, a coaching team to support and monitor the participants, and a medical doctor to conduct medical analysis, all occurring over 14 weeks, including pre and post-testing.

Our goal is to partner with our community and raise $8,000 for this study. We hope taking an active role in the grassroots effort to push for the study process will help empower our community.

Our Experience with Research

In 2016 Angie partnered with Dr. Gauree Konijeti, the Director of the Inflammatory Bowel Disease Program Division of Gastroenterology at Scripps Clinic in La Jolla, California, on a study entitled, “Efficacy of the Autoimmune Protocol Diet for Inflammatory Bowel Disease.” They used Angie’s group health coaching program, SAD to AIP in SIX, to lead study participants through a transition to the Autoimmune Protocol and then a maintenance period. The results were amazing and included clinical remission for 73% of the participants.

In 2018 Angie partnered with Dr. Rob Abbott, the Medical Director of Resilient Roots Collaborative in Charlottesville, VA, on a study entitled, "Efficacy of the Autoimmune Protocol Diet as Part of a Multi-disciplinary, Supported Lifestyle Intervention for Hashimoto’s Thyroiditis." Again, they used Angie’s group health coaching program, SAD to AIP in SIX, to lead study participants through a transition to the Autoimmune Protocol and then a maintenance period. The results were again impressive, with  a statistically significant improvement in health-related quality of life scores, a significant decrease in clinical symptom burden, and a significant decrease in inflammation markers.

These positive collaboration experiences prompted us to continue looking for research opportunities. Lucy came forward as an enthusiastic partner after conducting several studies looking at the effects of diet and lifestyle interventions on the gut microbiome.

Our Team & Qualifications

Our application for this new study on AIP for eczema and psoriasis will soon be approved by an institutional review board, which demonstrates confidence in our qualifications and approach; however, we want to let you know more about our team:

Lucy Mailing graduated from Kalamazoo College with a B.A. in Biology and is now a fourth-year MD-PhD candidate in the Division of Nutritional Sciences at the University of Illinois. She is also a senior research associate for the Kresser Institute for Functional and Evolutionary Medicine and was named an Emerging Leader in Nutrition Science by the American Society for Nutrition in 2017. Her laboratory research focuses on how diet and exercise can beneficially modulate the gut microbiome and gut barrier function in states of health and disease. Lucy is the founder and sole author of NextGen Medicine, writing evidence-based articles about gut and skin health, nutrition, the microbiome, and exercise science. Lucy will be heading up the medical side of the study, using laboratory testing and dietary assessments to gather data about the outcomes for the small group of participants.

Angie Alt is a Certified Health Coach and Nutritional Therapy Consultant, who has been running her group health coaching program for 6 years, teaching thousands of members how to use AIP to help improve their health. She and her coaching team of other nutritional therapists will be heading up the dietary side of the study, using the SAD to AIP in SIX program to walk participants with eczema or psoriasis through the transition to AIP and then supporting them during a maintenance period.

Doctor's Data, in a partnership led by Dr. David Quig, has generously offered to supply discounted intestinal permeability and short-chain fatty acid laboratory testing. This specialized testing by such a cutting-edge clinical laboratory also greatly strengthens the team.  

What We Need and What You Get

Most research studies of this scale if conducted at a major academic institution would easily cost $25-50,000, we're attempting to pull it off for $20,000! While we have been able to secure grants and other forms of funding, we're still $8,000 short in order to help fund the health coaching team and possibly increase the subject number for more impactful analyses.

Here’s a breakdown of our budget:

Sample collection, shipping, & processing  - $5,000

Microbiome sequencing - $3,720

Metabolite analysis - $3,200

Subject compensation - $4,000

Coaching Team Compensation - $3,350 (for the duration of the project)

Crowdfunding and credit card processing fees - 8%

Discretionary - $200

We feel that more research is an important investment in the AIP movement! The team at Autoimmune Wellness is beyond dedicated to doing everything in our power to advance the future of autoimmune treatment and we know you are too!

Here’s a breakdown of what we have to give back:

$10 - Our Thanks - We appreciate your contribution to the study!

$25 - Public Thanks -Have your name listed in a public recognition post on Autoimmune Wellness.

$100 - Live Q+A Session - Join Angie, & Lucy for an exclusive Q+A & gratitude session via Zoom.

$250 - Signed Book Bundle - Receive signed copies of all three of our hard copy books (The Autoimmune Wellness Handbook, The Autoimmune Paleo Cookbook, and The Alternative Autoimmune Cookbook - delivery within the US only).

$500 - Rockstar Recognition - We will be blasting your brand and/or name and expressing our deep appreciation for your contribution on every corner of social media!

When Will We Share the Results?

If we are able to raise the money needed and find suitable participants in time, Lucy hopes to begin statistical analysis by the end of this year and make a submission to a peer-reviewed journal by early 2020. Given our previous experience with the first AIP studies and the nature of this particular study, we expect that the study process from enrollment of participants and the program itself through statistical analysis and publication will take at least one year. As soon as results are published, we will be sharing through a large social media campaign to make sure everyone in our community who contributed sees how things went!

Thank You!

This is an exciting step and we are thrilled to take it with your support! Contributing to research which produces solid, scientific, peer-reviewed data can create stronger collaboration with the conventional medical system and spark the paradigm shift we are all working toward in the AIP movement. Sincerely, thank you!

story:
Our Story

Our names are Angie Alt, NTC, CHC and Mickey Trescott, NTP and we are the nutritional therapy team behind Autoimmune Wellness, a website, podcast, and associated social media channels dedicated to seeking health and building community for those with autoimmune diseases. With five autoimmune diseases between us, we found our path to better health and stronger community through the Autoimmune Protocol (AIP) and now it is our mission to share this approach. (If you would like to learn exactly what the AIP is, you can find a comprehensive guide here.)

In addition to writing books, creating tools, supporting individuals in our private practices, and teaching other practitioners how to use AIP, one of the ways we work to share this approach is through advocating for and participating in the medical research process. We pursue medical research to move AIP beyond anecdotal evidence and make its application a bigger part of the conversation in the conventional medicine world.

Our Newest Research Project and Goal

We were privileged to help lead the first-ever medical study of AIP in 2016. In 2018, we are teaming up with Rob Abbott, M.D., our resident Medical Advisor at Autoimmune Wellness, to further AIP research by conducting a small pilot medical study entitled, “Efficacy of the Autoimmune Protocol Diet for Hashimoto's Thyroid Disease.”

We’ll be using a very similar study design as we used in 2016, utilizing SAD to AIP in SIX to transition participants to AIP, a coaching team and registered dietician to support and monitor the participants, and a medical doctor to conduct medical analysis, all occurring over 14 weeks, including pre and post-testing.

Our goal is to partner with our community and raise $10,000 for this study. We hope taking an active role in the grassroots effort to push for the study process will help empower our community.

Our Experience with Research

In 2016 Angie partnered with Dr. Gauree Konijeti, the Director of the Inflammatory Bowel Disease Program Division of Gastroenterology at Scripps Clinic in La Jolla, California, on a study entitled, “Efficacy of the Autoimmune Protocol Diet for Inflammatory Bowel Disease.” They used Angie’s group health coaching program, SAD to AIP in SIX, to lead study participants through a transition to the Autoimmune Protocol and then a maintenance period. The results were amazing and included clinical remission for 73% of the participants.

This positive collaboration experience prompted us to continue looking for research opportunities. Dr. Abbott came forward as an enthusiastic partner, after conducting an extremely encouraging case study on a Hashimoto’s patient who had been through Angie’s program while adopting AIP.

Our Team & Qualifications

Our application for this new study on AIP for Hashimoto’s was approved by an institutional review board, which demonstrates confidence in our qualifications and approach, however we want to let you know more about our team.

Dr. Abbott is a family medicine resident at the Virginia Commonwealth University, Shenandoah Valley Family Medicine Residency Program and medical director of the newly formed Charlottesville Center for Functional Medicine. Dr. Abbott has completed training with the Institute for Functional Medicine, is a Kresser Institute ADAPT Level 1 trained clinician, and is an AIP Certified Coach. Dr. Abbott will be heading up the medical side of the study, using surveys focused on quality of life and symptom burden, laboratory testing (including thyroid function), and dietary assessments to gather data about the outcomes for the small group of participants.

Angie Alt is a Certified Health Coach and Nutritional Therapy Consultant, who has been running her group health coaching program for 5 years, teaching thousands of members how to use AIP to help improve their health. Her team will include other nutritional therapists and Kerri Cooper, RD. Angie and her team will be heading up the dietary side of the study, using the SAD to AIP in SIX program to walk participants with Hashimoto’s thyroid disease through the transition to AIP and then supporting them during a maintenance period.

Genova Diagnostics, led by their Director of Clinical Evidence, Lihong Chen, MD, PhD, has generously offered to supply nutritional and gastrointestinal health status testing for each participant, utilizing their NutrEval FMV Organic Acid Test and their GI Effects Comprehensive Stool Analysis Test. This specialized testing by such a cutting-edge clinical laboratory also greatly strengthens the team.  

What We Need and What You Get

Most research studies of this scale if conducted at a major academic institution would easily cost $25-50,000, and we’re attempting to pull it off for $10,000! Genova is supplying state-of-the-art testing that alone is worth tens of thousands. Additionally, we’ll ask participants to pay a small fee to join the program, as this investment is often associated with improved adherence to a health change. However, there are still other basic laboratory tests and costs of the study we need to cover.

Here’s a breakdown of our budget:

  • Basic lab testing - $398 per participant ($4000-$6000)
  • Dr. Abbott Compensation - $1,500 (for the duration of the project)
  • Dietary Team Compensation - $1000 (for the duration of the project)
  • Crowdfunding and credit card processing fees - 8%
  • Discretionary - $500

We feel that more research is an important investment in the AIP movement! The team at Autoimmune Wellness is beyond dedicated to doing everything in our power to advance the future of autoimmune treatment and we know you are too!

Here’s a breakdown of what we have to give back:

  • $10 - Our Thanks - We appreciate your contribution to the study!
  • $25 - Public Thanks -Have your name listed in a public recognition post on Autoimmune Wellness.
  • $100 - Live Q+A Session - Join Mickey, Angie, & Dr. Abbott for an exclusive Q+A & gratitude session via Google Hangouts.
  • $250 - Signed Book Bundle - Receive signed copies of all three of our hard copy books (The Autoimmune Wellness Handbook, The Autoimmune Paleo Cookbook, and The Alternative Autoimmune Cookbook - delivery within the US only).
  • $500 - Rockstar Recognition - We will be blasting your brand and/or name and expressing our deep appreciation for your contribution on every corner of social media!

When Will We Share the Results?

If we are able to raise the money needed and find suitable participants in time, Dr. Abbott hopes to begin statistical evaluation by the end of this year and make a submission to a peer reviewed journal by early 2019. Given our previous experience with the first AIP study and the nature of this particular study, we expect that the study process from enrollment of participants and the program itself through statistical analysis and publication will take at least one year. As soon as results are published, we will be sharing through a large social media campaign to make sure everyone in our community who contributed sees how things went!

Thank You!

This is an exciting step and we are thrilled to take it with your support! Contributing to research which produces solid, scientific, peer-reviewed data can create stronger collaboration with the conventional medical system and spark the paradigm shift we are all working toward in the AIP movement. Sincerely, thank you!

story:
Let’s make a difference!

In the last several decades, there has been a dramatic rise in behavioral and learning problems in our children. Science and research has proven that nature connection does amazing things to counteract many of these problems such as ADD,ADHD, anxiety, depression, etc.

our goal is to get kids outdoors and connect to their environment! 

We can’t do it without you

 despite the minimalistic approach of nature connection, there are many things that these children will need to make the most of the program. We will be outdoors everyday but we will still be doing many arts and crafts utilizing our natural environment.

 

we will need:

 

crayons, pencils, notebooks, field guides, kids nature story books, backpacks, water bottles, snacks, kids bows and arrows, atlatls, darts, targets, knives (for older kids), plaster, paints, drums, bandannas, totes, shelves, storage area, and many other arts and crafts

The Impact

With your help we can changes these kids lives for the better. They will carry the lessons and the stories for a lifetime. Nature connection has a positive impact of every part of ones life

Other Ways You Can Help

if you’d prefer to donate goods instead of money, please email me at primitivewildernesssurvival@gmail.com

crayons, pencils, notebooks, field guides, kids nature story books, backpacks, water bottles, snacks, kids bows and arrows, atlatls, darts, targets, knives (for older kids), plaster, paints, drums, bandannas, totes, shelves, storage area, and many other arts and crafts

The Impact
With your help we can changes these kids lives for the better. They will carry the lessons and the stories for a lifetime. Nature connection has a positive impact of every part of ones life

Other Ways You Can Help
if you’d prefer to donate goods instead of money, please email me at primitivewildernesssurvival@gmail.com

story:
We studied the market and found out that all hot water bottles and heating pads had the same flaws: the heat release was inefficient, and many of them were wasting water or causing burn injuries due to defective materials damage or electrical heating issues.

 

Our vision was to design more than just a regular heat pack. We wanted to create a warm, huggable companion to be there whenever you need it, and one that would solve the problems of current heaters. Some key aspects were an absolute must: a long-lasting heat release, safety, user friendliness, and a beautiful, high-quality design.

The cover of Heatbag is specially designed for a focused heat release with its clever differentiated sides. It is machine washable, made of recycled foam and a soft jersey fabric.

  • Open side: the one towards the open air has a thick insulating foam layer, preventing temperature loss.
  • Body side: the one towards your body is thin enough to release the heat slowly, preventing you from getting burnt by cold or heat.

 

 

 

After doing extensive research we chose to make the inner core out of clay. The use of this natural material brings multiple advantages. It can be used an unlimited number of times, contributing towards reducing the waste of water. It has a greater thermal inertia, meaning it stays warm or cold for a longer period compared to conventional fillings. It is also cleaner, easier and safer to use, being FDA/CE certified.

 

Heat reduces stress and tension throughout the body, as it increases the blood circulation keeping the muscles functioning properly and providing them with more oxygen and nutrients. Hugs, even short ones, immediately release oxytocin, a hormone associated with happiness and stress relief.

When heat and hugs are combined, both body and mind experience a sense of wellbeing that contributes to better long-term health and balance.

 

During the last months we have been intensely looking for the best materials, textures and combinations to design the beautiful yet functional product that we could not find in the market.

 

Heatbag will be ready for delivery the first two weeks of December, perfect timing for an original (and huggable) gift!

Surely you know someone who's always in need of an extra boost of heat, or who could use a warm companion to relieve the pains and strains of contemporary lifestyle. There is no better gift than taking care of your loved ones!

 

 

 

Join our referral program, spread the word and earn a 10% commission of every dollar you help raise!

 

 

 

 

We are a team of people passionate about design who share a common belief: always put people first. Thus, since 2012, we go out of our way to anticipate problems and offer solutions through products, services and experiences which can help to improve your daily life through Self-Care.

We feel honored that our projects have been featured in some of the most prestigious design, business and lifestyle media in the world.

story:
If every person on earth with HIV stood shoulder-to-shoulder along the equator, they would encircle the globe three times. That is a lot of people with HIV and yet it only includes the known cases.

Currently, there are 37.9 million people living with the HIV condition globally. According to the United Nations UN-AIDS project, as many as 9.4 million are living with HIV and don’t know it.

For many years, the cause of HIV has been magnificently advanced by the LGBTQ community and so much good has been accomplished. We are extremely proud of the work that has been done toward overcoming the stigma of HIV and the encouragement that has been given to all sectors of the population to advance the search for a cure.

HIV equally impacts people of the heterosexual and homosexual populations. In fact, 52 percent of people living with HIV are female. and they are often the most neglected when it comes to community.

In addition, there is no social network addressing the concerns of the HIV community in one place. Enter Plus-Friends, an HIV social network launching in early 2020 addressing community, social issues, and medical concerns in a wholistic approach to living well.

Plus-Friends is the first social network to provide social interaction, education, and entertainment for all men and women over the age of 18.

Our Plus-Friends platform makes it possible to explore life in an environment that is supportive of HIV positive lifestyles.

And Plus-Friends extends the opportunities for everyone living with HIV to communicate on a global basis. We are doing so by providing a safe, confidential, and optimistic atmosphere in which to meet other HIV-positive friends.

Plus-Friends provides a place to share opinions and experiences so that members can make better decisions. In addition, it allows the community to discuss mental health issues, aging with HIV, establish groups with shared interests, set up events, or just hang out.

Our members can explore what they love without fear of rejection, whether it is a love of art or architecture, music or film, pets or people, photography or painting, cooking or dining out, indoor or outdoor activities, and so much more. The opportunities are limitless.

Everything we do at Plus-Friends is about bringing people together and empowering them to be themselves. and to live a more fulfilling and healthy life. We take away the awkwardness of having to conform to the ideas and misconceptions of what it means to have HIV.

We celebrate the unique gifts that each person brings to Plus-Friends and recognize that everyone brings a valuable contribution to this world. We believe in everyone’s right to celebrate life and live well, connect with new people, be supported by friends, and perhaps even discover love.

Our goal is to provide a global community that provides a caring, non-judgmental environment that empowers people to get what everyone wants and deserves in life -- connection, love and support.

Taking the positive and turning it into a plus - that’s the Plus-Friends Social Network

Description of the project. Main features, strengths and differences.

You are opening doors to a more joyful life, better mental health, engaged learning, social interaction, and life-long friendships. Your donations to Plus-Friends add a new dimension to the lives of those living with HIV.

Thanks to your donations, Plus-Friends can effectively reach out to people with HIV who need the support and mentoring of others. Many of our members have been through the trauma of discovering they are HIV-positive, are in treatment and have their viral load suppressed.

Connecting people with HIV to one another allows them to develop friendships without the embarrassment of revealing their status to others. 

Plus-Friends removes the social stigma from HIV within the group and provides a much-needed platform to share knowledge, experiences, provide support, and recommendations.

Our goals are simple but will make a huge impact in the world:

Connect all people with HIV that have access to the internet and a mobile device or computer.

Provide mental health or group support for those who need it.

Bring attention to the issues surrounding aging.

Provide a supportive community for women and a secondary community for mothers living with HIV.

Help those living in isolation by giving them a sense of community.

Plus-Friends is not a medical or organizational site. We have chosen to be a social network to help bring life-affirming activities and friendships to those who are HIV-positive and therefore in need of a community. Our focus is not about being ill -- it is about living well and sharing common interests with friends around the world.

Why is it important Today, thanks to the tremendous advances with medications, people with HIV can expect to live a full life well into their 70s. This is wonderful news, but it also presents some unexpected challenges.

Not so long ago people with HIV did not expect to live a long life nor did they expect to be able to live a normal life such as getting married and having children. Science has made all of this possible. Now life for the HIV community has most of the same expectations of normal life – family, retirement, and goals. This places much more importance on protecting health, fitness, retirement planning, insurance, dating and romance, and all of the same interests that are common in a non-HIV population.

If Treatment Works, then What is the Problem Now?
In 2018, 1.7 million people became newly infected with HIV. This represents a decline in annual new infections of 18% since 2010, a pace that was far too slow to reach the United Nations’ Fast-Track Target of fewer than 500,000 new infections per year by 2020. Therefore, we must find other ways to improve the quality of life for those living with HIV such as reducing isolation, providing for the elderly, and assisting women.

It is vital to remember that HIV is a medical condition, and therefore, in most countries, is protected by privacy laws. Even though Facebook provides groups for HIV, this forum is a public social network, not a private network. As a result, it is open to everyone and does not accommodate the privacy that people seek and require for this condition.

A Close Look at Public Social Networks
While there are closed groups on Facebook, there is a systemic problem with the sharing of information on Facebook that makes many with HIV fearful of participating. Facebook, as you probably know, is under many investigations for breach of privacy and sharing of data. While Plus-Friends will use social media as a way of drawing in new members to have a look at our private social network, we are a completely different platform from Facebook. We have HIV and security as a primary focus for our membership.

In addition, Facebook and other public networks are often a platform for attacks from haters. Plus-Friends provides a place where people can feel comfortable being themselves without the fear of rejection or public humiliation. Our zero-tolerance policy allows us to address issues that might arise and are enforceable by the very fact that we are not a public network.

Why is Isolation and Depression an Issue that Needs to be Addressed?
HIV-infected people have a hard time finding and meeting others like themselves because HIV is shrouded with silence. As a result, these individuals often live in isolation. Plus-Friends will help educate and provide a normal life for people living in the shadows by focusing on living and not on the medical condition.

Plus-Friends also has a public-facing frontend that helps educate all people and encourages the understanding and acceptance of this medical condition. People with HIV want a place to discuss the subject, treatments, learn about new ideas and medical options, discuss medical results, anxiety and other mental health issues without fear of being ostracized. They also desire an opportunity not to have their condition overshadow life and community.

Special Groups for Special People
More than half of the people with HIV that are over the age of 18 are female, and these women have no private area to discuss issues of concern that are unique to women. There are no exact numbers to let us know how many of these women are mothers currently raising children. However, it is clear that there are immeasurable difficulties encountered by these families each day that have no outlet for answers. The same can be said for single fathers with HIV.

Groups are a special focus for Plus-Friends. We recognize that shared interests bring people together around the world. Our goal is to provide a platform that allows individuals to start their own groups dedicated to things they love – from crafting to cooking, coffee to wine, gardening to shopping, and running to dancing. Whatever floats your boat – including boats!

Why Privacy Matters
For people living with HIV, perhaps more than any other physical condition, privacy is critical. For example, in some countries a person could lose their job if they have HIV. Or their HIV condition could cause the group insurance rates at their place of employment to go up. Having HIV could cause harm to the individual in some locations in the world, and could even cause harm to their families.

In any case, HIV is a very private medical condition that should only be shared by choice of the individual who is living with it.

Another critical goal of Plus-Friends is to keep the lives of people with HIV private so that people in all nations can benefit from this network, including those in countries where being gay or HIV positive can lead to arrest, victimization, and even death.

A Plus-Friends Foundation to Give Back
In addition to its social network, Plus-Friends establishes a foundation that will benefit from a percentage of its sponsorship. This will be used to fund important projects for HIV/AIDS charities that are members of Plus-Friends and have applied through the appropriate channels.

Become an Angel of Light

Join our Team of Angels by sponsoring Plus-Friends. When you become a Plus-Friends Angel of Light you help bring HIV out of darkness. Together we are creating a vision of unity and hope for all people living with HIV around the world to believe for a better future.

Without power, there is darkness – literally. But when we combine our unique and diverse talents across the spectrum and diversity of humanity, we ignite a powerful energy. Where there was darkness, there is light. When we all come together, we create the power to change the world. That is the strength of our combined gifts, resources, talents, and unique human qualities.

Like light through a prism, we can appreciate the individual beauty of each color of the rainbow. But when we join them together, behold incredible power to focus shared energy and light vast areas. This energy can help more than 38 million people around the world take charge of their lives.

story:
Short Summary

Hello.

 

My name is Sean P. Gresh and I am a proud member of Valley Masonic Lodge . What we are trying to raise money for is the complete remodel of our lodge Dining and fellowship hall. This area was hit with some incredible flooding in September of last year and we have been trying to raise funds since but can't quite seem to get where we need to.  If we could raise the monies for this renovation, we could have events back at our home lodge rather than relying other places to use their facilities.  

We are trying to raise $50,000. Whether or not we reach this entire goal will not deter us from using these funds for this given project.  We will only use any monies received for this project. Should we fall short of the goal we will put all monies received into the fund we have started for this project.  

All Donations received will help us get one step closer to being able to have our annual Christmas party with Santa Clause and our many breakfasts and dinners that we hold for the community.

Thank you so much for your help.

Respectfully,

 

Sean P. Gresh, JW

story:
What are we doing here?

1 hour (or 60 minutes) of floating is equivalent to 4 hours of deep sleep.  With just that one line of information, we KNOW there isn’t one person who would not benefit from floating.  But just in case you're still not sold, we'll keep going.

The struggle is real!

People are becoming addicted to prescription medications at an astounding rate.  Statistics show about 7 million Americans are abusing them, which is an 80 percent increase within the last decade. It's an epidemic!  What if we told you there is a simple, yet effective way to reduce and possibly eliminate the use of prescribed and OTC medications.

We all struggle or know others that struggle with sleep deprivation, anxiety, and stress from work, school and/or family life, depression, PTSD, headaches, migraines and hypertension,  physical pains within the body, high blood pressure, cardiovascular disease…the list goes on!  If you or anyone you know has previously dealt with or are currently dealing with any physical/mental ongoing pain or even just temporary discomfort, and think to yourselves “I have tried EVERYTHING!”  yet you continue to suffer, we ask – have you ever tried floating?

Hi, I’m Alexis and I’m Ann.  We are the owners of Dakota Float Center and if you’ve made it this far, we want to explain what floating is, and how it benefits everyone. 

Floating takes place in a giant “pod” filled with 12 to 15 inches of water, warmed to body temperature and over 1000lbs of Epsom salt making it the cleanest commercial water you will ever find.  The water in a float pod has a relative density of about 1.25, making it essentially impossible not to float, creating an almost zero gravity environment.  Floating allows your mind and body to become so relaxed that you enter what it called the “Theta” state - which is a deep meditation or rest.  Many float for meditation alone. 

The benefits of Floating are scientifically proven to promote physical and mental recovery, diminish depression, anxiety, fatigue and jet leg.   Floating alleviates stress, symptoms of PTSD, and relieving pain from arthritis and the body.  It also improves mental clarity and alertness, as well as athletic performance and helping to prevent sports injuries.

 

 

 

 

Can we do it?! YES we can!

We need $185,000.00 

It seems like a lot, but with your help, we know this goal is not impossible!    

We'll be using the money brought in during this campaign to help fund the build out, cover Indiegogo fees, creating our book "Float Stories" (which is an available Perk for pre-order), and to cover the expenses of giving out over 2,500 FREE floats to those in need. Essentially, you'll be helping us to open our doors sooner than we could on our own by pre-purchasing,  but remember that EVERY SINGLE DOLLAR helps to cover a float.  Don't let the large amount needed deter you. We can get there, even if it's $5 at a time! No perk purchase is too small and all are very much appreciated! 

You get your choice of perk package(s).

Each perk has been discounted, but are only available at this rate for the duration of the campaign.  Some of which are a savings of up to $50.00!

**Please know - We aren’t asking for hand-outs or donations.  We are using Indiegogo as a platform for getting our information out to those that are beyond our reach.  

Our campaign does not stop at this Indiegogo page. We are actively working within our local community every single day. We will be including all purchases made on our business website, dakotafloat.com, as well as any and all purchases made directly to us while we're out promoting. We will provide updates to this campaign at least once a week to include all of those purchases as well.

** If we exceed our goal.... Every dollar over will be applied towards additional free floats.  As a reminder, these are going to those suffering daily from migraines, chronic pain, rheumatoid arthritis, fibromyalgia, PTSD, insomnia, anxiety, going through chemo... and so much more. 

*We aren't providing a cure for cancer, but we can promise to help alleviate the side effects of the treatment.* 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Risks & Challenges

We will be opening the very first sensory deprivation spa in our city.  We are finding that the community knows about floating (kind of). Those whom we have met with are interested and want to know more. We know that it is a vital part of our job to be active and educate the significance of sensory deprivation therapy. 

 

 

 

 

Market research and competitors analysis 

We've spent years going to float centers out there. We know the key areas that need to be improved upon are, and we are confident our float spa will be the best in the midwest! 

 

 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you just can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

By utilizing the Indiegogo share tools you are helping us "keep it salty".

 

 

 

 

 

Don't take our word for it... Links to studies, articles, and opinions of others. 

http://time.com/floating/

RESEARCH INTO FLOAT THERAPY AND ADDICTIONS

A lot of research has been conducted over the years to determine the effectiveness of flotation rooms in treating addictive disorders. The use of float rooms has increased in recent years as the knowledge and understanding of the underlying processes to addictions has grown.

In his book “The Book of Floating”, Michael Hutchinson shares that

“…both behavioural/cognitive psychologists and neuroscientists now agree that the floatation tank is a powerful tool for overcoming addictions, both by changing addictive behaviour and personality characteristics, and by bringing about rapid and striking changes in human biochemistry”.

https://abettermespa.com/2016/03/18/how-floatin...

https://oceanfloatrooms.com/en/blog-new/115-flo...

https://www.healthcentral.com/article/how-float...

http://ocdtreatmentcentre.com/floatation-sessio...

https://www.naturalstacks.com/blogs/news/778171...

https://www.naturalstacks.com/blogs/news/778171...

http://blogs.discovermagazine.com/crux/2014/04/...

http://www.floattanksolutions.com/product/free-...
story_txt:
What are we doing here?
1 hour (or 60 minutes) of floating is equivalent to 4 hours of deep sleep.  With just that one line of information, we KNOW there isn’t one person who would not benefit from floating.  But just in case you're still not sold, we'll keep going.
The struggle is real!
People are becoming addicted to prescription medications at an astounding rate.  Statistics show about 7 million Americans are abusing them, which is an 80 percent increase within the last decade. It's an epidemic!  What if we told you there is a simple, yet effective way to reduce and possibly eliminate the use of prescribed and OTC medications.
We all struggle or know others that struggle with sleep deprivation, anxiety, and stress from work, school and/or family life, depression, PTSD, headaches, migraines and hypertension,  physical pains within the body, high blood pressure, cardiovascular disease…the list goes on!  If you or anyone you know has previously dealt with or are currently dealing with any physical/mental ongoing pain or even just temporary discomfort, and think to yourselves “I have tried EVERYTHING!”  yet you continue to suffer, we ask – have you ever tried floating?
Hi, I’m Alexis and I’m Ann.  We are the owners of Dakota Float Center and if you’ve made it this far, we want to explain what floating is, and how it benefits everyone. 
Floating takes place in a giant “pod” filled with 12 to 15 inches of water, warmed to body temperature and over 1000lbs of Epsom salt making it the cleanest commercial water you will ever find.  The water in a float pod has a relative density of about 1.25, making it essentially impossible not to float, creating an almost zero gravity environment.  Floating allows your mind and body to become so relaxed that you enter what it called the “Theta” state - which is a deep meditation or rest.  Many float for meditation alone. 
The benefits of Floating are scientifically proven to promote physical and mental recovery, diminish depression, anxiety, fatigue and jet leg.   Floating alleviates stress, symptoms of PTSD, and relieving pain from arthritis and the body.  It also improves mental clarity and alertness, as well as athletic performance and helping to prevent sports injuries.
 
 

 
 
Can we do it?! YES we can!
We need $185,000.00 
It seems like a lot, but with your help, we know this goal is not impossible!    
We'll be using the money brought in during this campaign to help fund the build out, cover Indiegogo fees, creating our book "Float Stories" (which is an available Perk for pre-order), and to cover the expenses of giving out over 2,500 FREE floats to those in need. Essentially, you'll be helping us to open our doors sooner than we could on our own by pre-purchasing,  but remember that EVERY SINGLE DOLLAR helps to cover a float.  Don't let the large amount needed deter you. We can get there, even if it's $5 at a time! No perk purchase is too small and all are very much appreciated! 
You get your choice of perk package(s).
Each perk has been discounted, but are only available at this rate for the duration of the campaign.  Some of which are a savings of up to $50.00!
**Please know - We aren’t asking for hand-outs or donations.  We are using Indiegogo as a platform for getting our information out to those that are beyond our reach.  
Our campaign does not stop at this Indiegogo page. We are actively working within our local community every single day. We will be including all purchases made on our business website, dakotafloat.com, as well as any and all purchases made directly to us while we're out promoting. We will provide updates to this campaign at least once a week to include all of those purchases as well.
** If we exceed our goal.... Every dollar over will be applied towards additional free floats.  As a reminder, these are going to those suffering daily from migraines, chronic pain, rheumatoid arthritis, fibromyalgia, PTSD, insomnia, anxiety, going through chemo... and so much more. 
*We aren't providing a cure for cancer, but we can promise to help alleviate the side effects of the treatment.* 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Risks & Challenges
We will be opening the very first sensory deprivation spa in our city.  We are finding that the community knows about floating (kind of). Those whom we have met with are interested and want to know more. We know that it is a vital part of our job to be active and educate the significance of sensory deprivation therapy. 
 
 
 
 
Market research and competitors analysis 
We've spent years going to float centers out there. We know the key areas that need to be improved upon are, and we are confident our float spa will be the best in the midwest! 

 
 
 
 
Other Ways You Can Help
Maybe you just can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help!
By utilizing the Indiegogo share tools you are helping us "keep it salty".
 
 
 
 
 
Don't take our word for it... Links to studies, articles, and opinions of others. 
http://time.com/floating/
RESEARCH INTO FLOAT THERAPY AND ADDICTIONS
A lot of research has been conducted over the years to determine the effectiveness of flotation rooms in treating addictive disorders. The use of float rooms has increased in recent years as the knowledge and understanding of the underlying processes to addictions has grown.
In his book “The Book of Floating”, Michael Hutchinson shares that
“…both behavioural/cognitive psychologists and neuroscientists now agree that the floatation tank is a powerful tool for overcoming addictions, both by changing addictive behaviour and personality characteristics, and by bringing about rapid and striking changes in human biochemistry”.
https://abettermespa.com/2016/03/18/how-floatin...
https://oceanfloatrooms.com/en/blog-new/115-flo...
https://www.healthcentral.com/article/how-float...
http://ocdtreatmentcentre.com/floatation-sessio...
https://www.naturalstacks.com/blogs/news/778171...
https://www.naturalstacks.com/blogs/news/778171...
http://blogs.discovermagazine.com/crux/2014/04/...
http://www.floattanksolutions.com/product/free-...

story:
My name is Yulimar Z. Cruz and I am a personal trainer from Puerto Rico. I focus in changing people’s life styles by helping others overcome obstacles, tearing down barriers, breaking limits and achieving a mental state where there are no excuses for realizing  personal goals.  Before all these personal objectives and dreams became reality, In 2011, I was surgically intervened for a mass that was found around my breast area. As a consequence of this procedure I suffered significant nerve damage. I became pretty much completely useless, using lots of medications, without the use of my arm and suffering constant, unbearable pain. I drastically gained weight to 195 pounds from the 135 pounds I weight before the operation, all these in less than one year. In 2013, I made the decision to completely change my life. I began seeking information from people that had gone through similar situations and that had gotten results with a lifestyle and nutrition change.  I went against doctors advice because all those medicines and therapies where not getting any positive results.  I changed my eating habits, began doing physical activities and here I am a new person, without pain and without the use of medicines, feeling better than when I was 21 years old. I became a personal trainer to have the knowledge and tools to change other peoples life’s as I had changed mine.

This year I will have the opportunity to be certified as an instructor in a new training tendency that’s getting more and more attention these days. This training program provides great benefit for the body, including more mobility, flexibility, potential, ability, control and neuromuscular communication.  Besides these benefits for the physical well being it can also help with peoples emotional states, because these natural movements stimulate relaxation and are able to significally reduce stress levels and anxiety in very noticeable ways helping others achieve a better quality of life.  

With your contributions I will be traveling to Spain around the middle of November to take part in the Animal Flow Certification 1 Intensive Course.  These funds will be used to cover the course fee, airline tickets, hotel, transportation and other miscellaneous expenditures.
