story:
THE CROWDFUNDING PART OF THIS  CAMPAIGN CLOSED ON 5TH JUNE 2020, RAISING OVER £33K FOR EDUCATION AND AWARENESS FOR ABUSE IN YOGA!!! 

TO BE PART OF THE CAMPAIGN ACTIONS AND FOR FOR CAMPAIGN TOOLS, UPDATES AND MORE PLEASE GO HERE 

www.yonishaktithemovement.com

 

Yoni Shakti:  The Movement

Eradicate abuse of women in yoga: reclaim yoga as a tool for planetary healing and justice.​

Context

THANK YOU to all our backers so far.

Wow!! We are delighted to announce that we surpassed our £18,000 goal and raised £30,775 !! These extra funds will enable us to gift a Curriculum Overhaul Process to 3 Yoga Teacher Trainer Courses (more info coming soon) and to bring on another team member .

What next? The page will remain open for donations with some perks and all further money raised will fund taking this campaign further and wider.

 

In this moment under lockdown, when attention turns within, we are gifted an opportunity to search deep within the shadows of the inner world to discover the values that support us and to meet and heal the harms we have encountered. During this time of challenge, many previous traumas and difficulties resurface, and in seeking to make peace with ourselves we turn for comfort and healing to our heartfelt connection with each other and the earth.

This is the moment to reconnect with our deepest wisdom, and to stand in solidarity, support and connection for all those who seek to live in freedom ...

Endorsement and support

We're hosting this campaign with the endorsement and heartfelt support of our Yoni Shakti network of teachers, as well as:

Josna Pankhania, Project SATYA, Matthew Remski, Laura Doe-Harris of the Yoniversity, Jane Austin, Dr Mark Singleton, Yoli Maya Yeh, Felix Price & Diahanne Love Holder, Ashleigh Freckleton , Dianne Bondy, Melanie Swan of the Sacred Womb, Alexandra Pope, Sjanie Hugo-Wurlitzer of Red School , Jacqueline Hargreaves, Jason Birch, Lucy Arnsby-Wilson DPsych, Laurie Hyland Robertson ..

"I applaud Uma’s response to the abuses revealed in Satyananda yoga.  It is with gratitude that I welcome her campaign to address abuse and oppression in the global and transnational yoga industry."  Dr Josna Pankhania.  Human rights activist and seeker of truth, justice and healing in yoga.

“To me, this evolutionary circle holds everything onto which our humanity, values, and ability to be of service to one another relies — consciousness that has shifted from supremacy and conditional protection to equanimity, justice, and freedom — put into heartfelt practice with the utmost care. In deepest gratitude to all.”  Christie Roe

"I'm all in with my support for the Yoni Shakti Movement. Women need a safe and supportive space to practice yoga free of judgment, bullying and harassment.”  Jane Austin, Founder/Director Mama Tree Prenatal Yoga School. Director of Prenatal and Postnatal Program at Yoga Tree

"Now more than ever it is time to protect all of us against the continued abuses of power towards women. I endorse the goals of Yoni Shakti the Movement and support this campaign."  Dianne Bondy, Author of 'Yoga for Everyone'.

"Uma's work against the abuses of power in yoga is vital and timely. I applaud and support her efforts."
Dr. Mark Singleton, Senior Research Fellow, Hatha Yoga Project, SOAS University of London.

"I am so grateful for you using your voice and privilege to speak out, step up and work towards a world where all sisters are safe and free."  Lucy Arnsby-Wilson, Psychotherapist and Yoga Therapist

"The work of creating safe spaces for all cannot wait, and it's exciting to see what the yoga community can do with a compassionate voice. I wholeheartedly support Yoni Shakti the Movement."  Laurie Hyland Robertson, Editor in Chief, Yoga Therapy Today, and Founder & Director, Whole Yoga & Pilates

 

Campaign 

Imagine a world where all women and girls are free from shame, oppression and abuse, able to live in resonance with the power of their natural rhythmic cycles and in connection with their inner wisdom.  

We want a world where everybody’s sisters and daughters are safe to pursue their spiritual journeys of reconnection free from abuse.  With your help and the help of a global network of millions of yoginis and yogis, we want to help all women to be aware of how to ensure their safety and sovereignty within the often oppressive and disempowering orthodoxy of yoga environments, and to give women the courage to speak out. We intend to dismantle harmful structures and beliefs that create conditions for the abuse of power in yoga teacher-student dynamics. 

This is the central message of Yoni Shakti:  A Woman's Guide to Yoga and Freedom through Yoga and Tantra and and we're pledging all the funds raised from the launch of the revised and updated edition, available here first, to this movement and public awareness and education campaign.

To make this happen we need to spread the word, to educate yoga practitioners, teachers, teacher trainers and studio owners around the globe. We need your help to do that.

Background

Yoni Shakti: A Woman’s Guide to Power and Freedom through Yoga and Tantra was published in 2014. A key section of the first edition was removed prior to printing because author Uma Dinsmore-Tuli’s hard-hitting description of the contemporary Yoga Industrial Complex as a ‘stinking palace floating on a lagoon filled with corpses and shit’ was considered too offensive to publish at that time. 

Sadly, Uma’s censored prediction in that first edition has now been recognised widely to be the truth. The past few years have seen innumerable revelations and investigations of sexual, financial, physical and emotional abuses committed by teachers under the guise of ‘yoga’. There is now hardly a single ashram, school or yoga institution that has not been exposed to be harbouring these harms. The abusive power dynamics common to many individual yoga teachers and gurus have also been reported by brave women who have spoken up, and Uma Dinsmore-Tuli, like lots of other women in yoga, has now heard too many of these stories to keep quiet any longer. She is now fully committed to sharing the evidence presented to her, including the names of teachers and places that she wouldn’t want anybody’s sisters or daughters to go to. Her intention with this campaign is to educate yoga practitioners, teachers and yoga teacher trainers worldwide to call out existing harm and to prevent future abuses of power.

The uncensored and revised new edition of Yoni Shakti includes a practical checklist of warning signals to protect women in yoga, and a new Warning Prologue sharing a number of powerful statements in verse and prose. It also presents a comprehensive list of organisations and individuals that have harmed women and girls under the guise of the spiritual teachings of yoga. Yoni Shakti Updated and Uncensored is available online from May 2020.

About Uma

Uma Dinsmore-Tuli PhD is a writer, visionary, radical yogini, eco-feminist activist and Total Yoga Nidra advocate. Practicing yoga since the age of four, and teaching since 1994, Uma is a yoga therapist certified by the International Association of Yoga Therapists (CIAYT), with special expertise in yoga therapy for women’s health. She is a mother of three, and has written four books on yoga, including the massive and highly influential Yoni Shakti. 

About Team Yoni Shakti

This campaign is run by a committed team of women who are passionately, personally and professionally invested in the goals of the movement.  This team is Uma Dinsmore-Tuli PhD (Founder), Sophie-Jane Mortimer (Campaign Consultant),  Cecilia Allon (Campaign Manager) and Jessica Healy (Campaign Social Media Manager).  This team is supported by an extraordinary global web of allies, yoga teacher trainers, teachers and practitioners.  We are working as an open network, through heartfelt connection, trust and love without a formal hierarchy.  

Why we need YOUR help

The updated and revised new edition of Yoni Shakti includes a comprehensive, practical checklist of 13 Warning Signals that, both protect the safety and sovereignty of women, and empower sisters to spot the potentials for harm within the often oppressive and disempowering orthodoxy of yoga environments.  Also outlined are nine practical, simple and direct Calls to Action that can be taken when abuse is revealed.

Through this campaign, we aim to empower, educate, and resource the Yoni Shakti network of 1000's of women to share the 'Empowerment Kit' of the Womb Yoga Manifesto, the Thirteen Warning Signals of Abuse, the Nine Calls to Action.  Our intention is to reach 1008 yoga teachers, teacher trainings and studios around the globe.  We need YOU to help us reach this goal.

What your contribution will fund

This is what we project the crowd-funding and public awareness campaign will cost for one year. Any funds we raise above and beyond will go to fund further public outreach and campaigning. We will track our progress and give you monthly updates about the success of the public awareness campaign. 

Crowd-funding Campaign Costs

Campaign Management: £1000

Campaign Consultation: £350

Warning Signs, Evidence and Calls to Action PDF design and prep: £500

Book club set up and admin: £1,000

Uma’s teaching and administration costs for campaign events: £2,000 

Gift fulfillment and tech support: £1,000

Contingency and Indiegogo Campaign Fees: £2150

Public Awareness Campaign Costs

Public awareness campaign for yoga practitioners, staff costs for one year: £4,000

Public awareness campaign for yoga teachers, staff costs for one year: £4,000

Promotion and social media campaign for one year: £2,000

 

TOTAL: £18,000
Thank you so much for helping us reach our goal!

THANK YOU to all our backers so far.

Wow!! We are delighted to announce that we surpassed our £18,000 goal and raised £30,775 !! These extra funds will enable us to gift a Curriculum Overhaul Process to 3 Yoga Teacher Trainer Courses (more info coming soon) and to bring on another team member .

What next? The page will remain open for donations with some perks and all further money raised will fund taking this campaign further and wider.

How YOU can be part of this movement

 


 

This is an invitation to join a circle of yoginis and yogis in solidarity.

By donating, you are standing in solidarity with those sisters who have experienced abuse in yoga teaching environments, and committing to take action to raise awareness of the warning signals that help us to identify abusive organisations and individuals. Together we can join up the dots, support the survivors and prevent future suffering.

Through your donation, you will become part of the circle of belonging which is Yoni Shakti: The Movement, and receive a series of supportive, informative emails with gifts and tools to inspire and empower you, as well a chance to gather and rest with those answering the call of this campaign.

Every amount is deeply appreciated and will help us to end future abuse by standing in solidarity with all the survivors, and educating our yoga world so that we can together dismantle harmful systems that harbour abuse against women.

A global network of mobilised yoginis and yogis can crowdfund a public awareness campaign fast and you will each have the opportunity to be part of this campaign, spreading the word in your community and educating yoga practitioners, teachers and teacher trainers. 

Help us to build this campaign fast, and end the abuse of our sisters and daughters.

Join us in Yoni Shakti: The Movement and together we can reveal the truth, honour the survivors, raise awareness and dismantle the structures that harbour these harms. 

How YOU can help

Every time you share this campaign with a friend, you help to grow this movement. Thank you SO much for sharing it with your community:

  • Share it on Facebook
  • Email it to five friends
  • Tweet about it
  • Invite your friends to the Facebook group

 

THANK YOU

We hope you'll support us to fund this Public Awareness and Education Campaign that enables us all to work together to Eradicate Abuse of Women in Yoga and Reclaim Yoga as a Tool for Healing and Justice - this will involve sharing Warning Signals, creating book clubs, distributing of educational materials, support for educators so we can JOIN up the DOTS and ensure our sisters are safe to practice yoga free from abuse.

Your generosity is invaluable, thank you so much!
Uma and the Yoni Shakti Team

info@yonishaktithemovement.com

A global network of mobilised yoginis and yogis can crowdfund a public awareness campaign fast and you will each have the opportunity to be part of this campaign, spreading the word in your community and educating yoga practitioners, teachers and teacher trainers. 
Help us to build this campaign fast, and end the abuse of our sisters and daughters.
Join us in Yoni Shakti: The Movement and together we can reveal the truth, honour the survivors, raise awareness and dismantle the structures that harbour these harms. 
How YOU can help

Every time you share this campaign with a friend, you help to grow this movement. Thank you SO much for sharing it with your community:

Share it on Facebook
Email it to five friends
Tweet about it
Invite your friends to the Facebook group


 
THANK YOU 

We hope you'll support us to fund this Public Awareness and Education Campaign that enables us all to work together to Eradicate Abuse of Women in Yoga and Reclaim Yoga as a Tool for Healing and Justice - this will involve sharing Warning Signals, creating book clubs, distributing of educational materials, support for educators so we can JOIN up the DOTS and ensure our sisters are safe to practice yoga free from abuse.
Your generosity is invaluable, thank you so much!Uma and the Yoni Shakti Team
info@yonishaktithemovement.com

story:
What does Bive do?

Bive (Vive con Bienestar- Bive Foundation) is a social enterprise that facilitates access to high-quality, low-cost, health and dental services to rural coffee growers in Colombia's coffee triangle region. Bive is a leader in addressing the chronic gaps in health and dental services often faced by the vulnerable population in the remote departments of Caldas and Risaraldas, Colombia. 

Que Hace Bive?

Somos un negocio social que facilita y mejora el acceso a servicios para el cuidado de la salud, rápidos, de alta calidad y a un precio acorde a la capacidad de pago de las familias colombianas, con especial enfoque en comunidades vulnerables.

Queremos transformar la manera como se orientan los servicios de salud para las poblaciones de bajos ingresos en Colombia. Bive es un líder en la entrega de los servicios saludables para la población de cafeteros en los regiones rurales en Caldas y Risaraldas, Colombia.

Coffee Smiles

Bive's Sonrisas Cafeteras ("coffee smiles") project seeks to improve the oral health, livelihood, and long-term health of the rural coffee growing community, while eliminating the barriers to oral health services in order to improve the livelihood and productivity of farmers dwelling in rural areas.

Since the start of the Sonrisas Cafeteras project in 2017, Bive has strengthened the oral health of more than 900 rural coffee growers in the Caldas and Risaralda region, with 325 coffee growers receiving dental prosthetics and implants and 756 receiving preventative dental care. 

Our goal of raising $7,500 USD will allow us to provide an additional 140 coffee growers with corrective dental surgery and preventive care (100 farmers with oral prophylaxis and 40 with dental prostheses, respectively). 

Through this initiative, Bive has managed to strengthen the smiles of more than 900 farmers in our region, thus improving their livelihood, productivity, and confidence. Through additional funding, we hope to scale the number of coffee growers served by Sonrisas Cafeteras, and therefore, our social impact. 

Sonrisas Cafeteras:

La meta de Sonrisas Cafeteras es contribuir a la rehabilitación en salud oral (con prótesis dental) en los cafeteros vinculados a las cooperativas de caficultores, eliminando las barreras de acceso a los servicios de salud oral, para mejorar el bienestar de la población rural. 

Desde el comienzo de Sonrisas Cafeteras en 2017, Bive ha fortalecido la salud de más de 900 cafeteros en Caldas y Risaralda,  325 cafeteros han recibido los protesis dentales y 756 han recibido profilaxis oral como tratamiento preventivo.

Nuestro meta de recaudación de fondos nos permite entregar las servicios de rehabilitación oral y  tratamientos preventivos a más de 140 cafeteros (100 cafeteros con servicios preventivo, y 40 con prótesis dentales).

A través de este proyecto, Bive ha logrado  fortalecer las sonrisas de más de 900 cafeteros en nuestro región. Con más fondos, podamos servir más cafeteros, y por lo tanto, crecer nuestro impacto social.  (Nota me parece que éste párrafo se puede omitir porque esta información está repetida)

Why Oral Health?

Many rural Colombian coffee growers and farmers live in poverty (some living on an average of $1.30 dollars a day) and lack access to critical health and dental services due to their geographic isolation and lack of economic resources to dedicate to health services. As a result, the rural population is disproportionately affected by high rates of edentulism (tooth loss and decay in adults) and a lack of educational and preventative services.

Based on national statistics of oral health, "for people over 45 years old in the central Colombian area, including the coffee axis, of 1,000 people, 668 have partial edentulism (tooth loss and decay), 430 are completely edentulous, of which only 322 have accessed the partial and total prosthesis, and 66.8% of people with lost teeth do not have access to oral rehabilitation with dental prosthesis" (IV Report of the ENSAB, 2014).

The consequences of edentulism, or tooth loss negatively impact the digestive health and overall well being of farmers. Edentulism affects "the masticatory function, leading to nutritional consequences and social consequences (social interaction, isolation, shame, anxiety), which affects the quality of life who present this situation, especially when reaching old age"(ENSAB IV, 2014, P.12).

According to a labor official of the Risaralda Coffee Cooperative, "contributing to the masticatory, phonetic, and emotional health improves the quality of life in health and reduces the risk of oral, gastric, emotional, psychological and social and family relations of the coffee growers." Bive believes that providing these dental services is not only critical in improving the health and livelihood of coffee growers, but can be a powerful source of dignity as well. 

Porque los servicios dentales?

El acceso a servicios de rehabilitación oral para las comunidades de bajos ingresos es limitado debido a su costo, que es considerado por el sistema de salud como los procedimientos estéticos, lo que dificulta la inclusión en los beneficios básicos de salud, y debe ser asumido directamente por el usuario. Sin embargo, estos son los tratamientos necesarios para el mejoramiento de la calidad de vida y la disminución de los riesgos de morbilidad a nivel familiar y social.

De acuerdo con la OMS alrededor del 30% de la población mundial con edades comprendidas entre los 65 y los 74 años no tiene dientes naturales, la pérdida de dientes y otras enfermedades orales limitan en la persona afectada la capacidad de morder, masticar, sonreír y hablar, al tiempo que repercuten en su bienestar psicosocial; en adición a esto la población campesina en especial los caficultores, en promedio superan la edad de los 55 años, por lo que dichos dichos prometedores se convierten en el diario vivir de nuestros cafeteros.

A Donation = A smile

Bive seeks $7,500 USD to scale the Sonrisas Cafeteras project to improve the livelihood and long-term health outcomes of over 140 rural coffee growers through the provision of dental prosthetics, corrective surgery, preventative dental care, and oral health education in the 2018 - 2019 year. 

Donación = Una Sonrisa

Bive quiere recaudar los fondos para aumentar el impacto del proyecto Sonrisas Cafeteros con miras de  mejorar el bienestar y salud de los cafeteros a través de la rehabilitación oral con prótesis dentale, el tratamiento preventivo  y la educación sobre la salud oral, durante el año 2018 - 2019.

Sonrisas Cafeteras Coffee Grower Testimonies:

Testimonials: "The Sonrisas Cafetera project has been very important for me because it has allowed me to recover my ability to chewing. Now, people understand me when I speak and I feel very good  because I can smile without a problem" (coffee grower from Samaná, Caldas). 

Testimony: "With the prosthetic that Bive gave me, I can chew well, speak in public, and participate in the programs of the coffee community and smile with confidence" (coffee grower, Cafetero de Mistrató, Risaralda, Caldas).

Testimony: "Thanks to the project Smiles Coffee I can chew well, talk calmly, and my personal appearance changed a lot. Now, with the dental prosthesis that I was given, I can share my smile with family and friends with confidence" (coffee grower, Alto Occidente de Caldas

Los testimonios de los Cafeteros:

Testimonio: “Sonrisas Cafetera has sido muy importante para mi porque me permite  recuperar la habilidad para masticar. Ahora, la gente me entienden cuando hablo, y me siento muy bien porque puedo sonreir sin problema. (cafetero de Samaná, Caldas)

Testimonio:  Con los prótesis que Bive me dio, puedo masticar bien, hablar en público, y participar y sonreír en las programas de la comunidad cafetera con confianza.

Testimonio: “Gracias a Sonrisas Cafeteras, puedo masticar bien, hablar más tranquilamente, y mi apariencia ha cambiado mucha. Ahora con la prótesis puedo compartir mi sonrisa con confianza.”

Other ways that you can help to change a life: 

Support us by sharing our Indiegogo page on social media so we can reach more donors, and therefore, improve the smiles and livelihoods of more of coffee growers.

Otras maneras para ayudar a cambiar una vida:

Apoyanos compartiendo nuestro página de Indieogo en los redes sociales para llegar a más donantes y por lo tanto, mejorar las sonrisas de más cafeteros.

What will happen if we do not achieve the goal?

Don't worry...

If the Sonrisas Cafeteras project is not fully funded, the number of rural coffee growers receiving vital dental services will be reduced. 

If donations exceed the proposed goal, the number of coffee growers who can access oral health care and dental prosthesis is increased!

Helps more coffee growers to smile confidently!

Qué pasaría si no logramos la meta?

Si el proyecto Sonrisas Cafeteras no está financiado en su totalidad, se reducirá el número de cafeteros beneficiados con los servicios de salud oral.

Si las donaciones superan el objetivo propuesto, ¡aumenta la cantidad de cafeteros que pueden acceder a la atención de salud bucal y las prótesis dentales!

¡Ayuda a más cafeteros a sonreír con confianza!

story:
Robert F. Kennedy, Jr.:

“I don’t know anything that is more important than this issue. All of the environmental issues that I have worked on are absolutely critical to the future of our country and planet. But we can’t solve those environmental problems if we don’t have children with functioning brains and good health. We need a generation of kids that are ready to grapple with big problems.”

Join the movement!
Make a tax-deductible donation today!

Research shows that many environmental toxins and poisons are interacting synergistically to damage children’s health—heavy metals, pesticides, vaccines, fluoride, air pollutants, flame retardants, food additives and more. Here are the facts:

  • Over half of America’s children (54%) are chronically ill
  • Autism rates are as high as one in 28 in some states
  • One in six children (15%) has a learning or behavioral disorder
  • One in every 10 American children (11%) have attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD)
  • One in every 13 American children suffer from eczema and food allergies including deadly peanut allergies
  • One in every 8 American children (13%) are in special education
  • Over 15,000 children were diagnosed with cancer last year alone
  • There is an epidemic of autoimmune illnesses like diabetes, rheumatoid arthritis, and psoriasis
  • Many children suffer from debilitating anxiety, Tourette’s and sensory issues
  • American children are 70 percent more likely to die before adulthood with mortality of kids in the US higher than in peer nations since the 1980s. 
  • America’s infant mortality is much higher than in other higher-income countries.

Let the Science Speak

The Science Behind “Generation Sick” and Why We Need Children’s Health Defense:

Here are just a few of the many federal, regulatory and scientific publications supporting that America (and the world) is suffering from the worst childhood chronic disease epidemics we have ever known. 

Pediatric rates of some chronic conditions among the highest in the world. Children’s Health, The Nation’s Wealth: Assessing and Improving Child Health.  “Childhood obesity, diabetes, and asthma rates are among the highest in the world and are increasing rapidly. Intentional and unintentional injuries, mental health disorders, and attention deficit disorder are highly prevalent. The long-term consequences of these disorders are significant, because unhealthy children often become unhealthy adults and the nation cannot thrive if it has large numbers of unhealthy adults.

Over 54% of U.S. children have at least one chronic health condition. An estimated 43% of US children (32 million) currently have at least 1 of 20 chronic health conditions assessed, increasing to 54.1% when overweight, obesity, or being at risk for developmental delays are included; 19.2% (14.2 million) have conditions resulting in a special health care need.

One in every six children today has been diagnosed with a developmental disability such as autism or ADHD. Trends in the Prevalence of Developmental Disabilities in U. S. Children, 1997–2008. Data from the study showed that developmental disabilities (DDs) are common: about 1 in 6 children in the U.S. had a DD in 2006–2008. These data also showed that prevalence of parent-reported DDs has increased 17.1% from 1997 to 2008. 

ADHD Prevalence Rises, but Reasons Remain Unclear. The estimated number of diagnosed cases of attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) increased significantly during the past 20 years, new research shows. The study published online August 31, 2018 in JAMA Network Open analyzed long-term trends in the prevalence of formally diagnosed ADHD cases among US children and adolescents during the past 2 decades. The estimated prevalence of ADHD was 6.1% in 1997-1998 and jumped to 10.2% in 2015-2016. Increasingly, more boys than girls were diagnosed with the disorder. Today, 14% of boys are reported to have ADHD.

Estimated Prevalence of Diagnosed Cases of ADHD in US Children

  1997-1998 2015-2016
Overall 6.1% 10.2%
Boys 9.0% 14.0%
Girls 3.1% 6.3%

American kids are 70 percent more likely to die before adulthood than kids in other rich countries. A new study ranks 20 wealthy countries on childhood deaths. The US comes in last. The research, published in the journal Health Affairs in January, 2018, shows that the United States lags far behind peer countries on child health outcomes. It estimates that, since 1961, America’s poor performance accounts for more than 600,000 excess child deaths - deaths that wouldn’t have happened if these kids were born into other wealthy countries.

A national study reported in 2010 that half of U.S. adolescents had an often severe mental, emotional or behavioral disorder. Our findings document the high prevalence of mental disorders in youth, and specify that just over one in four-to-five adolescents in the general population suffers from disorders that result in severe impairment. Considered with recent estimates indicating that the annual economic burden of mental disorders on the well-being of American youth and their families approaches a quarter of one trillion dollars45, these findings underscore the key public health importance of mental health in American youth. The present data can inform and guide the development of priorities for future research and health policy. 

Everyone has a stake in the quest to restore our children’s health. As children are the keys to our successful future and prosperity, we don’t have a moment, or the health of any child, to lose.

Robert F. Kennedy, Jr. is Chairman of the Children's Health Defense. He was named one of Timemagazine's "Heroes for the Planet." He co-hosts "Ring of Fire" on Air America Radio and is the author of several books including New York Times' bestseller Crimes Against Nature. His leadership helped to spawn 300 Waterkeeper organizations across the globe. Children's Health Defense works aggressively to reduce all sources of neurotoxins, hold those accountable who failed to protect our planet and people from unnecessary exposure, restore health to those who have been harmed and make sure this tragedy never happens again.

Lyn Redwood, R.N., M.S.N. is published in Neurotoxicology, Medical Hypothesis, Molecular Psychiatry and co-authored the landmark paper: “Autism: A Novel Form of Mercury Poisoning” linking the symptoms of autism with excessive exposure to mercury. She is prominently featured in the award-winning book Evidence of Harm. She has testified before Congress about mercury toxicity from vaccines and its links to childhood neurological disorders. Ms. Redwood served on the NIH Interagency Autism Coordinating Committee and the Department of Defense, Autism Spectrum Disorder Research Program.

Laura Bono’s advocacy for children poisoned by neurotoxicants spans over two decades in Congress, NIH and federal agencies. She was a planning committee member and speaker for the IOM Workshop, “Autism and the Environment” and served as community liaison for NIEHS and NIMH research. She is a co-founder and Chairman Emeritus of the National Autism Association, SafeMinds board member and serves as an NIEHS Public Interest Partner. Her son’s heavy metal toxicity was chronicled in the book, Evidence of Harm. 

Our Mission

Our mission is to end the childhood health epidemics by working aggressively to eliminate harmful exposures, hold those responsible accountable, and establish safeguards so this never happens again. 

FAQs

How much of the raise will go towards the cause?

Indiegogo and credit card processors charge a small percentage of donation transactions.  Apart from these service charges, fully 100% of the campaign raise will go towards Children’s Health Defense.

How do I get a tax-deductible receipt?

As Children’s Health Defense is a 501(c)(3) Charitable Organization, your donations are tax-deductible.  

When you make a contribution, you will receive an email confirmation of your donation from Indiegogo.  Tax receipts will be provided to all backers by the Children’s Health Defense financial team after the completion of the campaign.

If celebrities and major donors are already supporting, why should I help?

All of our budget is not covered by major donors. Children’s Health Defense depends on the generous donations from everyone interested in improving the health of all children by working aggressively to eliminate harmful exposures (including those in vaccines), hold those responsible accountable, and establish safeguards so this never happens again. 

I have more questions.  Whom do I ask?

We'll be happy to answer any questions you have about our campaign.  Please contact us.

Thank you so much for your support.

The estimated prevalence of ADHD was 6.1% in 1997-1998 and jumped to 10.2% in 2015-2016. Increasingly, more boys than girls were diagnosed with the disorder. Today, 14% of boys are reported to have ADHD.Estimated Prevalence of Diagnosed Cases of ADHD in US Children

 
1997-1998
2015-2016


Overall
6.1%
10.2%


Boys
9.0%
14.0%


Girls
3.1%
6.3%

American kids are 70 percent more likely to die before adulthood than kids in other rich countries. A new study ranks 20 wealthy countries on childhood deaths. The US comes in last. The research, published in the journal Health Affairs in January, 2018, shows that the United States lags far behind peer countries on child health outcomes. It estimates that, since 1961, America’s poor performance accounts for more than 600,000 excess child deaths - deaths that wouldn’t have happened if these kids were born into other wealthy countries.A national study reported in 2010 that half of U.S. adolescents had an often severe mental, emotional or behavioral disorder. Our findings document the high prevalence of mental disorders in youth, and specify that just over one in four-to-five adolescents in the general population suffers from disorders that result in severe impairment. Considered with recent estimates indicating that the annual economic burden of mental disorders on the well-being of American youth and their families approaches a quarter of one trillion dollars45, these findings underscore the key public health importance of mental health in American youth. The present data can inform and guide the development of priorities for future research and health policy. Everyone has a stake in the quest to restore our children’s health. As children are the keys to our successful future and prosperity, we don’t have a moment, or the health of any child, to lose.Robert F. Kennedy, Jr. is Chairman of the Children's Health Defense. He was named one of Timemagazine's "Heroes for the Planet." He co-hosts "Ring of Fire" on Air America Radio and is the author of several books including New York Times' bestseller Crimes Against Nature. His leadership helped to spawn 300 Waterkeeper organizations across the globe. Children's Health Defense works aggressively to reduce all sources of neurotoxins, hold those accountable who failed to protect our planet and people from unnecessary exposure, restore health to those who have been harmed and make sure this tragedy never happens again.Lyn Redwood, R.N., M.S.N. is published in Neurotoxicology, Medical Hypothesis, Molecular Psychiatry and co-authored the landmark paper: “Autism: A Novel Form of Mercury Poisoning” linking the symptoms of autism with excessive exposure to mercury. She is prominently featured in the award-winning book Evidence of Harm. She has testified before Congress about mercury toxicity from vaccines and its links to childhood neurological disorders. Ms. Redwood served on the NIH Interagency Autism Coordinating Committee and the Department of Defense, Autism Spectrum Disorder Research Program.Laura Bono’s advocacy for children poisoned by neurotoxicants spans over two decades in Congress, NIH and federal agencies. She was a planning committee member and speaker for the IOM Workshop, “Autism and the Environment” and served as community liaison for NIEHS and NIMH research. She is a co-founder and Chairman Emeritus of the National Autism Association, SafeMinds board member and serves as an NIEHS Public Interest Partner. Her son’s heavy metal toxicity was chronicled in the book, Evidence of Harm. Our MissionOur mission is to end the childhood health epidemics by working aggressively to eliminate harmful exposures, hold those responsible accountable, and establish safeguards so this never happens again. FAQsHow much of the raise will go towards the cause?Indiegogo and credit card processors charge a small percentage of donation transactions.  Apart from these service charges, fully 100% of the campaign raise will go towards Children’s Health Defense.How do I get a tax-deductible receipt?As Children’s Health Defense is a 501(c)(3) Charitable Organization, your donations are tax-deductible.  When you make a contribution, you will receive an email confirmation of your donation from Indiegogo.  Tax receipts will be provided to all backers by the Children’s Health Defense financial team after the completion of the campaign.If celebrities and major donors are already supporting, why should I help?All of our budget is not covered by major donors. Children’s Health Defense depends on the generous donations from everyone interested in improving the health of all children by working aggressively to eliminate harmful exposures (including those in vaccines), hold those responsible accountable, and establish safeguards so this never happens again. I have more questions.  Whom do I ask?We'll be happy to answer any questions you have about our campaign.  Please contact us.Thank you so much for your support.

story:
La Ermita - a community space that matters

In July of 2001, I quit my job as a hospital based speech-pathologist to open up my own community wellness center, borrowing $6000 from my parents to launch this venture. I developed and published my own unique "radical inclusion" centered therapy approach and immediately put it into practice, initially focusing on kids with autism spectrum disorders, adults with stroke and other traumatic brain injuries and teen agers who were struggling with depression and anxiety. 

In the fifteen years that followed, I successfully started over 25 different all volunteer outreach programs, was the first non-profit yoga and wellness center in the Pacific Northwest, was the first social justice based yoga organization with a mission of radical inclusion and never sending anyone away for lack of funds, and the first yoga center in the area to focus on truly accessible yoga, for all bodies, for all minds. 

In 2015, with the market saturated in Seattle and the cost of living more than I could sustain running the non-profit, I took the leap to move to the small rural community in Mexico where I had already been planting roots for almost ten years. 

When I arrived in the town in early 2006, I began to ask folks what support they needed for things like depression and anxiety. At that time, as I was still an outsider, I was met with lots of "we don't get depressed here," or "that's an American thing to worry about." But as I continued to cultivate my ties to the community, learning to speak fluent Spanish, beginning to teach English and offer small groups for mindfulness and movement, the community response began to shift. Pretty soon I had lots of people, and particularly women, asking me if I could help them with various physical ailments. But every single time, when they entered into the tiny backyard studio I had built, they immediately began to cry and talk about things like domestic violence, feeling trapped and isolated, alcoholism, the stressors of poverty, and yes, depression and anxiety, 

I kept my reach small for many years, wanting to ensure that I had the right reputation with the community, that I understood - as well as an outsider could - their particular concerns and struggles, and that if I built something bigger it would be embraced and utilized and not seen as simply a "gringo" thing. I continued offering free one on one sessions, and expanded to offering twice weekly free mindfulness groups. I started offering free Bedside Yoga sessions in people's homes to help alleviate suffering and isolation associated with chronic pain - most people here not even able to afford over the counter pain medications. 

After my sister died in October of 2019, I earned a small but significant sum of money for being the executor of her estate. Erin was always so encouraging and proud of everything I did, and in particular admired my capacity and passion for reaching the most vulnerable among us. It only made sense to me then, to invest all of the money I earned from her estate into this place that would also honor her. 

Last year, finally having a bit of start up funding, a secure ground and, more than anything, watching the rapid growth and gentrification of the town, with the most marginalized of the community being further pushed to the margins, I knew I had to do something, especially before someone else did - putting in a "yoga studio" or some other space that would feel inaccessible to my local friends. 
 

The initial purchase of the land was approximately $22K and I have spent an additional $30K + of my own money to get us where we are. But the money has run out. 

  • In order for me to complete the main ground level space, that will include a simple garden, an office/library/welcoming area and a bathroom, I need an additional $25,000. With this part of the project completed, I will be able to open this healing space to the local community at no charge. I will be able to offer workshops, classes and retreats to visitors at a fair price that will help to sustain the work we will do here together.

    Once the ground floor is fully established, I hope to be able to build a second floor that will include a small two bedroom apartment and a therapy room which will then create a 100% self-sustaining model so that I will be able to grow my reach and programs to support the community. 
     
  • I have created several unique perks that I hope you will benefit from. I would love to have you come here and visit, to see and experience this place that you have helped to create, and to know that you have made a real difference in the lives of people who would otherwise never have access to the healing opportunities of La Ermita or a place like it!
     
  • If I do not reach my entire goal, I will continue to build little by little, investing all of my income over the next several years to see the project through to completion. In the meanwhile, I will use the main hall to offer individual therapy, group classes, arts opportunities, mindfulness and meditation groups, and weekly faith services to my local community. I will also use it to offer once monthly "free" thrift shops - asking tourists and "snowbirds" to donate unused or unwanted items to a centralized location for folks who are struggling financially to be able to get simple household items such as towels, sheets, dishes, clothing, books, tools and toys. 


The Impact

  • I have worked in community organizing and outreach and the healing arts, including clinical therapy for all of my professional life. I have a proven track record of making things happen. As I settle into my second half of life, I am becoming increasingly interested in small, personal impact over large programs.

    La Ermita is just that. We will offer free therapy and classes, as well as volunteer programs for people who are home-bound with critical or terminal illnesses and end of life care. We will provide a safe space for women of the community to gather and share and to know their own worth. We will offer a transformative, curative space which will allow people who otherwise don't have the means to even leave the pueblo to be able to experience a feeling of being transported beyond the limitations of poverty and lack of access. We will offer a space where kids can come and learn tools for self-regulation and valuing of self. We will replicate the experience of The Samarya Center, where all people feel invited, welcomed and celebrated. 

    The best part is that you, as a donor, can come here and see it and experience it for yourself, and know that you helped to create this and see with your own eyes the changes you have made in the lives of people who desperately need these opportunities. 
     
  • I have done this before and I can do it again. Please look at my press, the videos about what we accomplished at Samarya, and the short documentaries about the community we built together in Seattle. I have the experience, I have the passion, I have the capacity and I have a solid start.  Now I just need the funds. 

    Please help to make La Ermita a reality.

story:
A Short Summary

  • For those of you that don’t know me, I’m Jordan Williams, a third year Nursing student with FRCC and UNCO. Ever since I began this journey into Nursing, it has been my dream to use my skills to contribute to the care of others, worldwide. Working in the Eco Slum Clinic, in Faridabad, India, I’ll be able to provide access to much needed health assessments, procedures and medications.

What We Need & What You Get

Let’s break it down:

  • I know, I know. $3,500 seems like I’m asking a lot! But, if you contribute, you’ll be funding:
    • The travel to/from India.
    • Housing and meals for the 30 days.
    • My current housing in Colorado.
    • Visa payments.
    • The experience of a lifetime.
  • What you get: The opportunity to help an eager student experience a lifelong dream, and  that your financial gifts will be helping those less fortunate receive necessary medical care.

The Impact

  • The World Health Organization reported in June 2015, that 400 million people don’t have access to essential health services. India itself, with more than 740,000 active doctors at the end of 2014 -- a claimed doctor-patient population ratio of 1:1,674, worse than Vietnam, Algeria and Pakistan -- the shortage of doctors was one of the health-management failures cited by this report of a parliamentary committee on health and family welfare, which presented its findings to both houses of Parliament on March 8, 2016. Providing resources means providing care. Consider me as a resource! With years of health care training under my belt, I can use my knowledge and skills to help physicians take on a larger patient load, gathering pertinent health information from patients and performing procedures within my scope of practice.

Risks & Challenges

  • I’ll face the challenges any student faces when taking time abroad; traveling through foreign territories. By donating, you can help ensure that I have all the necessary travel documents needed to enter/exit India.
  • The other challenge I’ll be facing are hands on testing of my Nursing skills. I have confidence in my abilities and I’ll keep you all up to date as possible throughout my stay there.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please share this campaign! Share on as many different platforms as you please. If you still would like to contribute, but feel uncomfortable making payments through an unfamiliar website, please feel free to contact me personally at:
    • jordan.williams996@gmail.com
    • OR look my up on Facebook at: https://www.facebook.com/jordanelizabeth.williams.3

story:
Zenspace Yoga 

My name is Sydney and I’m an American yoga teacher in France pursuing my entrepreneurial dream of building an innovative yoga studio dedicated to the art of movement, meditation, and well-being in Lyon, France.

 

Who I am

I’ve been living between France and the US for 10 years working as a dancer and aerial artist. During this time, I’ve had the great fortune to be a part of international productions from circus companies and cabarets to operas and festivals.

Following my career as a performing artist, I completed an MBA and began work as a consultant traveling frequently between the US and France. During this tumultuous professional period, I grew increasingly dependent on my yoga practice as a way to cope with stress and ground myself.

I think I can speak for many practitioners when I say that yoga is truly a therapy and it has changed me in many ways; it changed the way that I live and it changed the way that I love.

In 2016, I turned my passion into my life’s purpose. I completed my yoga teacher training and soon after I began teaching. I adore my work and I love helping others discover the joy of yoga.

The Vision

The future space...

 

Why Zenspace

The pillars of a yoga practice encourage us to examine ourselves and focus our minds on movement, breathing, and meditation.

The meditative aspect of yoga is life-changing and demands the right environment. That’s why I am creating a modern and inspired space that allows for meditative transformation.

The interior design remains simple and spacious with concrete walls and flooring and marble tiling while offering warmth with a custom-built heated floor, indirect lighting, and decorative accents. 

Heated flooring to keep the yogis warm and practicing safely :)

 

Focus on design, living local, and good vibes

I strongly believe in living local and supporting my community. That's why I have decided to work with local artisans for all of the interior design work.

From draperies by Anne Lavit and custom woodwork from Damien Dumas, to the decorative lighting from ROVT, I love to live local and I encourage others to do the same!

 

The Space 

I'm an avid design enthusiast and enjoy tackling renovation projects with my husband Mikaël whose talent and passion for renovation exceeds all expectations.

I believe that form follows function and I love design which is simple and spacious allowing the physical surrounding to influence our mindset.

 

All the family pitching in, Go Team Martinie !

 

 

The Community

I will be teaching yoga, barre, and aerial yoga daily along with an amazing team of teachers and an incredibly supportive network of friends and faithful students.

The real heart of a studio is the community. I am thrilled to play an active part in my quartier of the 7th arrondissement with the suport of local officials and associations.

 

What we need

Starting a business is expensive, that's no surprise!

I've put attention on the design and ambiance of the space (quality yoga materials from Chin Mudra, local artisans for the interior design, good sound equipment, great ambiance lighting) and combined with the talent of the teaching staff and an excellent location, I feel confident that it's a recipe for sucess. I hope to grow the Zenspace concept in years to offer teacher trainings and franchising opportunities.

You can see in the detailed description what I am currently financing to launch and what I will need to continue operation in my first months of activity.

I have taken out a business loan to cover the startup expenses that total about €30,000 :

  • Tech (Computer/Ipad/Iphone) €1250
  • 3D images €520
  • 30 Yoga Mats €730
  • 30 Bolsters €1000
  • 60 Blocks €360
  • 30 Straps €210
  • 30 Meditation cushions €750
  • 30 Blankets €300
  • 60 Towels €180
  • 12 aerial hamacs €1100
  • Suspended lighting (local artisan) €1000
  • Linen draperies (local artisan) €4500
  • Custom woodwork (local artisan) €2600
  • Fans €560
  • Cleaning supplies €200
  • Plants/deco €500
  • Desk (local artisan) €500
  • Sound system €4040
  • Signage €2300
  • Washer/Dryer €800
  • Marketing materials (flyer/posters) €1500

I would greatly appreciate your help covering the first month of operation.

My estimated monthly expenses are €5,700 as detailed below:

  • Rent €2100
  • Loan reimbursement €500
  • Teacher’s salaries (24h/month) €1200
  • Electricity €600
  • Utilities €50
  • Insurance €50
  • Accounting €140
  • Events promotion (design) €200
  • Events promotion (materials) €200
  • MindbodyOnline (reservations) €90
  • Webmarketing services €300
  • Cleaning/maintenance €200
  • Internet/wifi €50

 

Get involved with perks!

Voila some of the perks I'm offering for supporters who are near and for those who are far away (hi friends and family back home):

  • €20 euros = 2 classes of your choice
  • €50 euros = 1h Essential Oils private with Sylwia
  • €50 euros = T-shirt with our lovely logo
  • €100 euros = Good Karma Angel Donation
  • €1000 euros = Good Karma for Life Angel Donation

I mean, Good Karma for the rest of your life? What a bargain!!

Any donation or share is, of course, greatly appreciated.  If you can come visit the studio, I’m more than happy to take you on a tour of my lovely city.

I’m thrilled to share my passion for yoga and movement and would love to meet you on the mat.

Sincere thanks for your support,

Namaste!

 

Pour les Français...

Le projet

Zenspace est un nouveau studio de yoga à Lyon qui vous accueille 7 jours sur 7.
Zenspace est une lieu dédié à l’art du mouvement, de la méditation, et du bien-être. Le studio est optimisé pour la pratique physique et spirituelle du yoga, barre, et yoga aérien.
Déconnectez-vous du quotidien et repartez la tête apaisée, le corps vif, et l’esprit zen.

Qui Je Suis

Je suis américaine, en France depuis 10 ans. Je poursuis mon rêve d'ouvrir un studio de yoga innovant sur Lyon, ma ville adoptive. J’ai travaillé en tant que danseuse et artiste de cirque professionnelle, période où j’ai découvert la pratique des mouvements aériens.

Puis j’ai validé un MBA à l’EM Lyon pour me destiner au commerce entre les Etats-Unis et la France. Tout le long de cette vie entre les deux continents, le yoga m’a accompagné et m'a permis de me reconnecter avec moi-même.

En 2016, je décide de réaliser mon rêve, devenir professeure de yoga et d'ouvrir un espace. Ma promesse, plus qu’un lieu, Zenspace est une expérience.

Pourquoi Zenspace?

L’aspect méditatif du yoga est primordial et demande une atmosphère propice pour s'épanouir. C’est pour ça que je crée un espace moderne, épuré, et inspiré pour donner cette opportunité aux autres.

L’architecture intérieure reste simple et spacieuse avec les murs en béton, le sol chauffé pour les corps qui seront en mode relaxation, le carrelage en marbre, et la lumière chaude et tamisée.

Militante pour la vie locale ou “living local”, l'aménagement d'intérieur a été réalisé par des artisans locaux; les tissus en lin, les bancs en hêtre, les étagères en bois, et les suspentes lumineuses. 

La Rénovation

Je suis très enthousiaste sur le monde du design et la philosophie autour du minimalisme codifiée par l'architecte Frank Lloyd Wright. J’adore les projets de rénovation que j’ai pu entreprendre avec mon mari, qui a lui-même, un grand talent pour la rénovation.

La forme suit la fonction et les intérieurs doivent influencer notre esprit et notre façon de penser. C’est pour ça que j’aime les intérieurs qui sont spacieux, épurés, et simples.

Ce projet demande beaucoup de travail ! Nous sommes très heureux de pouvoir révéler cet ouvrage a la fin du mois de juin...

Community

Mis à part l'espace, le vrai cœur d’un studio de yoga est sa communauté. Je suis très heureuse de jouer un rôle actif dans ma communauté et dans mon quartier du 7ème arrondissement, et j'apprécie le soutien des élus et celui des associations.

Je serai accompagnée par une équipe extraordinaire composée des professeures talentueuses et un network incroyable de copains, de la famille, et des élèves.

Le besoin

Le projet a été financé par un emprunt à la BNP Paribas.

Je serai honorée d’avoir votre participation pour aider à financer le premier mois pour un montant de €5,700 euros.

Les partages sur les réseaux sont également très appréciés !

N'hésitez pas à me rendre visite au studio si vous êtes sur Lyon, je serai ravie de vous faire découvrir mon studio et mon quartier.

Je suis très contente de partager ma passion pour le yoga et je vous attends avec impatience sur le tapis !

Mes remerciements très sincères,

Namaste

Zenspace Yoga My name is Sydney and I’m an American yoga teacher in France pursuing my entrepreneurial dream of building an innovative yoga studio dedicated to the art of movement, meditation, and well-being in Lyon, France. Who I amI’ve been living between France and the US for 10 years working as a dancer and aerial artist. During this time, I’ve had the great fortune to be a part of international productions from circus companies and cabarets to operas and festivals.Following my career as a performing artist, I completed an MBA and began work as a consultant traveling frequently between the US and France. During this tumultuous professional period, I grew increasingly dependent on my yoga practice as a way to cope with stress and ground myself.I think I can speak for many practitioners when I say that yoga is truly a therapy and it has changed me in many ways; it changed the way that I live and it changed the way that I love.In 2016, I turned my passion into my life’s purpose. I completed my yoga teacher training and soon after I began teaching. I adore my work and I love helping others discover the joy of yoga.The VisionThe future space... Why ZenspaceThe pillars of a yoga practice encourage us to examine ourselves and focus our minds on movement, breathing, and meditation.The meditative aspect of yoga is life-changing and demands the right environment. That’s why I am creating a modern and inspired space that allows for meditative transformation.The interior design remains simple and spacious with concrete walls and flooring and marble tiling while offering warmth with a custom-built heated floor, indirect lighting, and decorative accents. Heated flooring to keep the yogis warm and practicing safely :) Focus on design, living local, and good vibesI strongly believe in living local and supporting my community. That's why I have decided to work with local artisans for all of the interior design work.From draperies by Anne Lavit and custom woodwork from Damien Dumas, to the decorative lighting from ROVT, I love to live local and I encourage others to do the same! The Space I'm an avid design enthusiast and enjoy tackling renovation projects with my husband Mikaël whose talent and passion for renovation exceeds all expectations.I believe that form follows function and I love design which is simple and spacious allowing the physical surrounding to influence our mindset. All the family pitching in, Go Team Martinie !  The CommunityI will be teaching yoga, barre, and aerial yoga daily along with an amazing team of teachers and an incredibly supportive network of friends and faithful students.The real heart of a studio is the community. I am thrilled to play an active part in my quartier of the 7th arrondissement with the suport of local officials and associations. What we needStarting a business is expensive, that's no surprise!I've put attention on the design and ambiance of the space (quality yoga materials from Chin Mudra, local artisans for the interior design, good sound equipment, great ambiance lighting) and combined with the talent of the teaching staff and an excellent location, I feel confident that it's a recipe for sucess. I hope to grow the Zenspace concept in years to offer teacher trainings and franchising opportunities.You can see in the detailed description what I am currently financing to launch and what I will need to continue operation in my first months of activity.I have taken out a business loan to cover the startup expenses that total about €30,000 :
Tech (Computer/Ipad/Iphone) €1250
3D images €520
30 Yoga Mats €730
30 Bolsters €1000
60 Blocks €360
30 Straps €210
30 Meditation cushions €750
30 Blankets €300
60 Towels €180
12 aerial hamacs €1100
Suspended lighting (local artisan) €1000
Linen draperies (local artisan) €4500
Custom woodwork (local artisan) €2600
Fans €560
Cleaning supplies €200
Plants/deco €500
Desk (local artisan) €500
Sound system €4040
Signage €2300
Washer/Dryer €800
Marketing materials (flyer/posters) €1500
I would greatly appreciate your help covering the first month of operation.My estimated monthly expenses are €5,700 as detailed below:
Rent €2100
Loan reimbursement €500
Teacher’s salaries (24h/month) €1200
Electricity €600
Utilities €50
Insurance €50
Accounting €140
Events promotion (design) €200
Events promotion (materials) €200
MindbodyOnline (reservations) €90
Webmarketing services €300
Cleaning/maintenance €200
Internet/wifi €50
 Get involved with perks!Voila some of the perks I'm offering for supporters who are near and for those who are far away (hi friends and family back home):
€20 euros = 2 classes of your choice
€50 euros = 1h Essential Oils private with Sylwia
€50 euros = T-shirt with our lovely logo
€100 euros = Good Karma Angel Donation
€1000 euros = Good Karma for Life Angel Donation
I mean, Good Karma for the rest of your life? What a bargain!!Any donation or share is, of course, greatly appreciated.  If you can come visit the studio, I’m more than happy to take you on a tour of my lovely city.I’m thrilled to share my passion for yoga and movement and would love to meet you on the mat.Sincere thanks for your support,Namaste! Pour les Français...Le projetZenspace est un nouveau studio de yoga à Lyon qui vous accueille 7 jours sur 7.Zenspace est une lieu dédié à l’art du mouvement, de la méditation, et du bien-être. Le studio est optimisé pour la pratique physique et spirituelle du yoga, barre, et yoga aérien.Déconnectez-vous du quotidien et repartez la tête apaisée, le corps vif, et l’esprit zen.Qui Je SuisJe suis américaine, en France depuis 10 ans. Je poursuis mon rêve d'ouvrir un studio de yoga innovant sur Lyon, ma ville adoptive. J’ai travaillé en tant que danseuse et artiste de cirque professionnelle, période où j’ai découvert la pratique des mouvements aériens.Puis j’ai validé un MBA à l’EM Lyon pour me destiner au commerce entre les Etats-Unis et la France. Tout le long de cette vie entre les deux continents, le yoga m’a accompagné et m'a permis de me reconnecter avec moi-même.En 2016, je décide de réaliser mon rêve, devenir professeure de yoga et d'ouvrir un espace. Ma promesse, plus qu’un lieu, Zenspace est une expérience.Pourquoi Zenspace?L’aspect méditatif du yoga est primordial et demande une atmosphère propice pour s'épanouir. C’est pour ça que je crée un espace moderne, épuré, et inspiré pour donner cette opportunité aux autres.L’architecture intérieure reste simple et spacieuse avec les murs en béton, le sol chauffé pour les corps qui seront en mode relaxation, le carrelage en marbre, et la lumière chaude et tamisée.Militante pour la vie locale ou “living local”, l'aménagement d'intérieur a été réalisé par des artisans locaux; les tissus en lin, les bancs en hêtre, les étagères en bois, et les suspentes lumineuses. La RénovationJe suis très enthousiaste sur le monde du design et la philosophie autour du minimalisme codifiée par l'architecte Frank Lloyd Wright. J’adore les projets de rénovation que j’ai pu entreprendre avec mon mari, qui a lui-même, un grand talent pour la rénovation.La forme suit la fonction et les intérieurs doivent influencer notre esprit et notre façon de penser. C’est pour ça que j’aime les intérieurs qui sont spacieux, épurés, et simples.Ce projet demande beaucoup de travail ! Nous sommes très heureux de pouvoir révéler cet ouvrage a la fin du mois de juin...CommunityMis à part l'espace, le vrai cœur d’un studio de yoga est sa communauté. Je suis très heureuse de jouer un rôle actif dans ma communauté et dans mon quartier du 7ème arrondissement, et j'apprécie le soutien des élus et celui des associations.Je serai accompagnée par une équipe extraordinaire composée des professeures talentueuses et un network incroyable de copains, de la famille, et des élèves.Le besoinLe projet a été financé par un emprunt à la BNP Paribas.Je serai honorée d’avoir votre participation pour aider à financer le premier mois pour un montant de €5,700 euros.Les partages sur les réseaux sont également très appréciés !N'hésitez pas à me rendre visite au studio si vous êtes sur Lyon, je serai ravie de vous faire découvrir mon studio et mon quartier.Je suis très contente de partager ma passion pour le yoga et je vous attends avec impatience sur le tapis !Mes remerciements très sincères,Namaste

story:
"A mystical music that moves one to journey through both the deep joy and sorrows of the Soul." - Grace Cathedral, San Francisco, CA

Gabriel Gold is a pioneer of the Handpan, a steel, melodic percussion instrument he plays in accompaniment to his trademark, wordless, countertenor-ranged vocals; his works drawing from personal pilgrimages to sacred spaces across the globe. www.gabrielgoldmusic.com 

Sam Jackson is a masterful Crystal Bowls player and founding musician of Grace Cathedral’s “Yoga on the Labyrinth”, his melodic approach to Crystal Bowls uniting the world of composition with the intuitive space of music for healing. www.vibrantstillness.com

To us, performance, meditation, and exploring the healing nature of music are all entwined as a form of spiritual practice, a means of interacting and communing with unseen worlds and sacred spaces.  This album was born from a conversation between ourselves and the space and spirit of Grace Cathedral, forming a work which we hope succeeds at gracefully sharing the wisdom and beauty of that conversation's depths.

We met in 2012, both of us having been booked to play music in the same time-slot at an Acro-Yoga event and decided to play together, planting a seed that would through time grow into the upcoming, collaborative album which we are excited to be sharing with you.

Since that fateful day we have performed regularly together throughout the San Francisco Bay Area, most consistently as on-going resident musicians for Grace Cathedral’s “Yoga on the Labyrinth” and “Labyrinth Walk Concert Series.”, through which, given the meditative nature of these gatherings, our unique sound has organically emerged to enhance, deepen and support these types of practices.

Over the years playing together we dreamed of recording a collaborative album at Grace Cathedral as our sound together has grown from our relationship to the sacred space…

This album is the realization of that dream.

To note; while this album is recorded live at Grace Cathedral, we were able to capture the recording after normal cathedral hours, at a time when the Cathedral was quiet and relatively still... thus giving us the best environment to record the powerful resonance of the Cathedral and create each piece with maximum focus and minimum distraction.

We gratefully acknowledge the support of Grace Cathedral and it’s staff in making this recording possible and are joyously inspired that the recordings on this album will be used to serve and support the Cathedral as well.

That said, In gratitude we are donating 5% of the proceeds made by this IndieGoGo Fundraiser to the Cathedral to donate to a charity of their choice.

Most importantly, THANK YOU for your support by donating to this fundraiser, helping us to continue to walk our path of providing music to support yoga, meditation and healing in the world.

  • Gabriel & Sam

 

PERK DETAILS:

The Album Release Concert will be in the Chapel at Grace Cathedral on Feb 18th at 7:00pm (Intimate space; please be timely to avoid interruption.). For more info, please see: https://gabrielandsamalbumrelease.eventbrite.com

If you purchased “Reserved or VIP Seats” for the concert, please RSVP to us to reserve them for you by sending an e-mail to gabrielsoundhealing@gmail.com

  • “VIP Seats” are reserved seats in the 1st and 2nd rows.
  • “Reserved Seats” are reserved seats in the 3rd and 4th rows.

Downloads of the album purchased will be available to download through our hosting server from March 1st until March 31st. We will send a link to the download page to your specified e-mail address by March 1st.

Physical CD’s of the album purchased include international shipping and will be sent out by March 1st. If you do not receive your CD in the mail by March 28th please contact us by sending an email to: gabrielsoundhealing@gmail.com

If you purchased the “Private House Concert (1hr performance within San Francisco, CA Bay Area, 2017)” Please contact us to book dates and discuss the details by sending an email to: gabrielsoundhealing@gmail.com

 

SPECIAL THANKS TO:

Cheryl Rosenthal, Dijon Bowden and Steve Han for contributing your amazing video and photographic works!

Very Rev. Malcolm Young, Rev. Jude Harmon, Rebecca Nestle, Ramona Draeger, Jeremy Ranharter and Grace Cathedral's other amazing staff and clergy for all your support and for being such warm and welcoming hosts and a heartfelt home in realizing this project! 

Darren Main and Yoga on the Labyrinth for supporting us throughout this collaboration. It's such an honor to work and share in these magical journeys alongside you! Looking forward to see YOTL continue to grow in the impact of it's inspiration and depth of it's message across the globe in the years to come!

Lauren Artress and the Labyrinth Guild for inspiring us to explore our music on a deeply meditative level in collaboration with your heartfelt and graceful work with the Labyrinth. It's an honor to help hold sacred space alongside you.

Ryan Kleeman and Ghost Cat Studios for helping capture and cultivate the musical magic of the moment into something truly timeless! 

And again, to all of our fans! thank you so much for your support! 

May this album be a feather for your wings!

story:
Buy a Quilt Give a Quilt, a company of giving. For every quilt purchased BAQGAQ will donate a quilt to a local homeless shelter. Wherever the quilt is purchase a quilt will be donated to the local homeless shelter if there are no homeless shelters in the area the quilts will go to a church or foodbank to be distributed and donated to those in need. 

Where the company is going... When the company reaches a prime level the company will offer a scholarship to one who has been homeless. Requirements for the scholarship homeless, written essay, (can be a sentence, paragraph or page) where you see yourself in 5 years and a block style quilt design. Submitted by December 31 of given year. One scholarship to be given each year.

Company Description:

Nature of the business is to keep America warm. By giving a quilt to the homeless every time one is purchased.

All orders for quilts will be online. At this time there will be no store front. 

We need donations for material

  • We are in need of $10,000 for material for quilts lots and lots of quilts. Our goal is to give away 200 quilts to homeless shelters this season. with delivery to be before Christmas.
  • For every quilt purchase we will give one quilt to a shelter in the area the quilt was purchased.
  • All funds received no mater how much will all go to material. Every dollar will go to making quilts. 

The Impact

Your contribution will keep someone warm this season.

  • Our project will affect adults and children stay warm all winter.
  • This year through the help of Tabitha's way thrift store more than 100 coats and blankets were given to families in need.
  • With you donation and help we can reach our goal of 200 quilts by Christmas. No one should be cold this season.

Risks & Challenges

The greatest risk and challenge we are facing is not getting enough material for making quilts. My greatest fear is that we will not reach our goal and someone will go to bed cold. 

  • I was homeless once with a child and pregnant, for about 6 months. I understand just how cold it gets at night sleeping in my car. You value every little bit of help when you have nowhere to go and have nothing but what you can carry with you. 
  • Our challenge to find those in need. 

Other Ways You Can Help

For those who can't contribute, but still want to help:

  • If you can not donate please get the word out and share this with everyone you know together we can keep America warm.
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools! And share this with everyone.

Please share this with your friends, family and neighbors. Thank you

story:
We are Happy Jack Yoga, an educational system and yoga school. As a result of navigating through immense adversities Happy Jack created a revolutionary system of yoga for transformation. Our sole purpose is to touch the lives of one billion beautiful souls within a decade. Our scholarship fund Alive to Thrive Foundation is just one of many ways we are chipping away at that goal!

Our world is in dire need of passionate and committed leaders, who understand themselves first and foremost and are able to act from a place of compassion and wisdom. These are the people we graduate. So let's be empowered and committed to be the change we wish to see in this world, because right now the possibility for a bright future is within our grasp. Whether it be in a classroom, a hospital, or an executive boardroom, our system for human growth and development transcends all layers of social order.

Recipients of our scholarships successfully integrate their experience by teaching yoga to individuals recovering from addiction, to cancer patients, to their communities and within the public school system. Their impact is international, spanning North America and Europe! All scholarship recipients also get to complete 15 hours of teaching local community classes as a scholarship requirement. This means our teachers will have completed at minimum 375 hours of community service in 2018 alone!!

 

The truth is that many INCREDIBLE and INSPIRING human beings cannot afford the investment of a Yoga Teacher Training and we recognize that when we make our transformational system more accessible to them, we are creating more positive change than ever before!

Our scholarship recipients are carefully selected based on their financial need and willingness to contribute. Raising $75,000 will allow for us to send 25 students to our programs in the next year. Every dollar YOU contribute goes directly toward their program fees, thus eliminating the major barrier of economic burden, in addition to the impact they will create having completed our training.

 

In the past, our scholarships have been out of pocket expenses, and that limited our ability to support our students. With the Alive to Thrive Foundation we are creating unlimited possibility for sending students through our programs and experiencing the revolutionary Happy Jack Yoga System. Thank you for your generosity and contribution to changing lives!

 

Have you experienced the beautiful reciprocal feeling when you give from the heart? Watch our video and reflect: how would YOU FEEL if your contribution allowed another human being to have such a profound and transformational experience? That feels pretty good, doesn’t it!? Know that EVERY PENNY of your contribution goes directly toward someone’s life changing experience feels even better!

 

Perk Up And Donate:

OUR MOST AWESOME PERKS!

 

Dancing Warrior

  • We have been gifted the opportunity to share this amazing holiday stay at next to no cost! What better way to treat yourself for donating than relaxing in the sand and sun!
  • Only 50 spaces available at entry $150!

 

Humble Warrior

  • Join us! Become a part of our community! 

Try this! 

Host a small gathering in your community to raise funds and join our Perk: 21 Day Program! Learn about "The 7 Forces of Yoga Mastery" a perfect program that is built for community integration!

 

Silver Supporter and Beyond!

  • Receive a personal coaching session with Happy Jack!
  • Jack has received the highest levels of education in yoga, human performance, vocal expression, spirituality, mindfulness and leadership.

  • Please donate, share, and ask friends to do the same :) Use Indiegogo to share! 
  • Share our campaign with your Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter followers
  • Email your friends and PLEASE reach out in your community/circle. 

Ask your company if they would support you in this cause through a Donor Match program. Contact: jack@happyjackyoga.com for more information. Subject Line “ATT Campaign"
