story:
Short Summary

Hello, I'm Dr. Simone Lord, a naturopathic doctor, iridologist and minister who believes that great health can be restored with the proper intake of minerals, sleep, vitamins, good food, water and lifestyle changes. I own a juice bar & health food store called Mother Earth in Queens New York.

We are expanding by building a retreat & spa cabin in the mountains to provide lodging that will help folks that need some time away to get their mind, body & spirit right again. The team includes a licensed masseuse, master herbalist and naturopathic doctor.

We need to raise about $100,000 to put up a rustic 4 bedroom, 2 bathroom log cabin with a vegetable and herbal garden out back.

We have already purchased the land and the log cabin kit, now we need money for labor to erect it and to install plumbing, landscaping and interior work.

 

  • Perks: For a  $3000 donation you and your loved one can enjoy the unique experience of a 5 night stay at a private mountain log cabin. Includes  a couple's massage,  personalized meal plans, pH balancing, iridology and recommended changes as well as minerals/vitamins to restore health. There is hiking, camping, enjoying nature, fishing, nearby amenities include small airplane flying and more.
  • For $1500 you can enjoy the cabin for 5 nights, get naturopathic consultations for 2  and enjoy the peace and quiet and go home refreshed!
  • For $1000 enjoy a 3 night stay at the cabin with  naturopathic consultations for two guests.
  • $700, enjoy 2 nights and a naturopathic consult for two.
  • $500 enjoy a 2 night stay with us. Bring the whole family or health conscious friends.
  • $300 enjoy a naturopathic consult and steam detox therapy  with foot detox.
  • $200 enjoy a massage and naturopathic consult.
  • $100 enjoy the benefits of a natural health naturopathic consult.
  • $25 Get a 10 minute phone natural health consultation.
  • $10 Get the e-book, Beyond Organic- You Shall Live & Not Die.. A Guide to Healing Naturally with Minerals & Diet
Your contribution will improve the quality of life for yourself and  also help others live longer, healthier, happier lives, return to Mother Earth and will make this world a better, happier, healthier world to live in.

 

Even if you are unable to contribute, we are asking you to share this campaign on social media to all the people that you know who are health conscious, want to be healthier and/or love nature. Together we can make a difference in many lives.
story_txt:
Short Summary
Hello, I'm Dr. Simone Lord, a naturopathic doctor, iridologist and minister who believes that great health can be restored with the proper intake of minerals, sleep, vitamins, good food, water and lifestyle changes. I own a juice bar & health food store called Mother Earth in Queens New York.
We are expanding by building a retreat & spa cabin in the mountains to provide lodging that will help folks that need some time away to get their mind, body & spirit right again. The team includes a licensed masseuse, master herbalist and naturopathic doctor.
We need to raise about $100,000 to put up a rustic 4 bedroom, 2 bathroom log cabin with a vegetable and herbal garden out back.
We have already purchased the land and the log cabin kit, now we need money for labor to erect it and to install plumbing, landscaping and interior work.
 

Perks: For a  $3000 donation you and your loved one can enjoy the unique experience of a 5 night stay at a private mountain log cabin. Includes  a couple's massage,  personalized meal plans, pH balancing, iridology and recommended changes as well as minerals/vitamins to restore health. There is hiking, camping, enjoying nature, fishing, nearby amenities include small airplane flying and more.
For $1500 you can enjoy the cabin for 5 nights, get naturopathic consultations for 2  and enjoy the peace and quiet and go home refreshed!
For $1000 enjoy a 3 night stay at the cabin with  naturopathic consultations for two guests.
$700, enjoy 2 nights and a naturopathic consult for two.
$500 enjoy a 2 night stay with us. Bring the whole family or health conscious friends.
$300 enjoy a naturopathic consult and steam detox therapy  with foot detox.
$200 enjoy a massage and naturopathic consult.
$100 enjoy the benefits of a natural health naturopathic consult.
$25 Get a 10 minute phone natural health consultation.
$10 Get the e-book, Beyond Organic- You Shall Live & Not Die.. A Guide to Healing Naturally with Minerals & Diet
Your contribution will improve the quality of life for yourself and  also help others live longer, healthier, happier lives, return to Mother Earth and will make this world a better, happier, healthier world to live in.
 
Even if you are unable to contribute, we are asking you to share this campaign on social media to all the people that you know who are health conscious, want to be healthier and/or love nature. Together we can make a difference in many lives.

story:
This Star Won’t Go Out provides financial assistance and resources to families facing childhood cancer. Everything adds up when a you're missing work and taking care of your child who is in treatment. Direct financial support offers families a way to pay for transportation, mortgages, food, extended time away from work, and other medical costs that aren't covered by insurance.

The funding This Star Won't Go Out provides helps give families time to focus on each other when they need it most.This Indiegogo will help us provide financial support for at least 5 MORE families in 2019! Fans and supporters of TSWGO have donated some amazing perks to this campaign. Every perk you purchase and every donation you make, large or small, will help make a difference for at least 5 families this summer. A difference that will have a lasting impact on their childhood cancer journey.

TSWGO was established in memory of 16-year old Esther Earl, who lived her life to the fullest and left a legacy of love. Read more at TSWGO.org, and learn how your donation gives a family hope, impacts a child’s life, and aids in their cancer treatments. No amount is too small; when we come together everyone benefits.



UPDATE:
 

10 DAYS TO GO

Hello, wonderful TSWGO Family and donors! We wanted to give you an update! with 10 days to go, we currently sit at 17% of our goal to reach $5000. 

We want to say thank you to everyone who has shown their support and purchased a perk during the first week! We truly appreciate it, as it allows us to keep assisting families and fund the amazing ideas of kids, as Esther would have wanted. 

In the final 10 days we are going to be launching even more exclusive items and one amazing opportunity to hang out, via google hangout, with a very special guest.  

We understand that giving money to charity can be difficult when your financials are not as stable as you would want. We want to remind you, if you can't donate you can still show your support by liking our posts and sharing links to our Indiegogo. Helping us get the word out is just as impactful as purchasing a perk. 

Thanks to your support, we're able to give grants to families in need who are living with a childhood cancer diagnosis. As we relieve a portion of their financial burden, it gives them more time to focus on the important things, each other. 

Stay tuned for more updates! Be sure to follow us on Instagram, Twitter, and Facebook for instant updates and sneak peeks! 

As always DFTBA and stay lovely!





 

NOTE: Every single perk is a preorder! We will send them out as they come to us, and we cannot guarantee a specific timeline for any of them, but they will get to you!

story:
Short Summary

We are five students from the University of Tennessee, Knoxville, who have come together through our public writing course to team up with Second Harvest Food Bank of East Tennessee in order to raise $1,000 in donations that will support Second Harvest, a non profit organization, and ultimately bring awareness to hunger in our community. Food insecurity is a prevalent issue in Tennessee, especially for children, with one in six child struggling with hunger.

Second Harvest Food Bank is East Tennessee’s largest hunger relief organization and fights to end hunger in our community. Second Harvest distributes food in 18 counties across East Tennessee and annually distributes more than 21 million pounds of food and grocery products. Due to the devastating effects of Covid-19, the work Second Harvest does is important now more than ever. Second Harvest is in a great need of essential resources to aid our community. Our goal is to raise funds so Second Harvest can continue the great work they do in East Tennessee and combat the problem of hunger during this pandemic.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $1,000 in donations that will directly support Second Harvest, a non profit organization, and ultimately bring awareness to hunger in our community. We strive to be a group with integrity and want to secure your trust in our campaign. By choosing a reliable platform, such as Indiegogo, we can safely assure you that 100% of your donation will go directly to Second Harvest Food Bank of East Tennessee. 

While fundraising for our campaign will help support the work that Second Harvest does, it will also help make it possible for citizens all over East Tennessee, of all ages, to have a meal that they wouldn’t have been able to get. As a way of thanking our donors, our group has reached out to SunSport Restaurant (Knoxville, TN) and received a yummy list of perks! Some examples of our perks include dining at Stefano's Pizza for only $10, one free chips and queso at SunSpot Restaurant, and one entree 50% off when you buy one entree at SunSpot Restaurant!

We hope we can reach our goal of $1,000, but there is always the chance that we won't. In this scenario, how ever much money we have raised in donations will still directly go to Second Harvest Food Bank. No matter if we are under our goal or over our goal, any amount of donations is extremely appreciated during these trying times and will have a positive impact on our community.

 

The Impact

Did you know in 2017, Second Harvest served 181,758 people in East Tennessee alone? Imagine how many people they are serving now during this pandemic!  

As a result of Covid-19, food pantries, including Second Harvest, are serving record numbers of families. In order to keep up with the demand, monetary donations are important now more than ever. “Take a Bite out of Hunger” strives to raise funds for Second Harvest so they can continue with their programs, such as senior outreach or filling school pantries. We want to help those who don’t know when their next meal will be. Through our campaign, you can help us solve this problem in East Tennessee.

While fundraising for our campaign will help support the work that Second Harvest does, it will also help make it possible for citizens all over East Tennessee, of all ages, to have a meal that they wouldn’t have been able to get. For every $1 donated, Second Harvest produces 3 meals! That means if we reach our goal of $1,000, 3,000 meals will be served! Wouldn't you want to be apart of something life changing?

 

Risks & Challenges

It is important to note that in the midst of the Covid-19 pandemic, there are some risks associated with volunteer work and other aspects of the “Take a Bite out of Hunger” campaign. Volunteer work should be done while maintaining proper social distance of 6 feet. Masks should be worn at all times while interacting with other volunteers. If you feel sick or feel you have been potentially exposed to someone with Covid-19, you should choose to stay home. Our group is making sure that during our campaign process, we abide by University and Knox County health policies. This includes making sure we are healthy, socially distanced, and wearing a mask while working with Second Harvest. We also would like to ensure that all donations go directly to Second Harvest Food Bank, and that our donation platform, Indiegogo, is a reliable, trustworthy platform. We strive to be a group with integrity and want to secure your trust in our campaign. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

While “Take a Bite out of Hunger” is doing as much as we can to assist Second Harvest during these trying times, there is always more that can be done. There are multiple other ways you can help. Second Harvest is always taking monetary donations. When you visit Secondharvestetn.org, there is a place to donate. The website walks you through the steps to process your donations directly through Second Harvest’s website, in aid to their Covid-19 relief. Information about their donor privacy policy can also be found on their website.

Second Harvest’s website also provides those looking to help with a tab titled “Act”. This tab provides information about different ways the community can get involved and assist with Second Harvest’s mission. The “Act” tab provides insight about how to initiate involvement through advocating, donating, volunteering, and even attending an event hosted by Second Harvest. During times like these, we understand that monetary donations are not always possible, and we appreciate any form of help, whether you donate, volunteer or simply become an advocate for Second Harvest.

story:
Homes for the Homeless: Zachary Holton, Andrew Sale, Seth Garza, Julia Adams, Sanders Whiteside

 

People Behind Homes for the Homeless

We are students attending the University of Tennessee, Knoxville, and we created a group called Homes for the Homeless. We have a goal in mind to raise $1,000 for the Volunteer Ministry Center to contribute to ending homelessness forever. Everyone in our group of 5 has a soft spot for the homeless people in need, and we believe helping the homeless will benefit everyone.

 

What Exactly is the Volunteer Ministry Center?   

Many homeless shelters help the homeless people by giving them free handouts, but oftentimes this creates a cycle where the homeless people do not want to change. There is a common misconception that all homeless people are lazy and do not care about contributing to society. This simply is not always true. The Volunteer Ministry Center takes a different approach to help the homeless. They help them to get back on their feet and be functioning members of society again. They provide permanent supportive housing, dental care, emergency shelter, and many other things for the homeless. The Volunteer Ministry Center helps the people that are genuinely seeking positive lifestyle changes, and in return, that benefits everyone in the community. It is also essential to keep in mind the Volunteer Ministry Center does not give free handouts. The people being helped have to put forth the effort as well. This is part of the process of turning lives in a positive direction.

 

 

Homelessness in Knoxville

There are over 9,000 people that access homeless services every year in the greater Knoxville area ("Volunteer Ministry Center"). This does not count the people who need help that do not seek it. On a more prominent note, “around 7,467 people in Tennessee experience homelessness every day” (United States Interagency Council on Homelessness). All of these people could be retired veterans, college students, high school students, or even younger children. Remember, homelessness can be caused by a variety of things. Some of these people genuinely need help. We, along with the Volunteer Ministry Center, want to give these people another chance so they can become part of our community once again. 

 

What People Get Wrong About the Homeless

There are many misconceptions about homeless people. Not all of them fall under the stereotypical labels that we associate them with. There are many other reasons for people becoming homeless, reasons other than drugs, alcohol, or pure laziness. It is not always the person’s own doing as well. There are other reasons, such as escaping abuse, inability to afford housing, and health issues (“What Causes Homelessness?”). Getting a job will not always solve homelessness, either. Studies done in Los Angeles on over 50,000 people show around 27% of homeless adults worked full or part-time (“5 Things People Get Wrong About Homelessness”). We, along with the Volunteer Ministry Center, want to help everyone in every situation, but nobody receives free handouts. We make sure all donations go to people who genuinely need help and are willing to put forth the effort to make a change. 

Homelessness does not only negatively affect the people who experience it. This problem can affect  property owners of the community as well. An example of this is given in a New York Times article discussing property tax in Manhattan which states, “The city’s Independent Budget Office looked at sales in Manhattan and estimated that in such a situation, a homeowner would get about 24 to 25 percent less for a house or a condominium than for a residence farther from a shelter with no other shelters nearby,” (“How Homeless Shelters Affect Property Values”). Studies show that as the homeless population increases, the value of the property decreases as a result. Homeless people in front of stores also detract customers from going into the stores making the business lose sales and profit. Homelessness is a serious issue both economically and for humanitarian reasons. 

 

Why Donate and What does it go to?

The donations you send will not just benefit the Volunteer Ministry Center. As stated before, we help the people that need it and who are willing to make a change for the better. Donations help provide things such as permanent housing, dental care, emergency shelter, and assistance for rent.

One of the emergency shelter programs the Volunteer Ministry Center provides is the Foyer. The Foyer has a low-barrier entry and currently provides up to 40 beds to individuals who are homeless with health risks. The specific area that is targeted is a homeless gathering area under the I-40 overpass and Broadway in Knoxville. Keep in mind, certain expectations must be made to be allowed into the Foyer. Every person inside is held to a high standard of living, and everyone is expected to show respect to one another (" THE FOYER"). Donations would greatly benefit the Foyer by expanding its arms out to more people in need and providing more beds.   

Keep in mind all the donations given  provide benefits back to the donor. Helping the homeless benefits the people of the community. Studies show that for every $1 invested in beds for the homeless, $2.70 in net benefits are generated. Also, one bed provided to the homeless can generate, on average, up to $10,800 per year (Providing Housing for Homeless is Cheaper for Society”).  These benefits can slowly add up and trickle down to us, the community, benefits such as potential tax deductions.

 

Other Ways to Give Back

Sending donations is not the only way to help. Anyone can volunteer with the Volunteer Ministry Center.  Although the Volunteer Ministry Center is located in Knoxville, Tennessee, there are many homeless shelters across America sharing the same values. As a team, we are currently helping out the Volunteer Ministry Center, but our goal is much bigger than that. We are trying to spread awareness, inspire others, and help out the homeless all across America. Spreading the word is also another way to help and is just as important as the donations. We need to get our campaign out there to as many people as possible, and you are the perfect way to help!

 

Works Cited

 

“Ending and Preventing Homelessness.”  The Volunteer Ministry Center, https://www.vmcinc.org/.

“Tennessee Homeless Statistics.”  United States Interagency Council on Homelessness.  Web. September 30, 2020. https://www.usich.gov/homelessness-statistics/tn/ .  

“5 Things People Get Wrong About Homelessness.”  Huff Post (U.S. News).  Web.  January 22, 2019.  https://www.huffpost.com/entry/homeless-stereot...

“What Causes Homelessness.”  National Alliance to End Homelessness.  Web.  September 30, 2020.  https://endhomelessness.org/homelessness-in-ame...

“Providing Housing for Homeless is Cheaper and Better for Society.”   Graham Reilly, University of Melbourne.  Web.  March 16, 2017.  https://phys.org/news/2017-03-housing-homeless-...    

“How Homeless Shelters Affect Property Values.” Azi Paybarah, The New York Times.         September 25, 2019. https://www.nytimes.com/2019/09/25/nyregion/nyc...

'THE FOYER".  The Volunteer Ministry Center, https://www.vmcinc.org/the-foyer.

story:
Hi, my name is Rabiah and I’m really excited to tell you all about Bio-Reiki, a healing modality I’ve come up with specifically designed for offices.

Bio-Reiki is a deep assisted meditation that promotes calm, focus and presence.

Bio-Reiki is particularly well suited to creatively demanding work environments such as tech and media offices, film sets, or any place where employees would benefit from a quick, deep reset.

The sessions last between 10-20 minutes and combine both ancient and modern technologies: Reiki (a Japanese stress reduction technique), Binaural Beats (auditory brain entrainment) and an amethyst Bio-Mat (infrared heat technology). 

You can read about all three modalities below. It is the modern technologies that bring me here to Indie Go-Go. I would love to start offering these sessions immediately but I have to build my kit, which include a bio-mat and noise cancelation headphones, as well as a host of other things. You can check out my kit and the costs below.

You may be wondering how I know this works if I don’t yet have a kit. I was able to borrow a Biomat to do a run of test sessions and I was really happy to hear that people were getting the benefits I expected even from a 10-minute session. Everyone used the word "reset" to describe their experience. They reported feeling relaxed and focused which is ideal for any work environment.  I've included a couple of testimonials below.

What is Reiki?

Reiki: Japanese  Rei – Universal Life.  Ki – Energy.

Reiki is a palm healing technique that uses light touch to channel universal life energy, promoting the body’s natural ability to relax and heal itself at all levels of being – physical, emotional, mental and spiritual.

What are Binaural Beats?

Binaural Beats are a type of brainwave entrainment built on the principle that sound effects mood. By introducing particular frequencies, the brain can be entrained to a desired brainwave pattern, i.e. theta, alpha etc. In this instance, the binaural beats stimulate a meditative mind, allowing the listener to drop more quickly and deeply into a relaxed state of being.

A binaural beat is a “phantom frequency” produced by the brain when it experiences two nearly similar but different frequencies, one in each ear, with the use of stereo headphones.

What is a Biomat?

A biomat is an infrared heat mat lined with amethyst stones.

Infrared heat is used in many industries, most notably by NASA for maintaining the cardiovascular health of astronauts on long space missions.  

Infrared heat is capable of penetrating deep into the body. It gently elevates body surface temperature, activating major bodily functions and increasing blood circulation. Lying on an infrared heat mat has many benefits as it reduces inflammation and stress thus improving immune function.

Amethyst is a powerful crystal that is revered for its dual nature. It activates and enhances the creative mind while staving off hyperactivity and compulsiveness. It has a deeply calming effect for clear and focused action. Amethyst is known as the Artist’s Stone, vibrating the energy of success, imagination, intuition and ingenuity. 

A little bit about me:

For the past 20 years I’ve been a costume designer and wardrobe stylist in New York City. I started out in theatre and dance and then I moved on to music videos and film and then on to commercials.  

Over the years, the way that I managed the stress that comes with freelancing in NYC, and also the intensity that comes with working in these highly demanding environments, was to delve deeply into meditation and yoga, and to go to energy healers and body workers.

I’ve sat or served over twenty ten-day silent meditation courses, I’ve gone through a yoga teacher training and I just finished a nine-month course in shamanic practices.

It turns out that what I was initially using as a tool for my own self-preservation has become a gift that I can now offer out to others because over the span of all these years, I was in fact training myself to be a healer.

For the past 3 years I have been offering energy healing sessions while still working as a wardrobe stylist.

 

KIT BUDGET

Any amount raised above my goal will go towards a second Kit. This will allow me and another healer to treat multiple people simultaneously. 

If I don't reach my goal, I will put the money towards a "Starter Kit" and slowly build my full Kit. My first purchase will be a BioMat, the most costly item in my kit. 

  • Indie gogo fees + affiliate fees       $460
  • Biomat - Infrared Heat Mat             $2000
  • Noise Cancellation Headphones   $300
  • i-pod                                                        $200
  • Treatment Table/Bedding               $750
  • Selenite Lamps                                    $200
  • Shungite Eye Mask                             $75
  • Kit Carrying Cases                              $500
  • Website & Marketing                         $1200   
  • Perk supplies                                        $300                  

 

Testimonials

Kassia  (writer, musician)

I had no idea what to expect from my first experience with Bio-Reiki. I'm usually a pretty stress filled, actively mind-chattering person. I've used exercise and work to try to lessen my stress and stream line my competing thoughts but my mind is usually crowded and I'm always looking for ways to focus and feel more calmly productive.
During the session I was told to focus on my breath and return to it whenever I felt distracted. Usually this is a bit difficult for me but I found that the sound immediately put my mind into another place, making my usual chatter much quieter much faster. In the 20 minute session I could feel my body and mind deeply relax but also open up. Unlike a massage, I did not want to simply fall asleep. When I came out of the session I felt that my mind was clear and quiet, available for new information or creative projects. I needed about 10 minutes to absorb the feeling and get back to the world. It was like having a power nap mixed with some kind of therapy that didn't require me to to talk. Great! Afterwards I felt refreshed and also ready to work. I think this would be a particularly helpful thing to do right before having to write or organize something, as I felt awake and calmly focused rather than stressed and cluttered. I would definitely like to continue exploring the benefits of Bio-Reiki both in my personal and work habits.

Zach (audio-engineer)

Rabiah’s Bio-Reiki session was amazing. I went into the session with quite a considerable amount of stress. I’m in the beginning stages of launching a business, and will be leaving a steady job behind in order to do so. I had never tried Reiki before, but Rabiah explained the process and quickly put me at ease. The ambient music and the heated pad relaxed me almost instantaneously, and the energy therapy swept me away from worry. When the session was over, I felt more relaxed and comfortable in my own skin than I have in quite some time. If you’re on the fence, I would highly recommend having a session with Rabiah immediately.

story:
Let's Help Evan Get His Bike Back!

Evan's bike was stolen from inside his apartment building on May 7th. Not only does this suck, but now Evan will most likely have to take the C train to and from work during the Summer. This was also his primary/only source of exercise. Let's chip in some gogobucks (or some real money for you civilians out there) and help Evan get his ride back. 

Perks, Make it Werk! 

We've got SO many exciting perks to choose from! 

  1. $5 - A tweet of appreciation! 
  2. $10-$15 - I'll send you a tweet of appreciation, AND a high five! 
  3. $25 - Evan himself will give you 25 minutes of free and confidential crypto advice #alanacoin
  4. $50 - Evan himself will NOT give you 25 minutes of free and confidential crypto advice
  5. $100 - Fred Durst Karaoke! Get ready to duet the hell out of the musical oeuvre of Limp Bizkit. The deal of a lifetime! 

Thank you!

story:
It’s Time To Tell The Positive Story of Why Mass Participation Events Matter

“Mass Participation Events are at the very core of what it means to be human” *

All of us in the industry know that Mass Participation events create a MASSIVE positive impact but have we told the rest of the world?

MPW is hugely excited to invite you to join a campaign movement to help with the return and continuation of Mass Participation events globally.

Together with industry partners including World Athletics, Professional Triathletes Organisation and award winning Marketing Agency, Cravens, we are creating a digital media kit to help you tell the positive story of MP events in your market:

They are safe and deliver huge positive social, mental and physical wellbeing impact.

What will the kit include?

In early September, we will launch the media kit and campaign globally – It will consist of downloadable assets including videos, infographics, research, images and soundbites from ambassadors. We recognise that every market has different needs and will provide a toolkit for you to choose from.

It is our intention, subject to funding, to translate it into multiple languages.

We need your help. Please take 5 minutes to watch this video and read the image below to learn how you can be part of the movement.

 What will the funds be spent on?

  • Campaign set-up and planning
  • Creative development (inc design and copywriting)
  • Management of campaign production and delivery
  • Filming
  • Video production and editing
  • Website design and build
  • Industry coordination and amplification

 

What will any additional funds will be used for?

  • Translation and customisation to multiple markets
  • Amplification of the campaign on social media

 

Every dollar counts - no contribution is too small.

If you have any questions please do not hesitate to contact me.

Here’s to a new start line which creates massive positive global impact.

Best wishes,

Chris


* With thanks to Peter Burow, Founding Partner, NeouroPower Group, Globally recognised neuroscience and behavioural economics expert

story:
Let me introduce myself...

   I am a Midwest native and have always had an appreciation for the simple things in life. I love all things health and wellness and took that route in college but throughout my twenties I realized I loved business and thinking outside the box for sales and marketing. I've done everything from personal training to nutritional consulting to cooking for a health food store to medical sales. All of my paths have diverged into this one business which combines all my interests in to one. This was not an overnight idea, I have devoted the last year to consulting with business gurus, mobile vehicle professionals and have worked out the details of this mobile salon and am ready to get this business going. I truly believe that this mobile salon will redefine the way working professionals receive all their salon and wellness needs as well as serve as the premier wedding day essential to make any wedding or special occasion fun and memorable. The ideas are endless and I am so excited to see how we can bring the community the first of its kind. Innovation is scary sometimes but its always worth the risk. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $70, 000 to complete this project. With the interest level I've already received from large businesses I wanted to provide a large enough mobile salon that can host two salon stations, a wash bowl station as well as a sitting area, kitchenette, and room for other vendors that would be a part of Copper Canyon. The class A motor home is our best option but is not a cheap project. We will have the unit completely renovated to ergonomically work. Aside from the equipment and renovation is the umbrella licensing I will need to carry to be able to operate in multiple cities and states as well as the commercial license and insurances. 

 

I want to always give more than I get and I looked through hundreds of products that would be enticing to men and women. The majority of people wear ball caps and they are a stylish accessory that make any outfit look better and if you have a bad hair day just cover it up. Hats are great for sporting events, the pool to block sun, and boating.  Our personalized hats will go to each person who donates $30.

My top priority in this business is quality and I have found an aromatherapy line of products that are clean and smell amazing and include shampoo, conditioner, beard balm or heel balm, muscle rub, and toner. The products will come in a travel bag that you can have two options to choose between and will be your favorite travel bag!

For contributions $700 or more will receive their first choice of dates to have Copper Canyon come to their business, neighborhood, wedding, or event and receive free services for their party for the event and any donations over $1000 will receive services once a month for the year at no charge!  

If we do not receive the full amount of funding we will not touch the money but try and explore a traditional loan to pair it with as well as save for an additional year and launch another campaign. Your money will be invested wisely and I will be stretching every dollar that we raise. 

The Impact

While it may just seem like a mobile hair salon, this will be so much for the community. I have already dedicated my time to a gala in October of this year called Taste of Compassion hosted by Mother's Refuge, an organization that provides shelter for young pregnant women who need a safe place to land and flourish who do not have the resources they need. With a mobile unit serving would be so much easier and provide a place that I could simply pull up and have everything I need.

Another service based project that I want to utilize Copper Canyon Mobile Salon for is the Veterans Community Project which builds tiny homes to help homeless veterans get back on their feet in a community where they are supported in finding a job and living safely. I will dedicate my time to bringing the business to their community once a month and giving back in a small way to these men and women who have sacrificed so much for my freedom. A basic hair cut, shave, and massage can go a long way for these people when looking for a job and for their self esteem. 

Copper Canyon is committed to giving back to the community every way we possibly can!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't worry, if you are not in a financial place to contribute you can still help in a massive way by sharing this campaign with your network. If everyone either donates a small amount or shares it I believe it can become a reality but it's not an easy task but I believe we can do it.

story:
Molly's 2016 In Review 

Molly moved to the SF Bay Area in March of 2016 and quickly made an impact on many people's lives and became involved in several communities. Here is a brief summary of some of the special people and communities she's spent her last year with:   

  • Family: She supported her sister Emily through her first childbirth (welcome to the family, Sonoma!)
  • ​Roommate: She became seriously connected to her roommate Shereen
  • School: She met and inspired friends in her Nutrition Program at Bauman College, including Laura and Nate 
  • Dance: She connected with a conscious community of like-minded individuals through nights of dancing, including meeting Yoni and Guido 
  • Tribe: She became an integral part of Carrie and Ryan's  life as she poured love into supporting their family as the nanny to 1yr old Mila

With your support, we can help make Molly's 2017 even sweeter (and steamier)! 

How to make it happen + Perks for you!

  • We're working to raise $1,000 to build Molly a 7'x4'x8' private backyard steam room 
  • Funds will go to building the steam room from the ground up: steam generator, insulation, glass door, entry patio, electrical wiring
  • It'd be great to host you in the steam room! Backers (depending on contribution) will receive an invitation to join Molly for a private steam session, or to invite a friend of yours for a private session together 
  • Backers will also receive a signed photo from Molly post-construction of her and her very own steam room

The impact of your support 

Molly has made a regular practice of going to a steam room at a nearby spa near her Oakland home. With your support, she can destress her city-girl-life and get in tune with herself in the comfort of her own home. 

Spread the word! 

Please help us make this dream a reality for Molly by spreading the word of this campaign. We're so grateful for your support, but mostly for the love and light each of you bring into Molly's life. We are all so blessed to know her.

story:
Divine Source Spiritual Center Needs Funds for Repairs and Renovations! 

I am Reiki Master Willow Le Mechant of the Temple of the Phoenix in New Orleans, Louisiana. I am an Ordained Minister, Intuitive Psychic and Medium. I provide Spiritual Counselling, Clearings, Reiki Classes, Reiki Healings and Officiate Marriages. I have been an Ordained Minister and Reiki Master for 14 years. I have an AA in Business from Purdue University and have successfully operated my own full time spiritual services business in New Orleans, Louisiana for nearly 4 years. I assist clients who are seeking answers about life and their spiritual purpose daily. I am assisted by two other Reiki Masters at the Temple of the Phoenix and soon the Divine Source Spiritual Center, Reiki Master Spogga Hash and Reiki Master Richard Valley.

Spogga Hash follows the Buddhist path and is a very talented and successful musician here in New Orleans. He has a keen business sense and will be a great asset to our spiritual center. He will be helping in organizing music events and continue assisting with our Reiki classes and Healing Circles at the Divine Source Spiritual Center.

Richard Valley is an ordained minister who has been meditating and studying the Dharma for eight years.  He also assists with our Healing Circles and will be assisting us in organizing many events at the Divine Source Spiritual Center when we open in August.

It has been my long time goal to create a Nonprofit spiritual center, a place of healing and enlightenment, for people of all spiritual paths in my community. I started the Temple of the Phoenix in my home in September 2013 to offer Reiki Classes and host Healing Circles twice a month. Since its conception and continuous growth in numbers, our core members Spogga Hash, Richard Valley and I have talked about finding a larger space so that we can offer more to our spiritual community. We have found the PERFECT location in the French Quarter of New Orleans and now the Divine Source Spiritual Center can be born.


What We Need & What You Get

We have found the perfect building but it is in need of repairs and some renovations to get it ready to open by the end of August 2014. The building is 6000 sq.ft. with a large retail space on the first floor that we plan to sell 90% local made spiritual items, art, and jewelry, We will offer Reiki healing sessions, massage by a licensed massage therapist and aromatherapy. We will also offer Intuitive Tarot and Palm readings on our first floor.

The second floor is a large open space that was once used as a jazz club. It has a stage with a grand piano, a full balcony overlooking historical Armstrong Park and Congo Square, and a large rooftop patio area for outside gatherings. We plan to hold Music Events, Reiki classes, Yoga classes, Art Shows, Psychic Fairs, Community Holiday Gatherings, Guided Meditations and also rent out the space to private parties such as weddings, social clubs, and birthdays, etc...

We need to repair lots of drywall, take down 2 walls, replace several doors, repair damaged floors, seal the outside rooftop patio, build 2 healing/massage rooms, renovate 2 bathrooms, install ramps to make it more handicapped   accessible and paint. The labor has been volunteered but we need to buy all of the materials.

  • We are offering a variety of perks in exchange for your support--- The more you can contribute the more value we can offer. Perks range from distance healing, tarot readings, free classes, Reiki sessions, Massages, to full Lifetime Memberships giving discounts on event tickets plus free Reiki sessions and massage. Everyone will also get Good Karma!!!

  • If we do not reach our goal of $7500 we will still put what we receive into materials and keep on looking for other contributors and donations of materials. We will continue to reach deep into our own pockets so that the Divine Source Spiritual Center can become a reality for our community.

  • A surplus in contributions will allow us to finsih more work on the building, purchase tables and chairs for the second floor and make it even more welcoming. It will allow us to offer free classes to those in need and host larger scale events for our community as well.


The Impact

The impact of this venture is not only substantial; it is Tremendous!

  • Our community needs a place of healing and spiritual enlightenment. We need a place where we can gather and have a coming together of spirit with like minded people every day. By contributing to this labor of love, you will help us offer a place of acceptance, spiritual love and growth  to those of many spiritual paths. You will be helping create a place where regardless of your spiritual path, color of your skin, or sexual orientation you will find love, acceptance and healing.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please help us get the word out...tell your friends, share our posts, share this page, use whatever abilities you may have and make some noise about this campaign!

  • Help us open the Divine Source Spiritual Center!

    Help us Spread the Love!


Many Blessings!

Willow
